Project.Name: SAP Activate for SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition (3-system landscape)
Project.Title: SAP Activate for SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition (3-system landscape)

Task.Name: SAP Activate for SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition (3-system landscape)
Task.Notes: This Roadmap is intended to guide the implementation team through the SAP S/4HANA Cloud implementation. It is comprised of Phases, Deliverables, and Tasks in accordance with the SAP Activate methodology. In addition, accelerators are linked to the relevant deliverables and tasks making them easy to consume when they are needed. The Deliverables and Tasks are listed in sequential order based on the activity starting time. However, parallelization might be necessary to expedite the implementation. This roadmap covers the implementation of the core SAP S/4HANA Cloud solution. Projects that include SAP or third-party integrations may alter the procedures. SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition (3-system landscape) See the Content tab for the structure breakdown of this implementation roadmap.View the Getting Started with SAP Roadmap Viewer presentation for roadmap assistance.Read the latest release notes here.Learn more about SAP S/4HANA Cloud Implementation Projects in the SAP S/4HANA Cloud 3-system landscape Onboarding Presentation.Discover how customers leveraged SAP Activate to achieve successful implementations by reading their stories here.Check out our SAP Activate Minute videos through our playlist.Release Date: July 24, 2024

Task.Name: Discover
Task.Notes: The purpose of the Discover phase is to understand the functionality of SAP S/4HANA Cloud and how the solution can bring benefits to the business. Discover Phase Activities: User enablement via the trial system Solution scoping via the SAP Digital Discovery Assessment tool Value discovery By the end of this phase, the implementation scope, overall project timelines and target solution model are set and the implementation project is ready to begin.

Task.Name: Discovery Assessment
Task.Notes: The purpose of this deliverable is to document and capture project scope, through the SAP Digital Discovery, to generate a scoping report. The report will be used as a project scoping reference during the phases of the Implementation. The SAP Digital Discovery is a detailed assessment process that is used in the Discover phase to aid the project scoping process and to help position the customer for a successful implementation. The Digital Discovery Assessment app is used during the SAP Digital Discovery to: Provide clear visibility and insight into the current available capabilities of S/4HANA Cloud Centralize documentation and validation of business scope and integration requirements of SAP and non-SAP solutions within the customer’s landscape Document additional requirements identified in the customer’s landscape Generate a detailed report, that is used to validate integrations and outstanding questions that was captured during the detailed Digital Discovery Assessment workshop. Process Overview: Customer will receive an invitation email to join the SAP Digital Discovery Assessment. A scoping assessment is created for the customer in the Digital Discovery Assessment app which can be edited online before, during, and after the Digital Discovery Assessment workshop. The Account Team provides an enablement session of the Digital Discovery Assessment app. All key stakeholders are invited into the customer’s scoping assessment and can open the Digital Discovery Assessment app via the link provided in the invitation email Customer captures the systems, used in their systems landscape, and selects scope items for each functional area in the app. The customer can ask a question to SAP or take notes per business process in the app as well. Customer adds any additional integration requirements and selects relevant scope items. Generate a report from the Digital Discovery Assessment app that can be handed over to the Implementation team to use as the basis for the scoping of the project.

ExtendedAttribute.Value: GROW Adoption Plan, Hybrid Deployment (Two-Tier ERP)

Task.Name: Executing a SAP Digital Discovery Assessment
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is for all key stakeholders to gain access to the Digital Discovery Assessment app and to capture the customer’s scope. The Account Team and all key stakeholders will use the Digital Discovery Assessment app to capture and continuously discuss the S/4HANA Cloud scoping in a centralized, web based, collaborative approach. Various members of the account team will work with the customer to define relevant business capabilities; identify integrations, and extensibility needed in the customer’s landscape; leverage Q&A sections; capture notes; and document any additional requirements specific to the customer’s journey to SAP S/4HANA Cloud. Prerequisites: Confirmation from an Account Executive that all key stakeholders have been invited to join the Digital Discovery Assessment. Key stakeholders have been enabled on how to use the Digital Discovery Assessment app. Results from the Transformation Navigator and/or a Business Scenario Recommendation (BSR) report have been provided to the Account Executive (AE), if the customer has gone through these assessments. For Retail processes, review Accel ID = S4H_2032. Outcome can be used as an input for this task. Apps Used: Digital Discovery Assessment Procedure: Use the SAP Digital Discovery Registration to self-register for access for the Digital Discovery Assessment app. Use the link in the registration confirmation email to access the Digital Discovery Assessment app. Document current, as is, system landscape in the Digital Discovery Assessment app. Document additional system landscape requirements, to be, system landscape in the Digital Discovery Assessment app. Review all the lines of business and their end-to-end solutions and select all scope items in the end-to-end solutions that meet the customer’s additional requirements. Select the scope item ID and review the scope item description in the SAP Signavio Process Navigator to gain further understanding of the scope item. Validate localizations and languages documented and chosen. Note(s): Links to the SAP Signavio Process Navigator scope items are imbedded in the Digital Discovery Assessment app. However, SAP Signavio Process Navigator can be used to review scope item’s descriptions and business benefits. Within the Digitial Discovery Assessment app, further details about the Integration Suite use case can be found under the SAP Cloud Platform use case in Left Panel. For customer considering SAP S/4HANA Cloud for retail, fashion, and vertical business, request the Accelerated Retail Assessment service from SAP to accelerate the evaluation of industry-specific solutions processes.

ExtendedAttribute.Value: GROW Adoption Plan, Hybrid Deployment (Two-Tier ERP), Industry Cloud Apps, Localization, SAP BTP Apps

Task.Name: Generate SAP Digital Discovery Report
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to generate a report from the Digital Discovery Assessment app after the customer scoping is finalized. The report will be used as the basis for determining project scope during the phases of an implementation project(s). The report details: The percentage of scope items for functional business area selected Individual business capabilities selected Integration and additional requirements captured Questions raised by the customer around scope selected and additional requirements and the corresponding answers from the Account Team Apps Used: Digital Discovery Assessment Procedure: Generate the SAP Digital Discovery report from the Digital Discovery Assessment app. Hand report over to the Implementation team to use as the basis for the scoping of the project. Procedure Note(s): To upload the list of selected scope in Manage Scope app in Cloud ALM with your project, request an export in Excel format. To import the list of selected scope in Define Scope app in SAP Central Business Configuration, request an export in JSON format.

ExtendedAttribute.Value: GROW Adoption Plan, Hybrid Deployment (Two-Tier ERP)

Task.Name: Prepare Discovery Assessment (Partner)
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is for partners to use SAP Digital Discovery Assessment tool to help potential customer identify relevant solution processes with estimated implementation efforts. Procedure: Use SAP Digital Discovery Registration site to get access to SAP Digital Discovery Assessment tool. Login in with existing assigned SAP Universal ID of the partner. Access the Supply Chain of Selling tile to view license requirements, industry, localization information including estimation of efforts for the potential customer. Access the Digital Discovery Assessment tile to collaborate with customer on the selection of business content related scope for line of business and countries that are in scope. Procedure Note(s): Effort Estimation is provided by SAP to give an indication of effort required for the solution processes selected within the Digital Discovery Assessment tool. SAP suggests partner using the estimates as a baseline or foundation only. For complete project estimate, partner should also consider governance, testing, data migration, integrations, change management, number of countries and any other additional customer specific adaptation, extension and integration requirements.

Task.Name: Partner Demonstration Landscape
Task.Notes: The purpose of this deliverable is to request and receive access to the cloud test, demo, and development for SAP S/4HANA Cloud landscape, the SAP Cloud ALM and the SAP Central Business Configuration tenants. Note that SAP Cloud ALM is not available in all countries/regions.

Task.Name: Order Partner Demonstration Landscape
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to order the Cloud test, demo, and development for SAP S/4HANA Cloud landscape. The system provides access to an environment with the following capabilities: A Cloud test, demo, and development for SAP S/4HANA Cloud system with a tenant for customizing and configuration and a tenant for developer extensibility (ABAP environment). Access to an SAP Central Business Configuration tenant to activate and manage business configuration for the Cloud test, demo, and development for SAP S/4HANA Cloud SAP S/4HANA Cloud tenants. Access to an SAP Cloud ALM tenant to manage the entire landscape. The ordering process is offered by the SAP Non-Commercial Licensing. Refer to the SAP Partner Portal - How to Guides & FAQs accelerator. Once the order is complete, partners have access to the entitlement of the Cloud test, demo, and development for SAP S/4HANA Cloud and can start requesting the different tenants included in the landscape. Procedure: Access the SAP Partner Edge Demo Landscape and Click on the "Login" button. If you already have a profile, you don't need to create a new one. A new page will appear asking you to create a profile. Select the necessary options and complete your profile. Follow the instructions in the following onboarding video Accel ID = S4H_1037. Refer to this presentation S/4HANA Cloud Test, Demo and Development - Presentation to follow the process. Review the additional instructions in the Accel ID = S4H_1039.

Task.Name: Initial Access to SAP for Me
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to verify access and log into SAP for Me. In SAP for Me, customers and partners gain transparency and receive important alerts, metrics, and insights about their SAP product portfolio in one place. SAP for Me is a digital companion that helps customers and partners interact easily with SAP and get immediate guidance. SAP for Me is used in subsequent tasks to trigger the provisioning of different tenants and systems and check their status. SAP Cases (support tickets or service requests) can be created directly from SAP for Me. SAP Signavio Process Navigator required to review the SAP Best Practices content related to the scope items is accessible via SAP for Me. Prerequisites: SAP Support user (S-user) is available. Procedure: Access SAP for Me accelerator with the S-User account information received. If your IT contact is known but hasn't received your S-User Email, please check the SPAM email folder. If no emails were found, create an incident/service request. Follow the step via the SAP Note 1296527 - How to create a support case (contact SAP Product Support) - SAP for Me accelerator. Ensure you have access to the Dashboards: Validate access to the Systems & Provisioning Dashboard. Validate access to the Services & Support Dashboard. Validate access to the SAP Signavio Process Navigator or navigate to the Accel ID = S4H_176. Procedure Note(s): You need an SAP S-user ID to access SAP for Me Customer dashboards. Some content and cards require additional authorization. Contact your S-User Admin or Super Admin to get access. For additional questions or feedback about access to SAP for Me, customers can send an email via SAPforMe@sap.com Customers can contact a local SAP Customer Interaction Center via phone, email, or chat for all additional questions or feedback.

Task.Name: Request Cloud test, demo, and development for SAP S/4HANA Cloud
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to request the Cloud test, demo, and development for SAP S/4HANA Cloud system access via the bundled provisioning in SAP for Me. The Initial Admin user makes the request in SAP for Me and will then receive an email with the access instructions. Partners will have the option to request multiple tenants within a single request: SAP Cloud ALM, Central Business Configuration tenants and Cloud test, demo, and development for SAP S/4HANA Cloud system are included in the bundled provisioning. Note that SAP Cloud ALM is not available in all countries/regions. The bundled provisioning request is associated with the Partner Demo Customizing tenant, and the provisioning of the Partner Demo Development is automatically triggered after this. Prerequisite: The Initial Admin user has been identified and has the right authorizations in SAP for Me Procedure: Request the Bundled Provisioning in SAP for Me via Accel ID = S4H_889. Locate the 'Partner Customizing tenant' in the ‘Provisioning’ section under ’Product Available for Provisioning' and click 'Start Provisioning. Select the appropriate dependent products if applicable, review and follow the instructions in the pop-up windows for next steps. Once the appropriate selections have been made and all details reviewed for each tenant, select ‘Submit’. The request will trigger the bundled system provisioning, and an email will be sent to the 'Initial Admin user' when the system/tenants are available. Note: The bundled provisioning request is associated with the Partner Demo Customizing tenant, and the provisioning of the Partner Demo Development is automatically triggered after this. Procedure Note(s): Customers are entitled to use SAP Cloud ALM if they subscribe to an SAP Cloud Service that includes SAP Enterprise Support and cloud editions. Note that SAP Cloud ALM is not available in all countries/regions. For further questions or feedback, please send an email to cloudalm@sap.com. Learn about SAP Cloud ALM by reviewing Help - SAP Cloud ALM or the Self-Enable on SAP Cloud ALM task. Learn more about SAP S/4HANA Cloud Starter system provisioning, including SAP Cloud ALM and SAP Central Business Configuration, via Accel ID = S4H_1051. For additional scenario information related to the required SAP Cloud Identity Services Administration, see the Accel ID = ACT_021. You need an SAP S-user ID to access SAP for Me Partner dashboards. Some content and cards require additional authorization. Contact your S-User Admin or Super Admin to get access.

Task.Name: Access Partner Demonstration Landscape
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to access the Request Cloud test, demo, and development for the SAP S/4HANA Cloud system, the SAP Cloud ALM tenant, and the SAP Central Business Configuration tenant. The System Administrator (or the partner contact) will receive various emails once the provisioning has been made via SAP for Me. Each email will provide a set of instructions and information on how to access the various tenants. Prerequisite: Order Partner Demonstration Landscape Request SAP Cloud ALM Tenant SAP Central Business Configuration provisioned. Procedure: Review the SAP Note 3481049 - SAP S/4HANA Cloud in a 3-system landscape: Release Restriction Note accelerator. Follow the instructions in the Cloud test, demo, and development for SAP S/4HANA Cloud accelerator, in the section below, to access the systems. Procedure Note(s): Partners can develop ABAP Cloud extensions in a Cloud test, demo, and development for SAP S/4HANA Cloud 1-system landscape and provide them to customers SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition (3-system landscape) that is not connected to their current landscape. Refer to task Develop Cloud Extensions. If partners plan to use their namespace, ensure that they have created and installed the namespace as mentioned in Accel ID = S4H_1865.

Task.Name: Develop Cloud Extensions
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to develop ABAP cloud extensions in the Cloud test, demo, and development for SAP S/4HANA Cloud 1-system landscape and deploy them to customers SAP S/4HANA Cloud 3-system target landscape that isn't connected to the 1-system landscape. Using Multi-Off delivery, partners can develop ABAP Cloud extensions and use the Git-Enabled Change and Transport System (gCTS) to deploy them to the customers S/4HANA Cloud landscape. Prerequisite: Received and accessed the Cloud test, demo, and development for SAP S/4HANA Cloud 1-system landscape Read all the prerequisites under ‘General Information’ section from Accel ID = S4H_1853. Procedure: Develop ABAP Cloud extensions by reading and following the step-by-step guide in the Accel ID = S4H_1853. Below is a summary of the activities: General Information and prerequisite before you start developing. Setup for Multi-Off Delivery Develop Cloud extensions Test the Cloud extensions Deliver the Cloud extension Patch and update the Cloud extensions. Troubleshooting Procedure Note(s): If partners plan to use their namespace, ensure that they have created and installed the namespace as mentioned in Accel ID = S4H_1865.

Task.Name: Cloud Trial
Task.Notes: The purpose of this deliverable is to get access to a SAP S/4HANA Cloud Trial system via the cloud trial. As a result, project members have access to the trial system for demoing, value identification, and impact evaluation.

Task.Name: Learn on a SAP S/4HANA Cloud Trial System
Task.Notes: To support the value identification, and the impact evaluation in the Discover phase, it could be beneficial to have access to a trial system. SAP offers the SAP S/4HANA Cloud trial environment for users who want to discover the value of simplicity across concrete roles and predefined processes in finance, project management, and marketing. The trial system is available for limited period of 14 days. Procedure: To start your own trial, access the SAP S/4HANA trial pages via the SAP S/4HANA Cloud Trial accelerator. Users must first register in order to create a trial. If you don’t yet have sap.com account, you will need to create one using your e-mail address and providing information about you and your company. If you already have sap.com account, you may be asked to upgrade your account to access Cloud Appliance Library, which is required for running the trial. Users must also review and agree to Terms and Conditions for the 14-day free trial. The next screen will then provide you with your unique access link to the application and your User ID. Once you have completed registration process, SAP will also send you a confirmation e-mail with your logon details for SAP S/4HANA Cloud Trial. Keep the e-mail safe for the duration of the trial as it provides a unique User ID and application URL to access the trial environment. You are all set to start your trial system.

Task.Name: Cloud Mindset Assessment
Task.Notes: The purpose of this deliverable is to assess user adoption risks levels and review recommendations for risk mitigation. Business software as a service may deliver sustained business value for organizations ready to implement standardized business processes and to adopt periodic product innovation shipments through frequent agile deployment. The deliverable assesses this organizational readiness and suggests action plans commensurate with the identified risk level to ensure sustained business success.

Task.Name: Execute the Cloud Mindset
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to assess organizational readiness for the cloud subscription business model and then use the results to create awareness for organizational change management (OCM) related topics and activities for the business stakeholders. Procedure: Gain insight through the use of the Customer Organizational Readiness for SAP S/4HANA Cloud Whitepaper accelerator. Watch the Cloud Mindset Video accelerator. Read the Cloud Mindset Now Blog accelerator. Review, distribute, and complete the Cloud Mindset Assessment accelerator(s). Review risk level determination value and recommendation for action. Procedure Note(s): Engage with SAP or the implementation partner prior to starting a project to assess OCM initiatives.

Task.Name: Select the Right Cloud Partner
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to find the right SAP Partner for the SAP S/4HANA Cloud implementation. The key to a successful implementation is a partner’s understanding and embracing of SAP Activate for S/4HANA Cloud and a deep solution knowledge in SAP S/4HANA Cloud, proven through a fully certified, dedicated delivery team. Procedure: Review and follow the RISE with SAP S/4HANA Cloud Service Partner Selection Guidance accelerator to get more insight on the process of selecting the right partner for a Cloud-centric implementation. Find the right partner via SAP Partner Finder accelerator. The search tool provides customers with an easy-to-use interface that searches through SAP's directory of thousands of SAP partners, to help them find the best match for their needs.

Task.Name: Application Value and Scoping
Task.Notes: The purpose of this deliverable is to create a strategic roadmap that serves as key input into the customer business case. Furthermore, a first impact analysis may have identified show stoppers or road blocks, which could affect the implementation strategy, and which need to be addressed in additional planning and preparation activities.

ExtendedAttribute.Value: Application Design and Configuration, Extensibility, Integration, Operations and Support
2nd Wave Project / Rollout Project, GROW Adoption Plan, Hybrid Deployment (Two-Tier ERP)

Task.Name: Discover the Value of SAP Business Technology Platform for Your Company
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to become familiar with SAP Business Technology Platform and discover the value it may bring to your company. Procedure Review the Learning Journey - Discovering SAP Business Technology Platform accelerator to explore the SAP Business Technology Platform capabilities, its features and business benefits and understand how you can use the latest technologies and intelligent automation to transform business processes. Refer accelerator Customer Stories - SAP Business Technology Platform to understand how customers have successfully leveraged the capabilities of SAP BTP. Review the Help - SAP Business Technology Platform (SAP BTP) accelerator to get more details on the following: Solutions and Services within SAP BTP Best Practices for SAP BTP What's New for SAP BTP Use Cases and Strategy related whitepaper. Read the ‘The business value of SAP Business Technology Platform’ section within SAP Business Technology Platform to access the following IDC SAP BTP business value whitepaper SAP BTP Business value webcast IDC SAP BTP business value assessment

Task.Name: Perform a Digital Value Discovery Workshop
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to perform a value discovery workshop using an online game like tool that is powerful, interactive and hands-on, to uncover value of SAP solutions in a fun and engaging way. Prerequisites: Your SAP team has created the online, virtual workshop for your company and send you invitation. Procedure: Review the email and accept the workshop invitation to participate in the workshop Each participant can record pain points, strategic priorities for the company from the line of business that she/he represents. Reference the SAP Persona Value Discovery function for samples. Explore vision, strategy, industry trends and analysis for respective industry. Data collected from participants will be transferred to SAP Value Lifecycle Manager tools for Move the Needle, Benchmarking Report, etc. Build own case in modular approach to discover SAP solution capabilities based on Benchmarked Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) and Primary Value Drivers. Review SAP solution capability information to confirm relevancy. Create customer specific Innovation Map for the relevant solution capabilities with rough timeline (i.e. short, medium vs. long term), highlighting your current and future roadmap with clear owners assigned to each capability item. Transfer data to SAP Value Lifecycle Manager to create a business case. Generate a Point of View document that summarizes all the findings from the workshop. Procedure Note(s): Usage of SAP Value Lifecycle Manager tool is required when building own case in Module 1 of the modular approach. SAP Account Executive will be engaged towards the end of the of workshop. Customer can also submit questions to SAP Value Advisory and Solution Advisory during the workshop.

Task.Name: Perform Benchmarking Assessment for Value Baselining
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to perform a business process baseline, with the Line of Business heads, prior to the implementation of SAP S/4HANA Cloud. This analysis will help to determine the scope for the SAP S/4HANA Cloud implementation and prioritize the implementation of the scope. The results from this baseline will be used later in the Run phase to compare and to track the actual improvement in process maturity and key performance indicators. The SAP S/4HANA Benchmarking Assessment includes key business performance metrics and best practices for all process areas covered by SAP S/4HANA, such as: Procurement, Sales, Service, R&D Engineering, Supply Chain, Manufacturing, Asset Management, Finance, Human Resources, and Information Technology. Upon participation, you will receive a personalized scorecard in real-time showcasing the Key Performance Indicator (KPI) analysis and process maturity gap on best practices in comparison to industry peers. Procedure: Review the SAP Performance Benchmarking Assessment - Video Introduction accelerator to become self-enabled on the SAP S/4HANA Benchmarking Assessment. Self-enable on the output of Benchmarking exercise by reviewing the SAP S/4HANA Cloud Benchmarking Assessment – Sample accelerator. Self-enable on how to fill an assessment by reviewing the SAP S/4HANA Cloud Benchmarking Assessment – Tutorial accelerator. Register for the SAP S/4HANA Benchmarking Assessment via the SAP S/4HANA Cloud Benchmarking Assessment Registration accelerator. Fill out the SAP S/4HANA Benchmarking Assessment. Review the SAP S/4HANA Cloud Benchmarking Assessment – Overview accelerator for further step by step information on how to fill out the assessment. Download the results and store in a central location that can be referred to after the implementation. Procedure Notes: For any questions about the SAP S/4HANA Benchmarking Assessment or SAP’s Performance Benchmarking Program, please contact valuemanagement@sap.com.

Task.Name: Define the Implementation Strategy
Task.Notes: The objective of this task is to define an implementation strategy for functional enhancements, based on the “to-be state” of the business architecture. The definition of the implementation strategy should cover aspects like: Should I re-shape the existing landscape when introducing the new functionality? Consider two-tier? What are dependencies, and what is the ideal sequence in the context of the overall release plan? What is the strategy for custom development of SAP Fiori UI’s and other custom objects? Are there any updates required in the security strategy? Those questions can be addressed jointly with SAP, by using a structured SAP Best Practices approach: Define the right set of decision criteria, and rank the options per criteria. The strategy in general should be driven by business needs. The more business critical a system is, the more serious to take the IT constraints. There is a document available which documents and explains the customer specific implementation strategy. Prerequisites: There is a draft version of the “to-be” state of the business architecture available already. Procedure: Define the implementation strategy. Document the results. Upload all documents to a central location so information can be shared across the project team. Procedure Notes: Learn how SAP Cloud ALM can help support the implementation journey by reviewing the content in the SAP Cloud ALM – Support Portal Home accelerator.

ExtendedAttribute.Value: 2nd Wave Project / Rollout Project, GROW Adoption Plan, Hybrid Deployment (Two-Tier ERP)

Task.Name: Create a Strategic Road Map and Value Case
Task.Notes: The objective of this task is to derive a strategic roadmap for continuous improvement of SAP S/4HANA Cloud considering the findings from previous tasks. The value case is based on identified business benefits leveraging SAP S/4HANA Cloud. All documents should be uploaded and stored in a central location so information can be shared across the project team. The road map should also consider having new organizational model (i.e. Help Desk, Key User, Customer Center of Expertise) to manage all SAP-related topics in order to achieve company’s goals and objectives. Prerequisites: There is a documented implementation roadmap available. The definition of the road map is based on key findings from previous tasks, identified architecture impact, and consideration of parallel initiatives and projects. Procedure: Agree on business transformation initiatives, and map the value contribution to the segmented areas. Compose a consolidated strategic roadmap for the implementation of SAP S/4HANA Cloud. Agree on requirements and conditions for the business case calculation. Define Key Performance Indicators (KPIs), and link them to the identified value drivers. Determine the value driver. Determine the cost driver. Review the Customer CoE Strategy Governance and Organization accelerator to understand the overall strategy and governance and the importance of having a Customer Center of Expertise organization. Review Backup and Disaster Recovery for S/4 HANA Cloud accelerator for the list of supported data centers and the difference between standard and add-on service.

ExtendedAttribute.Value: Application Design and Configuration, Operations and Support

Task.Name: Determine Functional Fit of SAP S/4HANA Cloud (ByDesign to S/4HANA Cloud)(Partner)
Task.Notes: The objective of this task is to evaluate how well SAP S/4HANA Cloud aligns with the functional requirements of the current end-to-end procedures implemented using SAP Business ByDesign. Procedure: Review the attached accelerator Best fit of SAP S/4HANA Cloud for SMB to compare the coverage of existing end-to-end scenarios on SAP Business ByDesign with that of SAP S/4HANA Cloud Solution. The scenario coverage map provides the percentage of coverage on the SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition broken down by end-to-end business scenarios Additional license requirements have been called out where end-to-end coverage can be achieved through other solutions. Extensions and Addons have not been considered for the coverage analysis.

Task.Name: Organizational Change Management Overview
Task.Notes: The purpose of this deliverable is to establish a solid foundation for supporting an upcoming SAP cloud implementation through well-suited change management activities. Developing comprehensive expertise in handling the people aspects of a cloud implementation prior to the project start enables a realistic evaluation of both the organizational change management’s added value and the corresponding effort involved. A shared understanding of these aspects within the project team allows informed decision-making regarding the early-stage configuration of change management. This, in turn, facilitates a prompt initiation of change management activities, aligning with the fast pace of technological advancements in the cloud project.

Task.Name: Understand the Fundamentals of Organizational Change Management
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to establish a shared perspective on the upcoming cloud implementation as a holistic business transformation, emphasizing the systematic handling of people-related challenges. This involves gaining fundamental insights into user adoption, understanding the usual progression of user adoption during an implementation project, and recognizing the importance of user adoption post go-live. This knowledge is crucial for understanding the concept of organizational change management and its benefits for the cloud project. Additionally, it enables a clear distinction between organizational change management and project management, clarifying the specific contributions each discipline makes to the overall success of the cloud implementation. Procedure: Familiarize yourself with the people side of cloud projects by consulting the explanations and videos available in the Why is the People Side of Cloud Projects Important accelerator. Explore the concept of user adoption by referring to the explanations and videos provided in the Why Does User Adoption Matter in Cloud Projects accelerator. Understand the role of organizational change management by reviewing the explanations and videos presented in the What is the Role of Organizational Change Management in SAP Cloud Projects accelerator.

Task.Name: Comprehend the Approach to Organizational Change Management
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to acquire an overview of the fundamental principles of organizational change management and the various dimensions of change management that need attention when supporting the people aspects of a cloud implementation. This facilitates a broader perspective on organizational management that extends beyond simply applying tools and assists in managing expectations towards change management. Furthermore, gaining more detailed information about the specific deliverables encompassed within these dimensions offers initial insights into the specific activities required to support the SAP cloud implementation project. Procedure: Understand the principles of organizational change management by referring to the section “Organizational Change Management as an Attitude” in the What is SAP's Understanding of Organizational Change Management accelerator. Gain insight into the organizational change management approach through the “Introduction of SAP's Organizational Change Management Framework” section in the How is SAP's Organizational Change Management Framework Structured accelerator. Enhance your understanding of the six dimensions of the approach by referring to the respective sections in the How is SAP's Organizational Change Management Framework Structured accelerator.

Task.Name: Provide Information on Organizational Change Management to Project Stakeholders
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to raise awareness about the importance of people aspects in the cloud project and to ensure that relevant project stakeholders have a foundational understanding of organizational change management. These stakeholders include decision makers, leaders of affected business units, as well as project managers and team members. Particularly in larger implementation projects with diverse project roles and multiple roll-out phases, it is recommended to identify specific target groups and determine the particular change management knowledge each group needs. Given that the project team set-up may not be finalized at this stage, integrating information on change management into the project onboarding material is a viable option. Procedure: Choose the organizational change management content to be shared with relevant stakeholders, consulting the Discover Organizational Change Management for SAP Cloud Projects accelerator. Determine the delivery approach (e.g., info session, emails with links, onboarding material) and document decisions using the Knowledge Transfer Tracker accelerator. Distribute content and provide status updates, referencing the Knowledge Transfer Tracker accelerator.

Task.Name: Prepare
Task.Notes: The purpose of this phase is to provide the initial planning and preparation for the project. In this phase, the project is started, plans are finalized, project team is assigned, and work is under way to start the project optimally. Prepare Phase Activities: Define project goals, a high-level scope, and a project plan Identify and quantify business value objectives Secure executive sponsorship Establish project standards, organization and governance Define and secure approval for the implementation/upgrade strategy Define roles and responsibilities for the project team Validate the project objectives Establish project management, tracking, and reporting mechanisms for value delivery Begin self-enablement Receive and access the Cloud Starter System Kick off the project

Task.Name: Getting Started with your SAP Implementation
Task.Notes: Welcome to the SAP Activate implementation roadmap. This roadmap will act as a step-by-step guide throughout your implementation journey. The purpose of this deliverable is to start the journey of implementing your SAP solution using SAP Activate Methodology and to become familiar with the implementation process.

ExtendedAttribute.Value: 2nd Wave Project / Rollout Project, GROW Adoption Plan, Hybrid Deployment (Two-Tier ERP)

Task.Name: Join Embedded Launch Activities in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition Onboarding Journey
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to prepare for participation in the Embedded Launch Activities within SAP customer onboarding. During the onboarding process, the SAP Onboarding Advisor will organize two Welcome & Introduction calls, introduce guided enablement, and facilitate the adoption touchpoint to conclude the initial implementation. Procedure: Attend the Welcome and Introduction workshop, where the main objective is to ensure the customer has received expected communications from SAP and can access the systems. In the case you have not been contacted by an SAP Onboarding Advisor, please reach out to your account manager. This workshop offers insights and guidance on the onboarding journey and plan, system provisioning, entitlements for SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition, and SAP support, including an overview of Quality Checks. Review the GROW with SAP - Onboarding Resource Center and Blog - GROW with SAP S/4HANA Onboarding - New to SAP S/4HANA Cloud accelerators for additional information on the onboarding process. Become familiar with the Guided Enablement offered in the Onboarding Resources Center. Schedule your participation (either live or by watching the recording) for the 1:m onboarding sessions according your project schedule. Review SAP S/4HANA Cloud - Application Lifecycle Operational Responsibilities.pptx to help determine customer, partner and SAP responsibilities. Review the Continuous Quality Check & Improvement Services accelerator and submit a request for the Continuous Quality Check Transformation Assessment . Explore the SAP Business Technology Platform (BTP) Onboarding Resource Center accelerator to gain additional information and receive further guidance on the SAP Business Technology Platform.

ExtendedAttribute.Value: 2nd Wave Project / Rollout Project, GROW Adoption Plan, Hybrid Deployment (Two-Tier ERP)

Task.Name: Review Overview Documentation for SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to become familiar with the SAP S/4HANA Cloud solution and SAP Activate Methodology. Procedure: Review the SAP S/4HANA Cloud 3-system Landscape Onboarding Presentation accelerator for an overview about SAP Activate and the implementation journey. Learn how an SAP implementation project works and how to get started by using the Key User Onboarding Guide accelerator. Review Using SAP S/4HANA Cloud for Single and Multi-Country Deployments accelerator to gain an insight into SAP Activate project practices applicable to both single and multi-country deployments. Review the Accel ID = S4H_1051. The accelerator contains the provisioning process for the SAP S/4HANA Cloud Starter tenants, including SAP Cloud ALM and SAP Central Business Configuration tenants. The details steps of the provisioning process can also be found detailed in the Technical Architecture and Infrastructure workstream. Review the SAP for Me Initial Access and User Setup accelerator. The accelerator has been created to guide customers from the contract signature until the first access to SAP for Me, the new digital companion for all support-related queries. Review the release restrictions including supported internet browser applications. See the SAP Note 3450904 - SAP S/4HANA Cloud Release Restrictions accelerator for more details. Review the Service Level Agreement for Cloud Services accelerator for downtime and maintenance windows. Review the SAP Activate for Upgrade of SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition (3-system landscape) roadmap for an overview of the upgrade process. Review, bookmark, and refer to the SAP Notes for SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition - FAQs collection for any questions or clarifications where you cannot find the answer in this implementation roadmap. Verify the Initial Admin User with the SAP account team. The Initial Admin User is the person that will receive communications from SAP including the system credentials and upgrade information. Procedure Note(s): If the person receiving the cloud system emails (Initial Admin User) is incorrect, Create an Incident/Service Request with the Subject ‘'Request update to the Initial Admin User, Description ‘'Please change the Initial Admin User to <NAME>, <EMAIL ADDRESS>' and component XX-S4C-OPR-SRV. Only one person is assigned as an Initial Admin User. This person receives the system provisioning notifications and is the main contact for the systems. Multiple people can be assigned as a Communication Contact. These people receive general communications related to the SAP S/4HANA Cloud system. Refer to the Initial Access to SAP for Me task for guidance on establishing access to SAP Signavio Process Navigator and submitting support tickets.

ExtendedAttribute.Value: 2nd Wave Project / Rollout Project, GROW Adoption Plan, Hybrid Deployment (Two-Tier ERP), Industry Cloud Apps

Task.Name: Define Guardrails for the Implementation Project (ByDesign to S/4HANA Cloud)
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to define strategic and program-specific goals for the customer’s cloud implementation project. Procedure: Gathering of challenges and elaboration of internal and external requirements from a business and IT perspective. Derivation of lighthouses and fields of action along the dimensions of Products / Portfolio Processes Technology and IT Organization Prioritization and scheduling of fields of action and goals using a structured method. Formulate the guardrails and design principles for customer’s cloud implementation project. Use the attached accelerator Guardrails for ByDesign Transition Project to help define the guardrails for your implementation project.

Task.Name: Supporting Tools for Implementation
Task.Notes: The purpose of this deliverable is to set up the access for all team members to the SAP Support Portal, SAP Signavio Process Navigator, SAP Activate Community and other tools which are used in the implementation.

ExtendedAttribute.Value: Application Design and Configuration, Customer Team Enablement, Integration, Project Management, Technical Architecture & Infrastructure

Task.Name: Verify Initial Admin/Technical Administrator
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task to verify and confirm the Initial Admin user (called Technical Administrator on the contract). The Initial Admin user refers to the individual designated to receive communications from SAP, including the system credentials and upgrade information. This person is listed on the contract/sales order as the Technical Administrator and will have the role of a super administrator or cloud administrator. If this is a new SAP customer and has not had any S-users yet, a new S-User is created and assigned to this user. This administrator will receive all authorizations that are required to fulfill SAP related tasks on the SAP for Me portal. The role and responsibilities of administrators include, but are not limited to: Creating additional S-user IDs Maintaining access authorizations for all users Receiving system provisioning communication emails 2896942 - How Super and Cloud Administrators manage Cloud Notification subscriptions for other users Prerequisite: SAP Universal ID created Procedure: Verify the Initial Admin User/ Technical Administrator listed in the sales order. This user is designated to receive the communications emails from SAP including the systems credentials and is listed as the person responsible to request the systems. If the person's name is correct, start with the provisioning request by following task Initial Access to SAP for Me for the next steps. If the person's name is incorrect, find the User Onboarding Token. It is included in the sales order and should be shared with the correct person fulfilling the role of Initial Admin. This token should be used by the customer if the technical administrator's name in the contract is not correct. Redeem the Onboarding Token by following the User Onboarding Token site. Verify access to the SAP Universal ID Account Manager. If the customer has not yet received the S-User email, contact SAP support using Contact Us (sap.com) If the SAP Universal ID entered is incorrect, check your company email to retrieve an existing SAP Universal ID or register an account by following the steps provided on the SAP Universal ID page. If the SAP Universal ID is correct and want to change or reset the SAP Universal ID password, refer to the SAP Universal ID password change and reset. If you still face challenges, please create an official support ticket for the support team to investigate further by contacting SAP support using Contact Us (sap.com) Manage Cloud notification subscriptions for other users. SAP for Me - Manage Cloud Service Availability Notifications is used to add, customize and manage subscription to Cloud Availability notifications. SAP Cloud customers can remain informed and receive timely updates regarding their SAP Cloud Services. Setup Cloud notification subscription for other users by follow the steps in the SAP for Me Help 2896942 - How Super and Cloud Administrators manage Cloud Notification subscriptions for other users. Ensure the right authorizations are assigned. If authorizations are missing, reach out to your company SAP Super admin user or if unavailable contact SAP support using Contact Us (sap.com). Procedure Note(s): You need an SAP S-user ID to access SAP for Me Customer dashboards. Some content and cards require additional authorization. Contact your S-User Admin or Super Admin to get access. Create an SAP Universal ID. This is required to use the token. Follow the steps provided on the SAP Universal ID page. Only one token is provided per Sales Order. If the onboarding token has already been used and need to update the Initial Admin contact, enter an incident under the component XX-S4C-OPR-SRV and Title 'Request update to the Contact Person IT.' In the text, please request an update to the IT Contact and Communication User. SAP's recommendation is to create at least two additional super administrators who can support or substitute if needed. Customers can reach out to their Account Executive if they have not yet received their S-User email.

Task.Name: Initial Access to SAP for Me
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to verify access and log into SAP for Me. In SAP for Me, customers and partners gain transparency and receive important alerts, metrics, and insights about their SAP product portfolio in one place. SAP for Me is a digital companion that helps customers and partners interact easily with SAP and get immediate guidance. SAP for Me is used in subsequent tasks to trigger the provisioning of different tenants and systems and check their status. SAP Cases (support tickets or service requests) can be created directly from SAP for Me. SAP Signavio Process Navigator required to review the SAP Best Practices content related to the scope items is accessible via SAP for Me. Prerequisites: SAP Support user (S-user) is available. Procedure: Access SAP for Me accelerator with the S-User account information received. If your IT contact is known but hasn't received your S-User Email, please check the SPAM email folder. If no emails were found, create an incident/service request. Follow the step via the SAP Note 1296527 - How to create a support case (contact SAP Product Support) - SAP for Me accelerator. Ensure you have access to the Dashboards: Validate access to the Systems & Provisioning Dashboard. Validate access to the Services & Support Dashboard. Validate access to the SAP Signavio Process Navigator or navigate to the Accel ID = S4H_176. Procedure Note(s): You need an SAP S-user ID to access SAP for Me Customer dashboards. Some content and cards require additional authorization. Contact your S-User Admin or Super Admin to get access. For additional questions or feedback about access to SAP for Me, customers can send an email via SAPforMe@sap.com Customers can contact a local SAP Customer Interaction Center via phone, email, or chat for all additional questions or feedback.

Task.Name: Grant Access to Partner for Creating and Managing Cases
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to grant access to partner S-user ID(s) so that they can create and manage SAP cases on behalf of the customer using the Service Partner Management Application in SAP for Me. The application plays an import role in enhancing the quality of support services provided by partners, optimizing troubleshooting processes, and facilitating collaboration between SAP and partners. SAP advises customers and partners to leverage the Service Partner User Management application in situations where partners interact with SAP support upon customer request and on their behalf. Some of the benefits of using the Service Partner Management Application for SAP customers and Partners include, but not limited to: Accelerated troubleshooting by partners on behalf of customer Closer collaboration between SAP and partners Higher transparency Increased efficiency in managing partner authorizations Increased efficiency in case handling across customers For detailed information about this process, please refer to Accel ID = S4H_2143. Prerequisite: SAP Support user (S-user) is available Customer S-user ID who is providing authorizations must be listed as Cloud Administrator Customer S-user ID (Cloud Admin) who is providing authorizations must have the same customer number as the installation(s) in question Procedure: Provide access to partner S-user IDs to enable them to assist in creating and managing cases on behalf of the customer. Refer to the procedure in SAP Note 2518600 - How to grant support authorization to a service partner S-user using the Service for detailed steps. Procedure Note(s): You need an SAP S-user ID to access SAP for Me Customer dashboards. Some content and cards require additional authorization. Contact your S-User Admin or Super Admin to get access. For additional questions or feedback about access to SAP for Me, customers can send an email via SAPforMe@sap.com Customers can contact a local SAP Customer Interaction Center via phone, email, or chat for all additional questions or feedback.

ExtendedAttribute.Value: 2nd Wave Project / Rollout Project, Hybrid Deployment (Two-Tier ERP)

Task.Name: Ensure Project Team Members Access to the SAP Learning Hub
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to ensure that the project team can access the SAP Learning Hub. SAP Learning Hub The SAP Learning Hub is the central location that provides access to various learning offerings and the SAP Learning Rooms. With the SAP Learning Hub there are different editions available, which will be based on the support subscription. By default, all SAP S/4HANA Cloud customers are entitled to use the SAP Learning Hub, edition for SAP Enterprise Support. This edition provides users with access to all SAP Enterprise Support learning content powered by SAP Enterprise Support Academy. Contact SAP_ES_Academy@sap.com for related feedback and questions. In addition to utilizing the SAP Enterprise Support Academy content available in the SAP Learning Hub, edition for SAP Enterprise Support, you can enroll and join the SAP S/4HANA Cloud Implementation Learning Room to access a selection of support offerings, including live fundamental sessions. If you have any questions or feedback regarding this aspect, please contact e-learning@sap.com. Procedure: Go to the accelerator Accel ID = S4H_192. Click on ‘Learn More and Sign Up’ and follow the steps outlined. Select ‘Program Entitlement’ to check eligibility and find out more information. Click on ‘Sign-Up’ and register with your S-User ID and password. A welcome email will be sent shortly after signing up. Confirm the popup message (only relevant for first time access to the Accel ID = S4H_207. Please note that S-User assignment to the SAP Learning Hub, edition for SAP Enterprise Support can take up to two hours from the time you have received the welcome email. Login using the link provided in the registration email. Search a topic under the ‘Quick Access’ section. To search all content related to SAP S/4HANA use the search tag “SAP S/4HANA” (including the quotations) or use the accelerator Accel ID = S4H.1214. Procedure Note: The SAP Learning Hub - Editions accelerator provides an overview of the Learning Hub.

Task.Name: Ensure Project Team Members Access to the SAP Activate Community
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to ensure that all project team members access the SAP Activate Community. This community allows for collaboration with other customers, partners and experts on SAP Activate Methodology and provides valuable information throughout your implementation. Procedure: Access the SAP Activate Community the via the SAP Activate Community accelerator link in the Accelerator section. Select the “Follow button” to receive updates and notifications on new content. Submit questions to the community on SAP Activate throughout the implementation project by selecting “Create a Post” hyperlink.

Task.Name: Request Initial System Access
Task.Notes: The purpose of this deliverable is to request initial access to your system/tenant through SAP for Me.

Task.Name: Request Initial System Access of SAP S/4HANA Cloud
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to request initial system/tenant access in SAP for Me. The Initial Admin user makes the request in SAP for Me and will then receive an email with the access instructions. Customers have the option to request multiple tenants within a single request. SAP Cloud ALM tenant, SAP Central Business Configuration tenant and SAP S/4HANA Cloud Starter System are included in the initial provisioning. Note that SAP Cloud ALM is not available in all countries/regions. There are two tenants in the SAP S/4HANA Cloud Starter System: Starter Customizing and Starter Development and both will be provisioned with the initial systems. The Initial Admin user has been identified and has the right authorizations in SAP for Me Procedure: Request the systems in SAP for Me via the SAP for Me - Dashboards > Systems & Provisioning > Provisioning . Locate the 'SAP S/4HANA Cloud Starter Customizing tenant' entry in the ‘Systems to be Provisioned’ section of the ’Provisioning tab' and click 'Start Provisioning. Select the appropriate dependent products if applicable, then review and follow the instructions in the pop-up windows for the next steps. Once the appropriate selections have been made and all details reviewed for each tenant, select ‘Submit’. The request will trigger the system provisioning, and an email will be sent to the 'Initial Admin user' when the system/tenants are available. Note: The Starter Development tenant will be provisioned along with the Starter Customizing tenant. Procedure Note(s): Customers are entitled to use SAP Cloud ALM if they subscribe to an SAP Cloud Service that includes SAP Enterprise Support and cloud editions. Note that SAP Cloud ALM is not available in all countries/regions. For further questions or feedback, please send an email to cloudalm@sap.com. Learn about SAP Cloud ALM by reviewing Help - SAP Cloud ALM or the Self-Enable on SAP Cloud ALM task. Learn more about SAP S/4HANA Cloud Starter system provisioning, including SAP Cloud ALM and SAP Central Business Configuration, via Accel ID = S4H_1051. For additional scenario information related to the required SAP Cloud Identity Services Administration, see the Accel ID = ACT_021. You need an SAP S-user ID to access SAP for Me Customer dashboards. Some content and cards require additional authorization. Contact your S-User Admin or Super Admin to get access.

Task.Name: Request SAP Analytics Cloud
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to request an SAP Analytics Cloud tenant via SAP for Me. SAP Analytics Cloud is a single solution for business intelligence and enterprise planning, augmented with the power of artificial intelligence, machine learning technology, and predictive analytics. Customers are entitled to use SAP Cloud Analytics if they have subscribed to a RISE with SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public edition premium package. An SAP account Executive (AE) can be contacted for additional information on the different packages available. Prerequisite: Initial Access to SAP for Me Procedure: Request the SAP Cloud Analytics tenant in SAP for Me - Dashboards > Systems and Provisioning > Provisioning accelerator. Locate the SAP Cloud Analytics in the 'Provisioning' section under 'Product Available for Provisioning' and click on 'Start Provisioning'. Follow the prompt to select the respective SAP Cloud Analytics tenant. Click on the 'Submit' button. The request will trigger the tenant provisioning, and an email will be sent when the tenant is available. Procedure Note(s): You need an SAP S-user ID to access SAP for Me Customer dashboards. Some content and cards require additional authorization. Contact your S-User Admin or Super Admin to get access.

Task.Name: Initial System Access for SAP Cloud ALM
Task.Notes: The purpose of this deliverable is to request and access the SAP Cloud ALM tenant to perform the initial setup of project team environment, including selection of SAP Activate template, user setup, definition of milestones, etc. The tasks below will help guide you through this process. SAP Cloud ALM has the same great SAP Activate content as the Roadmap Viewer but offers extended features allowing both project managers and implementation experts to better manage their work. Some examples of the features are: Assigning tasks to teams and users Adding project specific tasks Tracking completion status as part of the project management capabilities.

Task.Name: Required Setup for SAP Cloud ALM
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to perform the required setup for SAP Cloud ALM before starting productive use of the solution. If the SAP Cloud ALM tenant already exists and has been fully configured, then this task can be skipped. In SAP Cloud ALM, the content of SAP Activate is integrated and provides enhanced project and task management functionality. It should be the primary source for following SAP Activate once this task is completed. Note that SAP Cloud ALM is not available in all countries/regions. Prerequisite: Received email with access information to SAP Cloud ALM tenant. Procedure: Read the overviews and follow the procedures for each of the three steps listed under Help - Required Setup for SAP Cloud ALM to complete the required setup of SAP Cloud ALM. If you need help, refer to our Help - Troubleshooting and FAQ for SAP Cloud ALM or SAP for Me - Schedule an Expert (component SV-CLM-INF-ONB). Create a project for your implementation using the Projects and Setup app within SAP Cloud ALM. For guidance, see the in-app help and/or topic ‘Projects and Setup’ in Accel ID = S4H_1803.

Task.Name: Initial System Access for SAP Central Business Configuration System
Task.Notes: The purpose of this deliverable is to access the SAP Central Business Configuration tenant, perform scoping and initial settings, and set up the two starter projects. There are two tenants in the SAP S/4HANA Cloud Starter System: Starter Customizing and Starter Development. The Starter Customizing tenant is used to review the pre-delivered standard business processes during the fit-to-standard workshops while the Starter Development tenant is used for exploring available APIs, CDS view and released developer objects.

Task.Name: Access SAP Central Business Configuration Tenant
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to access the SAP Central Business Configuration tenant and the Administration Console of the Identity Authentication Service and perform the initial system setup. Prerequisite: Received email with access information to SAP Central Business Configuration tenant and Identity Authentication Service provisioning tenant. Procedure: Locate the Identity Authentication Service email sent to the ‘Initial Admin User’ and follow the instructions to access and set up the Administration Console of the Identity Authentication Service. Locate the SAP Central Business Configuration provisioning emails sent to the ‘Initial Admin User' and access the tenant using the link provided in the email. Access the SAP Central Business Configuration and follow the instructions provided in the provisioning email to do the initial setup of the SAP Central Business Configuration users. Initial setup tasks must be performed to enable additional users to work in SAP Central Business Configuration. Follow the step-by-step guide in the Help - Set Up SAP Central Business Configuration accelerator. Below is the summary of the required steps: Creating Business Users and Providing Access Rights Running Jobs for User Provisioning Enabling Business Users to Access the SAP Central Business Configuration System Procedure Note(s): The SAP Central Business Configuration tenant uses the same identity authentication tenant as the SAP S/4HANA Cloud tenant, and therefore, no additional notification is sent. If the person receiving the cloud system emails (IT Contact) is incorrect, Create an Incident/Service Request with the Subject ‘'Request update to the Contact Person IT’, Description ‘'Please change the IT Contact to <NAME>, <EMAIL ADDRESS>' and component XX-S4C-OPR-SRV. Only one person is assigned as an IT Contact. This person receives the system provisioning notifications and is the primary contact for the systems. Multiple people can be assigned as Communication Contacts. These people receive general communications related to the SAP S/4HANA Cloud system.

ExtendedAttribute.Value: Identity and Access Management, Localization, Parallel Project Line

Task.Name: Set Up Starter Customizing and Development Tenants in SAP Central Business Configuration
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to set up an SAP Central Business Configuration Evaluation Project for the SAP S/4HANA Cloud Customizing tenant in SAP Central Business Configuration and activate content in your Starter Customizing tenant. There are two tenants in the Starter System: Starter Customizing and Starter Development. This process is followed twice: once for the Starter Customizing tenant and once for the Starter Development tenant. Prerequisite: Received provisioning email with access information for SAP S/4HANA Cloud Starter System Procedure for the Starter Customizing Tenant: Login to the Project Experience in the SAP Central Business Configuration and create an Evaluation Project for the Starter Customizing tenant. See the section 'Selecting Your Project (Initial Logon)' in the Help - Project Experience. accelerator for detailed steps to complete the activity. Complete SAP Central Business Configuration activities and milestones for setting up the Starter Customizing tenant. See the section 'Evaluation Project' in the Help - Project Experience accelerator for additional information on completing the activities. Below is a summary of the activities: Scoping Assign a Deployment Target Milestone Confirming Scoping is Completed Primary Finance Settings Setup Organizational Structure Milestone Confirming the Scope and Organizational Structure Phase is Completed Procedure for the Starter Development Tenant: Login to the Project Experience in the SAP Central Business Configuration and create an Evaluation Project for the Starter Development tenant. See the section 'Selecting Your Project (Initial Logon)' in the Help - Project Experience accelerator for the detailed steps for completing the activity. Complete the SAP Central Business Configuration activities and milestones for setting up the Starter Development Tenant. See the section 'Evaluation Project' in the Help - Project Experience accelerator for additional information on completing the activities. Below is a summary of the activities: Scoping Assign a Deployment Target Milestone Confirming Scoping is Completed Primary Finance Settings Setup Org Structure Milestone Confirming the Scope and Organizational Structure Phase is Completed Procedure Note(s): Only the Starter System gets connected to the Evaluation project in SAP Central Business Configuration. The main purpose of the Starter System customizing tenant is to run through pre-delivered standard business processes during the fit-to-standard workshops. The recommended use of the Starter Development tenant is mainly for exploring available APIs, CDS view and released developer objects. On first use, it is recommended to select only one country/region and use the default settings provided by SAP to get the Starter System activated. JSON file of your scope selection from Digital Discovery Assessment can be uploaded in Define Scope app. Reference the Importing Scope section under Scoping in Help - Project Experience accelerator.

Task.Name: Set Up SAP Central Business Configuration Integration to SAP Cloud ALM
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to set up integration between SAP Central Business Configuration and SAP Cloud ALM systems. The integration will help customers easily navigate to the SAP Central Business Configuration tasks list from SAP Cloud ALM tasks. Note that SAP Cloud ALM is not available in all countries/regions. Procedure: Follow the step-by-step guidance in the Help - Setup and Administration for SAP Cloud ALM accelerator. The steps include the procedure for the technical setup and the integration during project creation. Navigate to the SAP Central Business Configuration via the respective tasks in SAP Cloud ALM.

Task.Name: Initial System Access for SAP Cloud Analytics
Task.Notes: The purpose of this deliverable is to receive and access the SAP Analytics Cloud tenant. The tasks below will help guide you through this process.

Task.Name: Initial System Access for SAP Analytics Cloud
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task to access the SAP Analytics Cloud tenant. The Initial Admin User will receive a provisioning email with instruction needed to access and setup the tenant. Prerequisite: Request SAP Analytics Cloud via SAP for Me SAP Analytics Cloud URL and initial logon credentials were received. Procedure: Follow the procedure provided in the provisioning email.

Task.Name: Initial System Access for SAP S/4HANA Cloud Starter System
Task.Notes: The purpose of this deliverable is to receive the new Starter System and create the initial users. The Starter System contains configuration and data so the customer can execute business processes during the Explore phase. There are two tenants in the Starter System: Starter Customizing and Starter Development. The Starter Customizing tenant is used to review the pre-delivered standard business processes during the fit-to-standard workshops while the Starter Development tenant is used for exploring available APIs, CDS view and released developer objects.

Task.Name: Initial System Access for SAP S/4HANA Cloud Starter System
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to access the SAP S/4HANA Cloud Starter System and create the initial users of the implementation project team. Additional users can be added at any time in the future. This process is followed twice: once for the Starter Customizing tenant and once for the Starter Development tenant. The Starter System includes configuration for the enablement of the project team on the standard processes and is used in the fit-to-standard workshops. Corresponding test scripts and process flows are available in the Implementation Portal and the SAP Signavio Process Navigator. The SAP S/4HANA Cloud Starter System will be automatically decommissioned by SAP 30 calendar days after the SAP S/4HANA Cloud Production System provisioning email is sent. Prerequisite: Starter Customizing Tenant in SAP Central Business Configuration has been set up. Starter Development Tenant in SAP Central Business Configuration has been set up. Procedure for the Starter Customizing Tenant: Locate the provisioning email sent to the ‘Initial Admin User’. Access the Starter Customizing System URL provided in the provisioning email. Create and activate users in the Starter System by following the instructions provided in the Help - Initial System Access to SAP S/4HANA Cloud accelerator. Procedure for the Starter Development Tenant: Locate the provisioning email sent to the ‘Initial Admin User’. Access the Development System URL provided in the provisioning email. Create and activate users in the Starter System by following the instructions provided in the Help - Initial System Access to SAP S/4HANA Cloud accelerator. Procedure Note(s): For the SAP S/4HANA Cloud system, the initial user has administration rights. It can be used to create additional users with the same administration responsibilities. If the SAP Business Technology Platform IAS account is already active, no new notification will be sent. In this case, the SAP S/4HANA Cloud system was connected to the existing test IAS tenant. Please get in touch with your IAS Administrator to gain access. If additional SAP Cloud systems (SAP SuccessFactors, Concur, etc.) are to be integrated and have the same subscription start date, additional provisioning emails will be received for those systems. For login issues, create a case (incident) with the component XX-S4C-OPR-INC. See task Ensure Project Team Members Access to the SAP Support Portal for more information on using support. If the person receiving the cloud system emails (Initial Admin User) is incorrect, enter an incident under the component XX-S4C-OPR-SRV and Title 'Request update to the Contact Person IT.' In the text, please request an update to the IT Contact and Communication User. This will apply to future communications. Only one person is assigned as an IT Contact. This person receives the system provisioning notifications and is the primary contact for the systems. Additional people can be assigned as Communication Contacts to receive general communications related to the SAP S/4HANA Cloud system. These assignments can be requested via the SAP for Me - Manage Cloud Service Availability Notifications accelerator. For additional information on the cloud product availability and maintenance, refer to the Cloud Availability Center & Cloud System Notification Subscriptions accelerator. The app IAM Information System can be used to determine the existing roles that allow access to specific apps. To find the roles, set the Main Entity = Application, enter the app name in the Search field, and press ‘Go.’ For additional information on creating an admin business user, initially, see the topic “SAP S/4HANA Cloud - Initial System Access” in the SAP S/4HANA Cloud Tutorials accelerator. Person-ID External used in SAP SuccessFactors Employee Central needs to be the same as the Employee ID in SAP S/4HANA Cloud. The user name used in SAP SuccessFactors Employee Central needs to be the same as that in SAP S/4HANA Cloud.

Task.Name: Initial System Access for SAP Business Technology Platform
Task.Notes: The purpose of this deliverable is to receive the new cloud SAP Business Technology Platform entitlements and start the onboarding process. SAP Business Technology Platform is an integration, extension, and application development platform. Once the commercial agreement is signed, SAP will send two (2) separate emails with all necessary information to access the SAP Business Technology Platform. Reach out to your SAP representative for questions regarding provisioning details, available credits, usage information, and pricing.

Task.Name: Access to SAP Business Technology Platform
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to access the SAP Business Technology Platform system. The ‘IT Contact’ maintained in the contract will receive an email with the URL, SAP ID User and Login instructions for the SAP Business Technology Platform. Procedure: Locate the SAP Business Technology Platform provisioning emails sent to the ‘IT Contact’. Follow the instructions provided in the provisioning email to perform the the initial onboarding activities. Refer SAP Business Technology Platform Onboarding Resource Center for details on getting the initial access. For additional guidance review the mission Accel ID = S4H_1014. Procedure Note(s): If customers have an existing account for SAP Business Technology Platform, the "IT Contact" would have received emails about the provisioning of SAP BTP Entitlements. All new entitlements should have been provisioned to the existing global account and customers can distribute the entitlements as needed. Only the 'IT Contact' user will have initial access to the Global Account and have authorization to distribute entitlements.

Task.Name: Create Users in the SAP Business Technology Platform Cockpit
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to create users in the SAP Business Technology Platform Cockpit. SAP recommends customers to create at least one additional Global Account Administrator who can support or substitute the initial Global Account Administrator if necessary. SAP cannot assign additional user IDs on the company's behalf. Procedure: Follow the instructions in the Help - SAP Business Technology Platform: Add Members to Your Global Account accelerator, to add additional users in the SAP Business Technology Platform account.

Task.Name: Set Up SAP Business Technology Platform Global Account
Task.Notes: The purpose of the task is to access your SAP BTP global account, verify entitlements and quotas for the SAP BTP apps and to setup your subaccount structure in accordance with your intended usage. Prerequisite: A finalized list of SAP BTP Apps to be setup based on the scope items that were selected in 'Executing a SAP Digital Discovery Assessment' Task. Procedure: Review accelerator Landscape Modelling Recommendations for Selected Business Technology Platform (BTP) Apps for guidance on how to map the subaccount structure of selected SAP BTP Apps with the tenants of SAP S/4HANA Cloud. For SAP BTP Apps that are not specifically mentioned within this guidance, please refer to their app-specific documentation. Login and access the SAP BTP global account using the login credentials and URL provided in the Access Information for SAP Business Technology Platform email that was sent to the 'IT Contact' maintained in your SAP BTP contract. Verify that the entitlements for the SAP BTP Apps to be implemented have been added to your global account using a global administrator user. Create the subaccount structure as required. The global administrator can then distribute the entitlements to the subaccounts as required. Go to the Products with Integration Capabilities section within the accelerator Help - S/4HANA Cloud Integration and locate the corresponding SAP BTP apps and review the Setup Instructions within the Administration Section. Identify the SAP BTP Services that are required as prerequisites for the setup and ensure that they are subscribed to within the corresponding subaccounts. Procedure Note(s): Refer section ‘Systems & Tenants in a 3-System Landscape’ within the accelerator Help - The SAP S/4HANA Cloud Universe for additional guidance on how to setup your subaccounts and choose the corresponding regions based on the data center availability of the SAP BTP Apps required.

ExtendedAttribute.Value: Industry Cloud Apps, SAP BTP Apps

Task.Name: Activate SAP Build Entitlements
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to activate the SAP Build entitlements that are included as a part of your RISE with SAP or GROW with SAP Packages. Prerequisite: SAP Business Technology Platform Global Account has been setup as mentioned in task Set Up SAP Business Technology Platform Global Account Procedure: Ensure that the required entitlements assigned to your SAP BTP global account. Use the following accelerators to activate the corresponding SAP Build components SAP Help - Getting Started with SAP Build Work Zone, standard edition SAP Help - Activate Your SAP Build Process Automation Package SAP Help - Activate Your SAP Build Apps Package

Task.Name: Subscribe to Cloud Integration Automation Service within SAP BTP
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to subscribe to the Cloud Integration Automation Service that provides you a guided workflow to integrate SAP cloud solutions Prerequisite: Customer has SAP Business Technology Platform (BTP) Cloud Foundry subaccount in one of the data centers supported by Cloud Integration Automation Service or an SAP Cloud Integration account. Customer system instances of licensed SAP products that are in scope of the Cloud Integration Automation Service Procedure: Review the accelerator Help - Cloud Integration Automation Service and check the section "Supported Scenarios for Cloud Integration Automation Service" to determine if Cloud Integration Automation Service is relevant for your project depending on the planned Integration Scenarios. Subscribe to the Cloud Integration Automation Service If you have requested SAP Cloud ALM tenant and have received access, the Cloud Integration Automation Service will automatically be subscribed to within the BTP subaccount where SAP Cloud ALM is provisioned. In this scenario, verify that the Cloud Integration Automation Service tenant has been provisioned. No further action is required.
