If you have an existing SAP Cloud ALM tenant through another cloud subscription or if you want to provision a separate Cloud Integration Automation Service instance in a supported data center of your choice, subscribe to the Cloud Integration Automation Service within your SAP BTP subaccount as described in the "Subscription to Cloud Integration Automation Service" section of the Cloud Integration Automation Service User Guide accelerator. Procedure Note(s): Customers who are yet to request their SAP Cloud ALM tenant are recommended to the use the Cloud Integration Automation Service that will be automatically subscribed within the SAP BTP subaccount used for SAP Cloud ALM provisioning.

Task.Name: Set Up SAP Start and SAP Mobile Start
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to set up SAP Start including SAP Mobile Start to create a central entry point for Business Users. Prerequisite: Customer has setup the SAP BTP Global Account Customer has entitlements to SAP Task Center and SAP Cloud Management Service The customer has registered their SAP S/4HANA Cloud System to their SAP BTP Global account. Refer to Help - Register an SAP S/4HANA Cloud System in a Global Account in SAP BTP for additional details. Procedure: Execute the steps to set up SAP Start as described in Accel ID = S4H_2061. This will lead to a subscription of SAP Build Work Zone, standard edition (plan: foundation) Open the SAP Start site via the URL provided in the SAP Build Work Zone tenant. Refer Help - Launch SAP Start for additional details. Install SAP Mobile Start on end user mobile device and connect it to the SAP Start instance as is described in Accel ID = S4H_2063. Integrate additional SAP solutions to the SAP Start instance by following steps detailed in Accel ID = S4H_2064. Content will also be available within SAP Mobile Start afterwards.

Task.Name: Customer Team Self-Enablement
Task.Notes: The purpose of this deliverable is for the customer to learn different elements of the SAP system and SAP Activate methodology using self-paced enablement materials. SAP cloud projects are intended to be completed in a shorter time period which requires more focus on learning tools. It is important that self-enablement begins prior to the project kickoff in order to maximize the time for learning and create efficiencies in later deliverables.

ExtendedAttribute.Value: Analytics, Application Design and Configuration, Customer Team Enablement, Data Management, Extensibility, Integration, Solution Adoption, Technical Architecture & Infrastructure, Testing
2nd Wave Project / Rollout Project, Artificial Intelligence Technology, Identity and Access Management

Task.Name: Request Knowledge Assessment
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to conduct a knowledge assessment by requesting the Continuous Quality Check (CQC) for transformation assessment service. The CQC for transformation assessment service reports assess your project team’s awareness of SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition critical topics and provides you with individualized recommendations for tools and training resources. The goal of the CQC for transformation assessment service is to provide you with high-level recommendations in line with SAP best practices and ensure your project team moves in the right direction during the various SAP Activate phases. At the end of the service, you will receive an individualized knowledge assessment report which will include an executive summary, action plan and detailed recommendations. All findings and recommendations detailed in the service report can be used to help create the enablement plan for your project team and business owners. The topics covered within the CQC for transformation assessment include the following: project timelines, SAP Activate, Central Business Configuration, SAP Cloud ALM, functional aspects and pre-set parameters, data migration, Identity and Access Management, extensibility, integration, analytics, release upgrade and enablement/community. Procedure: Review the SAP Support Portal info sheet accelerator to become familiar with the assessment service offering. Request the service via two options: Option 1: directly request the service via CQC for Transformation Assessment – Request form for SAP S/4HANA Cloud, Public Edition. Option 2: Sign up via the SAP Enterprise Support value map for SAP S/4HANA Cloud, public edition. Within the value map select the tab “Continuous Quality Check” and click the “Request CQC for Transformation Assessment” button. If you have any questions about the service, make sure to post them on the value map platform. Procedure Notes: The CQC for transformation assessment is embedded in your SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition contract. There are no extra fees required for this service. A service questionnaire will need to be filled and sent back to SAP in order to receive the final report with SAP findings and recommendations.

Task.Name: Create Self-Enablement Plan
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to understand why self-enablement is key for a successful SAP S/4HANA Cloud implementation and how a customer specific enablement plan can be created. Procedure: Schedule a half of a day workshop with your implementation partner and your dedicated Customer Success Manager (CSM), if Preferred Success is a part of your SAP subscription. Review the Customer Self-Enablement Workshop.pptx accelerator and use the Customer Self-Enablement Plan.xlsx accelerator in the workshop. Nominate Customer Lead to monitor the progress of team members. Specify your project and future RUN tasks for SAP S/4HANA Cloud with your implementation partner. Identify learning items per task with your implementation partner and CSM to gain maximum content of Enterprise Support and Preferred Success offerings including SAP Learning Hub. Define your future organizational roles to map all tasks and learning items to your team members. Execute and monitor progress of your self-enablement learning plan. Procedure Note(s): Please review all tasks below Customer Team Self-Enablement Deliverable for more self-enablement activities.

Task.Name: Review Getting Started Tutorials in S/4HANA Cloud
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to use the in-app help to learn about the SAP S/4HANA Cloud. Procedure: Log in to the SAP S/4HANA Cloud System. Choose the 'Help' button in the shell bar ('?' button in the upper right corner) to open the in-app help. Select the 'Learning' tile to open the 'Recommended Learning' list. From the 'Recommended Learning' list, select the 'Working with the Launchpad' package and view the ‘Working with the Launchpad’ tutorials. Note that there are three options associated with the tutorials: Interactive Demo, Try it yourself, and Print (PDF). From the 'Recommended Learning' list, select the ‘Working with Apps’ package and view the tutorials. Procedure Note(s): Tutorials can also be accessed externally via the SAP S/4HANA Cloud Tutorials accelerator. SAP developed the tutorials using the SAP tool called SAP Enable Now. If the customer has the license for SAP Enable Now, additional content can be developed by the customer.

Task.Name: Self-Enable on Transport Management
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to provide you with an overview of the 3-system landscape in SAP S/4HANA Cloud, and the process of transporting customizations, key user configurations, and developer extensions between systems. Procedure: Review the 3-system landscape overview using the Help - 3-System Landscape and Transport Management accelerator. Review the 3-System Landscape - Transport Management Fundamentals e-learning accelerator. In order to acquire authorization details, refer to the task Ensure Project Team Members Access to the SAP Learning Hub. Use the tag ‘Transport Management’ to access the list of tasks related to Transport Management. Review all tasks' descriptions, steps, and notes including accelerators. Review the Manage Transports task to learn how to manage transports. Procedure Note(s): In SAP Cloud ALM, Features can be used to bundle dependent transports of different transport types e.g, Customizing and Key User Extensibility. Exported transports can be assigned to Features, and the Feature Traceability app provides a quick overview of the deployment status per Feature. Prerequisite is the creation of Communication Arrangement SAP Cloud ALM - Change and Deployment Management Integration (SAP_COM_0690).

Task.Name: Self-Enable on Two-Tier ERP with SAP S/4HANA Cloud
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to become familiar with the Two-Tier ERP Deployment strategy for SAP S/4HANA Cloud. The Two-Tier ERP Deployment strategy enables customers to maximize their existing investment in their ERP system while allowing the necessary flexibility and agility needed to run their business. Procedure: Review the accelerator Two-Tier ERP Deployment for SAP S/4HANA Cloud. This document describes what it means to operate your business in the cloud, explains how successful companies embraced cloud technology for their ERP systems, showcases key business scenarios, and helps start their transformation journey. Review the Two-Tier ERP Community Page accelerator. The community page is a valuable resource in becoming familiar and staying up to date with the Two-Tier ERP Deployment strategy. Review the relevant scope items available for Two-Tier on SAP Signavio Process Navigator using the Two-Tier ERP accelerator. Review the Blog - Master Data and Integration approaches in Hybrid cloud deployment with S/4HANA.

Task.Name: Self-Enable on SAP Cloud ALM
Task.Notes: The purpose of to review the training material and become familiar with SAP Cloud Application Lifecycle Management (ALM). SAP Cloud ALM is an essential how-to solution for managing all aspects of any SAP cloud solution. It assists customers through the initial implementation, to going live, to monitoring integrations, to running and continuously optimizing your instance. Customers are entitled to use SAP Cloud ALM if they subscribe to an SAP Cloud Service that includes SAP Enterprise Support, and cloud editions. Procedure: Learn about SAP Cloud ALM by reviewing the SAP Cloud ALM - Support Portal Home and SAP Cloud ALM for Implementation pages. Test Drive SAP Cloud ALM using the Accel ID = S4H_828. Upskill yourself by accessing the Accel ID = S4H_1042. Be sure to review the demos in section ‘End to End Implementation Process in SAP Cloud ALM’. Learn how to use SAP Cloud ALM to efficiently manage your cloud - centric landscape by accessing the SAP Cloud ALM for Operations accelerator. Align with your implementation team on interest in using SAP Cloud ALM. Procedure Note(s): For further questions or feedback, please send an email to cloudalm@sap.com. See the in-app help within the SAP Cloud ALM tool for additional documentation, best practices, and videos on the apps and processes.

Task.Name: Access the SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition Support Value Map and Implementation Learning Room
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to access the SAP Enterprise Support value map for SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition. This learning resource guides users in accessing the necessary SAP Support services, tools, and offerings at the right moment for the successful implementation and operation of SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition. If you have any inquiries or feedback related to this, please reach out to SAP_ES_Academy@sap.com. To kickstart your journey with SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition, you should complete the respective SAP S/4HANA Cloud Onboarding for 3SL or SAP S/4HANA Cloud Onboarding for 2SL accelerator available in the SAP Learning Hub, edition for SAP Enterprise Support, accessible through the SAP Enterprise Support value map during the prepare phase. In addition to utilizing the SAP Enterprise Support value map, you can join the SAP S/4HANA Cloud Implementation Learning Room to access a selection of support offerings, including live fundamental sessions. If you have any questions or feedback regarding this aspect, please contact e-learning@sap.com. Prerequisite: Users need to be registered in the SAP Learning Hub, edition for SAP Enterprise Support. If any users are not yet registered, please refer to the task ‘Ensure Project Team Members Gain Access to the SAP Learning Hub.' Procedure: To access SAP Enterprise Support value map for SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition Navigate to the SAP Enterprise Support Value Maps Landing page using the SAP Enterprise Support Value Maps Landing Page accelerator. Select the ‘Access Value Maps’ option. Choose the ‘SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition’ value map from the available options in the ‘Select a Value Map’ section Click the ‘Join Group’ button on the SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition value map landing page. To access SAP S/4HANA Cloud Implementation Learning Room Navigate to the SAP Enterprise Support Academy Landing page using the SAP Enterprise Support Academy Landing page accelerator. Select ‘Access SAP Learning Hub.’ Click on the ‘Learning Room’ tab. In the ‘Explore SAP Learning Rooms’ section, enter “SAP S/4HANA Cloud Implementation Learning Room” and initiate the search. Access the SAP S/4HANA Cloud Implementation Learning Room from the search results. Follow the instructions in the email invitation and accept it.

Task.Name: Self-Enable on Experience Management
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to review the documentation available and become familiar with Experience Management (XM) transformation to learn how to safeguard the success of the implementation of SAP S/4HANA Cloud, using Experience Management. This is achieved by capturing the project team’s experiences throughout the course of the implementation, to ensure teams are functioning well and the features and functions being implemented will meet the needs of end-users. Procedure: Understand the value of Experience Management (XM) Review the Introduction to Experience Management accelerator, to understand the core benefits of Experience Management (XM). Consider how you would apply XM within your organizational structure, including incorporating it into your Organizational Change Management and Continuous Improvement activities. Key areas of consideration will be governance, stakeholders and technology. Review how Experience Management transformation applies to your Implementation. Review the XM Transformation Procedure accelerator, to understand how XM can be applied to your implementation. Use the listed accelerators to support the development of your XM strategy for this particular implementation; with special reference to stakeholder mapping, reporting structures, and what technology will be required to support the program. Utilize the XM Transformation Procedure and XM Transformation Survey Questions accelerators throughout your implementation, to support your XM program. Procedure Note(s): Ensure the core Project Team (customer and partner PMO staff) understand the principles of Experience Management (XM) programs, including how they enable innovation and agility in Enterprises, using continuous feedback mechanisms that deliver data-driven, actionable insights. These principles are especially useful in large enterprises with diverse business processes, heterogeneous IT landscapes, disparate teams or reporting lines, a high number of individual stakeholders, and/or multiple languages. Ensure the project team is aware of what will be required to implement an Experience Management (XM) transformation program in an implementation; ensuring implementation issues can be rapidly identified and mitigated prior to any escalations.

Task.Name: Self-Enable on SAP Central Business Configuration
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to learn about SAP Central Business Configuration and the Project Experience. Procedure: Learn about SAP Central Business Configuration using the Learning Journey: SAP S/4HANA Cloud – SAP Central Business Configuration accelerator in the SAP Learning Hub. The learning journey accelerator contains openSAP courses focused on SAP Central Business Configuration and periodically updated What’s New – SAP Central Business Configuration eLearning courses to help you stay up-to-date on release innovations. All openSAP courses are free of charge. Review the Help - SAP Central Business Configuration accelerator for SAP Central Business Configuration Project Experience. Use the Tutorial Library for SAP Central Business Configuration accelerator to, step-by-step, learn how to navigate and use different features and apps of the tool. You can also access the tutorials within SAP Central Business Configuration from the in-app help.

ExtendedAttribute.Value: Application Design and Configuration, Customer Team Enablement

Task.Name: Self-Enable on the Fit-to-Standard Process
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to learn about the Fit-to-Standard process so effective discussion around solution configuration can take place during the Fit-to-Standard workshops. Every customer needs to go through a series of Fit-to-Standard workshops to create a backlog to adjust the out of the box settings to optimize the solution based on customer specific requirements. The backlog of requirements will be further refined during the planning and design workshops, to plan for work during the Realize phase. Self-enabling on these topics will help the project team members understand what needs to be documented before, during, and after the fit-to-standard workshops. Procedure: Review the How to Approach Fit-to-Standard Analysis accelerator to learn the Fit-to-Standard process overall and to learn what to expect during each phase. Review the How to Approach Remote Fit-to-Standard Workshops accelerator if the Fit-to-Standard workshops are to be conducted in a remote setting. Review the Blog - Fit-to-Standard How Does It Support the Picture? accelerator to learn how the Fit-to-Standard supports the overall implementation project. Review the Blog - Fit-to-Standard: Input and Output accelerator to deep dive into details of the process. Review the Blog - Fit-to-Standard: Mural Template to learn how to facilitate the workshop with online tools in a remote setting. Procedure Note(s): See product specific accelerator when available.

ExtendedAttribute.Value: Application Design and Configuration, Customer Team Enablement

Task.Name: Self-Enable on SAP S/4HANA Migration Cockpit
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to learn about data migration including the SAP S/4HANA migration cockpit. The SAP S/4HANA migration cockpit is a template-based migration solution built into SAP S/4HANA and SAP S/4HANA Cloud. Apps Used: Migrate Your Data Procedure: View the Introducing the SAP S/4HANA Migration Cockpit click-through tutorial to understand the process of using SAP S/4HANA Migration Cockpit (Migrate Your Data app). The tutorial can be accessed via the SAP S/4HANA Cloud Tutorials accelerator. Use the path: Implementation and Configuration Tutorials → SAP S/4HANA Data Migration. Review the overview presentation Accel ID = S4H_2034. Please be aware that there are 2 migration approaches included in the Migrate your Data app: Migrate Data using Staging Tables and Migrate Data Directly from SAP system. Review the following Solution Process accelerators: Accel ID = BPSI_2Q2. If you plan to use staging tables with remote database connection, check the set-up instructions. Data Migration to SAP S/4HANA from SAP (BH3) The communication arrangement setup is necessary for using the Direct Transfer approach and is include in the set-up instructions. Review the content in the Help - Data Migration accelerator. This includes sections on Getting Started, Learning, Application Help, Migration Objects, Project Organization. Select the topics in the graphic. Review Upgrade and Maintenance Schedule - 3 System Landscape and Hotfix Collection Deployment Restrictions.pdf to know when there is no access to the system due to an upgrade or system maintenance. Include these periods in your migration project planning. Review the SAP S/4HANA Migration Cockpit - Data Migration Testing in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition to gain insights on testing. Open the SAP S/4HANA Migration Cockpit Community and view the related community information. Find additional insight via community blogs using the Blogs - Migration Cockpit Search in the SAP Community with SAP S/4HANA Cloud tag accelerator. Find Knowledge Based Articles (KBA) using the Notes - Migration Cockpit Search in SAP for Me accelerator. Access the SAP S/4HANA migration cockpit to gain hands-on experience.

Task.Name: Self-Enable on Test Management and Tools
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to enable the team on the chosen test management and tools for the project. Risk-based test planning helps to analyze the impact of SAP software changes on critical business processes and provides adequate test plan proposals. SAP customers who have already a defined test solution from partners or third parties, have the choice of using it in combination with test management apps in SAP Cloud ALM (Cloud Application Lifecycle Management) and the Test Automation Tool. Procedure: Review the Test Strategy for Cloud-Centric Customer and the Test Management Overview via the SAP Cloud ALM for Implementation accelerator which covers testing challenges in Cloud ALM (if using SAP Cloud ALM for Implementation). Follow the path: Capabilities > Test: Planning, Manual Testing, Test Automation > Test Management Overview. Review the SAP S/4HANA Cloud Tutorials accelerator for enablement on the Test Automation Tool. Follow the path: Implementation and Configuration > SAP S/4HANA Cloud - Test Automation Tool. Review the SAP Cloud ALM Tutorials accelerator for enablement on SAP Cloud ALM. Follow the path: Implementation > Management Competence. Review the Test Management Guide accelerator for SAP S/4HANA Cloud test management and best practices. Review selected third party testing automation tool documentation, if applicable. Procedure Note(s): To access the documents from the SAP Cloud ALM for Implementation Support Portal, see the SAP Cloud ALM for Implementation accelerator and choose Capabilities and expand the: Planning, Manual Testing, Test Automation Section. For additional information and blogs on the Test Automation Tool, refer to the Blogs - SAP S/4HANA Cloud Test Automation Tool Tag in the SAP Community accelerator.

Task.Name: Self-Enable on Artificial Intelligence Technologies
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to become familiar with the Artificial Intelligence technologies and scenarios that are supported by SAP S/4HANA Cloud Artificial Intelligence technology offerings are available to support SAP S/4HANA Cloud customers either embedded directly within SAP S/4HANA Cloud or a side by side service offering in SAP Business Technology Platform. Machine Leaning, Situational Handling and Augmented Analytics are examples of technologies embedded within SAP S/4HANA Cloud. SAP Build Process Automation is available as a service within SAP BTP to be consumed as a standalone service. Procedure: Review the help documentation available for SAP Build Process Automation using accelerator Help - SAP Build Process Automation Review the accelerator Blog - Resources and journey to machine learning with SAP S/4HANA for guidance on the usage of Machine Learning use cases for SAP S/4HANA Cloud Review the help documentation available for Situation Handling using the accelerator Help - Situation Handling

Task.Name: Self-Enable on SAP S/4HANA Cloud Embedded Analytics
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to learn about embedded analytics in SAP S/4HANA Cloud. It enables a customer to get started with SAP S/4HANA embedded analytics and integrate with best-in-class analytical platform and solutions from SAP. Procedure: Review the learning content in the Blogs - SAP S/4HANA Embedded Analytics Tag in the SAP Community accelerator. Review the Help - SAP S/4HANA Cloud Analytics accelerator. Review scope items available for SAP Best Practices for Analytics with SAP S/4HANA Cloud accelerator. Review the Help - SAP S/4HANA Cloud Analytics accelerator to learn the following: The foundations of embedded analytics Integrations with embedded Analytics and the solutions available Insights and updates from Community experts Review and learn all available Learning Journeys for the embedded analytics topic via the Help - SAP Learning Journeys accelerator. Follow the path: click the Help - SAP Learning Journeys accelerator > search with the terms “embedded analytics.” Self-enable and review the courses in the OpenSAP - SAP S/4HANA Embedded Analytics accelerator. Self-enable using the SAP Enterprise Support content by referring to the SAP community blogs SAP Blog: 5 Steps 2 Analytics in SAP S/4HANA and SAP Blog: Expert Guided Implementation - SAP S/4HANA embedded analytics accelerators.

Task.Name: Self-Enable on Extensibility
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to learn about the various Extensibility scenarios that are supported in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition. Procedure: Review the Extend SAP S/4HANA in the cloud and on premise with ABAP based extensions to become familiar with the guidelines for choosing extensibility options within SAP S/4HANA Cloud. Review the ABAP Cloud - Technical Use Cases and Recommended Technologies to understand the recommended technologies for various extensibility use cases. Review the SAP Extensibility Explorer to determine sample scenarios and extensibility patterns. Review the Open SAP course - Introduction to ABAP in Cloud listed in the accelerator section below. Refer to the SAP Community - ABAP Extensibility topic for additional discussions and enablement content on Extensibility topics within SAP S/4HANA Cloud. Review the accelerator Solution Standardization Board (SSB) [public cloud] for information about governance that SAP introduced for SAP S/4HANA Cloud customers to help them stay as close to the SAP standards as possible. Procedure Note(s): Extensibility for key users is deactivated by default within the customizing tenant of the Starter System. Extensibility can be activated with Fiori application "Extensibility Settings". Refer to SAP Note - 2283716 - Key User Application is not configured for additional information. Refer to Blog - SAP S/4HANA Extensibility: All You Need to Know for more details about extensibility options and use cases. Use the SAP Help links Help - Key User Extensibility and Help - Developer Extensibility to access help materials for extensibility. Senior IT leaders should review this document to understand the extensibility options Accel ID = S4H_881.

Task.Name: Self-Enable on SAP Business Technology Platform
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to learn about SAP Business Technology Platform (SAP BTP) and its capabilities. SAP BTP is the foundation for the Intelligent Suite, our industry cloud, as well as extensions developed by our customers or partners. SAP BTP environments provide comprehensive application development services and capabilities that let customers develop new cloud applications, extend existing solutions, and integrate applications in the cloud. With SAP Extension Suite, customers can extend solutions in a fast and agile way without disrupting key business processes and via the SAP Integration Suite, customers can integrate various applications while securely connecting people, processes data ,and devices. Procedure: Review the accelerator SAP Business Technology Platform-Basic Concept to get an introduction to SAP BTP. Review the SAP Discovery Center accelerator to learn how to adopt SAP BTP and turn data into business value. Review the integration paper in the accelerator Accel ID = S4H.1541. In this paper, SAP provides customer proof points with key processes and gives an outlook of the innovation and integration scenarios that are yet to come. Also review the accelerator Integration Architecture Guide for Cloud and Hybrid Landscapes for guidance on the design of Integration Architecture. Review the following accelerators to familiarize yourself with the capabilities of SAP Business Technology Platform Integration Suite Cloud Integration using Integration Suite. Refer to accelerator Accel ID = S4H.1277. Consume and deploy predefined integration content provided by SAP. Refer to accelerators Accel ID = S4H_995. Transport Integration Content between CPI tenants. Refer to accelerator Accel ID = S4H_996. Review the following section to enable yourself on the Cloud Integration Automation Service. This setup option is provided for selected scope items. It will provide a guided workflow to integrate SAP cloud solutions. Supported integration scenarios are published in the ‘Plan for Cloud Integration Scenario’ tile on the Accel ID = S4H.0620. Verify with the project manager that scope items with Cloud Integration Automation Service option are in the project scope. Make yourself familiar with this service by reading the accelerator Accel ID = S4H_983. Also see related accelerator Accel ID = S4H_524. Make yourself familiar with release information, maintenance, and interoperability of the service in Accel ID = S4H_525. Review the accelerator Accel ID = S4H_870. Customers can build reports, dashboards, and visuals into their business application to make confident decisions. Review SAP BTP Guided Answers for an interactive documentation designed to help troubleshoot issues, navigate processes and guide through tasks Procedure Notes: RISE with SAP and GROW with SAP customers receive a specified amount of CPEA credits that can consumed using services on SAP Business Technology Platform. Customers can contact their SAP representative for questions regarding the credits, usage, and pricing. This Cloud Integration Automation Service has to be subscribed to and instantiated in your BTP Global Account. Refer to task 'Subscribe to Cloud Integration Automation Service in BTP' for further details. Reflect your BTP Architecture and extensions based on the Reference Architecture Content in LeanIX. Check with your SAP Account Executive on license entitlement of LeanIX products.

Task.Name: Self-Enable on SAP BTP Apps
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to self-enable on SAP delivered BTP business solution apps and services. Prerequisite: A finalized list of SAP BTP Apps to be setup based on the scope items that were selected in Discover Assessment phase. Procedure: Go to the Products with Integration Capabilities section within the accelerator Help - S/4HANA Cloud Integration and locate the corresponding SAP BTP apps and review the product related feature and scope descriptions. The SAP BTP Apps listed below are examples of how the SAP BTP Apps can be implemented and integrated with S/4HANA Cloud with an enhanced degree of automation. Help - SAP Cloud for Real Estate Help - SAP Market Rates Management, Bring Your Own Rates data option Help - SAP S/4HANA Cloud for Projects Help - SAP Subscription BIlling Help - Central Invoice Management Help - SAP Ariba Buying For partner delivered integrated applications, reach out to the corresponding partner for Help and User documentation. Procedure Note(s): We recommend setting up this integration scenario using the Cloud Integration Automation Service. Cloud Integration Automation Service provides a guided workflow that features: Customer-specific system information (for example, target URLs) Reusable configuration settings between tasks Automated execution capabilities Please refer task Self-Enable on Cloud Integration Automation Service for additional details.

ExtendedAttribute.Value: Industry Cloud Apps, SAP BTP Apps

Task.Name: Self-Enable on SAP S/4HANA Cloud Identity and Access Management
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to learn about Identity and Access Management in SAP S/4HANA Cloud. Identity and Access Management (IAM) is the security control that allows the right individuals to access the appropriate resources during the authorized time for the authorized reasons. In SAP S/4HANA Cloud, the IAM launchpad enable customers to view, monitor and control business users, business roles, business catalogs and access restrictions. Procedure: Review the learning content in the Open SAP - Accelerating IAM Activities with SAP Activate accelerator with SAP Activate to learn on how to use the SAP Activate Methodology to identify the relevant IAM tasks in your implementation project. Review the learning content in the Open SAP - User Management Overview - SAP S/4HANA Cloud Deployment accelerator to learn how to first access the SAP S/4HANA Cloud systems. Review the Blog - SAP S/4HANA Cloud, Identity and Access Management – SAP Enterprise Support Academy recorded learning accelerator to learn the following: The foundations of IAM in SAP S/4HANA Cloud The IAM tools available in SAP S/4HANA Cloud The implementation methodology of IAM in SAP S/4HANA Cloud The authorization concept, project planning and project phases of IAM Procedure Note(s): Use Help - Identity and Access Management and Help - Authorization and User Concept in SAP S/4HANA Cloud for reference

Task.Name: Project Initiation and Governance
Task.Notes: The purpose of the Project Initiation and Governance deliverable is to formally recognize that a new project exists and to initiate the work on the project. During this time the project sponsor and project manager work to align stakeholders – such as customers, partners and SAP management – around a project and its scope, provide updated information for planning, and obtain a commitment to proceed. As part of the initiation activities, the project manager conducts handover from pre-project phase, creates a project charter document, scope statement document and establishes the project governance that ensures proper management process for the project. This ensures alignment between the implementation partner(s), the customer's project team, company's strategic direction, and the satisfaction of operational requirements.

ExtendedAttribute.Value: 2nd Wave Project / Rollout Project, GROW Adoption Plan

Task.Name: Create Project Charter and Scope Statement
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to create a project charter and scope statement. If you skip this task, the project is not formally approved by the customer sponsor and the project manager is not authorized to apply organizational resources to project activities. Also, the scope of the project will not be understood. Procedure: Develop the project charter by reviewing documents from the pre-project negotiation process and through interactive meetings with the customer to facilitate an understanding of the project’s goals, business case, external assumptions, and constraints. The project charter clearly and explicitly defines the objectives of the project, analyzes all possible benefits, and quantifies benefits in financial terms, and illustrates clearly project acceptance criteria. This information and supporting documents align key stakeholders around the strategic intent of the project. Please feel free to utilize the Project Charter Template accelerator as a reference template. Produce a reviewed and approved scope statement that is documented and communicated to the project team, enabling integrated change control. The scope statement facilitates an initial understanding of the project scope and associated project-related assumptions and constraints. The project scope statement evolves through the initiation and planning of the project and clearly and explicitly defines Key Performance Indicators (KPIs), tolerances, and deliverables of the project. This information and supporting documents align key stakeholders around what the project is going to deliver. Please feel free to utilize the Scope Statement Template accelerator as a reference template. Assess whether the customer has existing: Organizational policies and procedures, standard product and project life cycles, and quality policies Standardization guidelines and work instructions Guidelines and criteria for tailoring the organization’s set of standard processes to satisfy the specific needs of the project Organizational communication requirements, data retention policies and security requirements Procedures for issue and defect management, including controls, identification and resolution, and action item tracking Change control procedures, including the steps by which the company modifies, approves, and validates official company standards, policies, plans, and procedures as well as project documents Risk control procedures including: probability definition and impact, risk categories, and probability and impact matrix

ExtendedAttribute.Value: 2nd Wave Project / Rollout Project, GROW Adoption Plan

Task.Name: Establish Project Governance
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to establish project governance. Project governance is a management framework setup for the project to ensure the decisions are made in a structured manner. The project governance establishes a policy for the project team, project stakeholders, executives and system integrator that clearly specifies roles, responsibilities, accountability, and organizational setup. The project governance provides a decision making framework that is robust and logical in order to ensure the decisions are made timely and on an appropriate level. Procedure: Establish various levels of governance structure according to committee’s daily tasks and duties. Place Executive Sponsors & Steering Committee in level 1 and 2. The responsibilities in these levels include: Business priorities, goals and objectives Decision rights and decisions criteria Ownership: change, process & data Economic justification and funding prioritization Place Project Management Office in Level 3. The responsibilities in this level includes: On time, On Budget, On Value monitoring Process strategy development Drive Business Standardization & Best Practices Adoption Prioritization criteria and deployment options IT requirements and dependencies Communication Place Project team in Level 4. The responsibilities in this level includes: Day-to-day execution and delivery of project tasks, identifying, documenting and resolving issues and risk within the framework of their authority. Identification, resolution and communication of issues and risk to PMO Status reporting and communication to the PM Please find below a graphical example:

ExtendedAttribute.Value: 2nd Wave Project / Rollout Project, GROW Adoption Plan, Localization, Parallel Project Line

Task.Name: Establish Solution Standardization Board
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to provide guidance on the setup and execution of governance activities with Solution Standardization Board (SSB). The role of the SSB is to act as a body overseeing the compliance with 5 Golden Rules and Clean Core philosophy. It is approving all extensions, integrations, data activities, adoption of processes deviating from these rules and philosophy. The SSB governance is setup in the customer IT organization and reports to the project sponsor and steering committee (after the initial go-live it will transition to report to CIO or COO during the Run phase). Procedure: Review the Solution Standardization Board template Determine participants, structure of the board and meeting cadence Schedule SSB meetings as required Define process for reviewing / approving and documenting the objects that go beyond the 5 Golden Rules for deployment of the SAP Solution following the Clean Core philosophy

ExtendedAttribute.Value: Application Design and Configuration, Extensibility, Integration, Project Management

Task.Name: Establish the Center of Expertise
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to set up a Customer Center of Expertise (Customer COE). The Customer COE is a core team of experts that will drive the realization of tangible business value via the SAP solution(s). They are drivers for continuous success and are crucial to maximizing the return on investment. This team will have or develop strong SAP skills and knowledge, and by collaborating with their business's key teams, be in the best position to identify the solution functionalities that will best meet the business priorities. Procedure: Review the Customer COE guidance in the Accel ID = S4H_911. This includes the resources “Customer COE Intro”, “Customer COE One Pager” and “Customer COE Accreditation Guide” listed under the heading “Customer COE Must Haves” Create the Customer Center of Expertise as per the guidance in the “Customer COE Accreditation Guide”. Submit the questionnaire in the Accreditation guidance to gain your Customer COE Accreditation.

ExtendedAttribute.Value: 2nd Wave Project / Rollout Project, GROW Adoption Plan, Hybrid Deployment (Two-Tier ERP)

Task.Name: Define Project Communications and Reporting
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to define and agree on the project communications and reporting strategies. Procedure: Identify who needs to see what information, when, and how, in addition to the intent of each message. The project manager defines the project’s communication strategy. Distribute information to the steering committee, senior management, the project team, subject matter experts, clients, contractors, and other internal or external personnel. Define the communication strategy, so that it also involves determining which key project deliverables are communicated. (for example, objectives/scope, project schedules, work plans, project status reports, cost information, and so on). Define the frequency and format of the regular status reports that the project manager and project teams provide to the key stakeholders. Use the Project Status Report for SAP Activate/S/4HANA accelerator throughout the whole process to provide a status of the overall project to interested parties. Create a Communication Plan using the Communication Plan Overview template accelerator as a starting point. The purpose of the creation of Communication Plan is to define the communication rules and how information will be distributed to and feedback received from all stakeholders. It serves as a guide for communications throughout the life of the project. It is a working document that defines: Stakeholder communication requirements Communication approval process Define the Risk Management process by completing the Sample Risk Register and Sample Stakeholder Management Plan accelerators.

ExtendedAttribute.Value: 2nd Wave Project / Rollout Project, GROW Adoption Plan

Task.Name: Project Plans, Schedule and Budget
Task.Notes: The purpose of this deliverable is to plan activities during the early stages of the project, including the development of project plans, preparation of project WBS, definition of the project schedule and budget development. The project management plan development is critical for ensuring the project is managed according to structured approach that covers all aspects of project management necessary for size and complexity of the project. The project management plan is a comprehensive document (or collection of documents), including plans for managing the schedule, budget, issues, risk, project changes, etc. The management plans cover all PMI PMBOK knowledge areas as appropriate. Once the project scope is refined and the work breakdown structure (WBS) is developed, the project manager and planning team define and sequence required tasks. With dependencies identified, the project manager adds resources, estimated effort (hours), and estimated duration to create an initial draft of the project schedule. As requirements are identified, the project schedule and budget are refined.

ExtendedAttribute.Value: 2nd Wave Project / Rollout Project, GROW Adoption Plan, Upgrade

Task.Name: Create Project Schedule and Budget
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to create a project schedule and budget. Procedure: Create a project schedule. The detailed project schedule defines the work to be performed, the resources and associated time commitments required for the project, and the individual phases of the project. The work breakdown structure (WBS) serves as the foundation for the project schedule and deliverables to be produced as part of the project. Ensure, at a minimum, the project schedule includes: Deliverables and tasks for the current phase Estimated effort (work) and duration Task dependencies (such as predecessors and successors) Scheduled start and finish dates for each task, based on dependencies Task constraints (such as must-start-on date and must-finish-on date) Resources assigned to each task High-level schedule for subsequent phases Transport freeze periods related to software updates Set the first approved Schedule as the Project Baseline. Elaborate this schedule during subsequent planning activities during the project, using a “rolling wave” planning approach. Create a project budget, that outlines all the costs associated with the project, including labor, hardware, software, cloud provisioning, contracting fees, and facilities. Set the budget baseline and will manage the budget according to the cost management plan that is developed as part of the Project Management Plans task. Maintain the project budget throughout the whole project.

ExtendedAttribute.Value: 2nd Wave Project / Rollout Project, GROW Adoption Plan, Upgrade

Task.Name: Assign Resources and Refine Project Tasks in SAP Cloud ALM
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to expand the task template and assign teams or people to tasks in SAP Cloud ALM. The task template assigned during the project creation provides the essential elements for implementing SAP solutions and flexibility for expansion to meet the project needs for additional supporting deliverables and tasks. Resource assignment is critical in managing work as well as ensuring proper reporting in the SAP Cloud ALM Dashboard. Procedure: Determine use of Teams, Roles, Responsibilities and Individuals in the Task list. Setup Teams and Roles. See the ‘Best Practices’ section and topic, ‘Roles, Teams, and User Assignment’ in the SAP Cloud ALM for Implementation - Expert Portal accelerator for additional information. Review the project tasks and add new deliverables and tasks as necessary. See topic Project and Task Management > Project Tasks in the SAP Cloud ALM for Implementation - Expert Portal accelerator. Assign users to project tasks. Procedure Note(s): Reporting should be considered in the formulation of Teams, Roles, and Tasks. See topic ‘Analytics’ in the SAP Cloud ALM for Implementation - Expert Portal accelerator for more information.

ExtendedAttribute.Value: 2nd Wave Project / Rollout Project, GROW Adoption Plan

Task.Name: Align Project Schedules
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to align the product schedules for the products in an integrated scenario. Procedure: Review and align individual project schedules accordingly. Key milestones to be considered are: Different system landscapes provisioning (including integrated applications) System landscape configuration start date System landscape configuration completion date Testing in the Test System and migrate to Production System (including integrated applications). System operations related to Software updates schedule. Ensure the overall master schedule is updating accordingly.

ExtendedAttribute.Value: 2nd Wave Project / Rollout Project, GROW Adoption Plan, Industry Cloud Apps, Upgrade

Task.Name: Project Standards, Infrastructure, and Solution
Task.Notes: The purpose of this deliverable is to provide consistent means of executing and governing project work in an efficient and effective manner. The key objective of Project Standards is to identify, define, approve, and communicate standards related to project execution. Where and when applicable, the current customer processes and procedures, related to the project standards should be taken into account when defining the most suitable standards for the project. Requirements and Constraints Project support tools have been set up already.

Task.Name: Define Project Standards
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to identify, define, approve, and communicate standards related to project execution. Project standards provide a consistent means of executing and governing project work in an efficient and effective manner. Project standards are elaborated throughout the Prepare phase (some may be fine-tuned in a later stage of the project). Procedure: Establish, at minimum, the project standards for the following areas: Requirements Management Business Process Modeling Solution Configuration and Documentation Custom Code / Development Authorizations / Security Test Planning and Execution Change and Release Management Post-implementation Support and Operations. Define, approve, and communicate foundational project standards to the project team. Include project communication standards in project on-boarding for project team members. Manage changes in accordance with the integrated change control procedure.

Task.Name: Set Up Project Team Logistics and Infrastructure
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to establish a project team environment and ensure that team members have the necessary access levels. For on-site or hybrid project delivery, also account for physical access to the customer facility and project room. The project manager, in collaboration with the technical team, will address the setup of the following areas (the questions in each section are designed to provide guidance). Procedure: Setup the following areas (the questions in each section provide guidance): Project Experience: Is there a requirement for hardware (e.g. servers, laptops, etc.)? Are additional software licenses needed? Have they been purchased? Are additional consulting services required? Has the software been installed for the project team members? Is there a designated area for the project equipment? Is the project equipment located in different geographical sites? IT Infrastructure and Access Is Wi-Fi or LAN access available to the project team? Has the Wi-Fi or LAN access been tested? Is white listing required? Have soft token / hard token requirements been communicated? Has IT access been granted for: E-mail Internet and/or Intranet access Team collaboration tools like Sharepoint, Jira, Slack MS Office with Teams Customer Policies Is there a specific project policy applicable (e.g., communication, confidentiality, backup)? Has the project policy been communicated? Telephone / Voicemail: Is there a central repository with each team member's contact details? Project Team Member Equipment Is the required equipment (computer, laptops, mobile devices, etc) available to all project team members? Are office supplies available to the project members (on-site / hybrid)? Are the necessary software licenses purchased (if needed)? Physical Project Environment (on-site or hybrid only): Has the required workspace been arranged at all project sites? Are sufficient conference rooms planned for the project team? Has multimedia equipment been planned for all conference rooms (e.g., video conferencing, projectors)? Has physical access been granted for all project team members at different geographical sites? Is there a working area assigned to the project members? Physical Security (on-site or hybrid only): Has all necessary access been granted at different project sites? Have all site policies been communicated (e.g., security, safety, emergency exits)? Use the Project Guideline Template accelerator below to provide new project members with the essential information needed to understand the project and its associated administrative and technical regulations for setup.

Task.Name: Verify Project Team Certification and Experience for SAP S/4HANA Cloud
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to ensure that the project team members at least have the minimum level of knowledge and experience needed to successfully implement an SAP S/4HANA Cloud system. It’s imperative that every implementation team member hold the SAP S/4HANA Cloud certifications in the areas they are working and that the service lead/project manager and Finance lead have hands-on experience on a successful SAP S/4HANA Cloud implementation project. Procedure: Project Team Certification Ask the team members for their personal SAP Acclaim link. After passing an SAP certification test the individual will have received instructions on how to claim the link. The link will be in the following format: https://www.youracclaim.com/user/<unique name> Load the individual’s Acclaim link. If the page is not found, then confirm the link with the individual. Check the individual’s Acclaim certification page to determine if the individual holds the certifications required by their role on the project. The service lead, project manager, solution architect, and technical architects should have a current "SAP Certified Application Associate - SAP S/4HANA Cloud Onboarding". The functional consultants should have an “SAP Certified Application Associate – S4HC [name] Implementation” where “name” is the Line of Business each consultant will be working with. If the necessary certifications are not held then ensure a plan is in place for the person to obtain the certification before project kickoff. Repeat this check prior to project kickoff. Project Team Experience Ask the team members if they have hands-on experience implementing an SAP S/4HANA Cloud system that has successfully gone live and is in productive use. If the individual does not have hands-on experience, then consider filling that role with a person who does have experience. If that is not possible then initiate a mentoring/oversight relationship with an individual who has experience in that role. It is strongly recommended that teams new to SAP S/4HANA Cloud utilize SAP Value Assurance service for their first implementation. Please contact your Partner Business Manager for more information.

Task.Name: Create a Document Repository for the Implementation Project Team
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to determine and create a document repository for the project implementation team. Procedure: Determine a document repository for the project. A quality document repository allows teams to collaborate and share documents in real time for status updates, event meetings, milestone creation, and internal/external communications to accelerate learning, collaboration, and adoption. The project team should agreed which document repository system works best for their implementation project. Ensure a repository is created and all project team members have access.

Task.Name: Project Kick-Off and On-Boarding
Task.Notes: The purpose of this deliverable is to kick-off the project and ensure that all needed information is shared with the project team resources, key stakeholders, and anybody involved in the project. The goal of the kickoff meeting is to ensure that everybody involved in the project understands the goals and objectives of the project, as well as the schedule that the project team will follow, which is one of the key ingredients for a successful project execution.

ExtendedAttribute.Value: 2nd Wave Project / Rollout Project, GROW Adoption Plan

Task.Name: On-board Project Team
Task.Notes: The purpose of this activity is to prepare the onboarding package for external consultants and new project team members from SAP and partner companies coming to the project. The onboarding package contains the essential information that each new team member needs to understand, which is the purpose of the project, goals, operating procedures, and other key information. Procedure: Ensure the onboarding package contains all the necessary information to properly onboard the team members. The onboarding package typically contains the following information: Project objectives, scope, and goals including SAP solutions being implemented Project schedule including milestones Project governance including key project stakeholders Organizational chart for the project- showing both internal and external resources Outline of regular project meetings Travel policies, dress code, project location, and other project guidelines as needed.

ExtendedAttribute.Value: 2nd Wave Project / Rollout Project, GROW Adoption Plan

Task.Name: Conduct Kickoff Workshop
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to schedule, prepare, and conduct the project kickoff meeting. Procedure: Finalize the attendance list for the kickoff meeting. Participants typically include: project team, key stakeholders, project sponsor and company executives. Schedule the kickoff meeting. Some resources may attend the kickoff meeting remotely; in such cases it is important to ensure good audio and video infrastructure so the remote participants can take full part in the kickoff meeting session. Use the Project Kick-off Template accelerator as a template to prepare kickoff meeting materials specific to your project. Conduct the Project Team Kickoff Meeting. The kickoff meeting should include discussion of project objectives, organizational structure, roles and responsibilities, project governance, schedule, scope, communication standards, change request process, and decision making process. The project manager should also utilize the meeting to ensure a mutual understanding of the Project Plan. Furthermore, the project manager can use this meeting to communicate methods that will be used to manage and control the project.

ExtendedAttribute.Value: 2nd Wave Project / Rollout Project, GROW Adoption Plan

Task.Name: Change Concept
Task.Notes: The purpose of this deliverable is to create the foundation for the organizational change management support of the SAP implementation project. By discussing and aligning on relevant aspects of the change management set-up, it promotes a shared understanding among key project stakeholders. This clarity regarding the scope and benefits of organizational change management helps to manage expectations and prevents unrealistic assumptions. The change concept should be developed at the beginning of the project and only modified when significant parameters of the organizational change management delivery are adjusted, such as resource replacements or scope changes.

ExtendedAttribute.Value: GROW Adoption Plan, Organizational Change Management

Task.Name: Define Organizational Change Management Roles
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to identify the responsibilities related to providing organizational change management support for the SAP project. Depending on the project’s specific characteristics, such as scope, complexity, number of affected users, and anticipated change impacts, one or more roles for organizational change management need to be established. Common roles in larger implementation projects include the change management lead, change management expert, and communication expert. It is important to clearly distinguish and document the respective areas of responsibility and duties in a transparent manner. Procedure: Assess the anticipated level of effort needed for organizational change management in the SAP implementation project. Describe roles and responsibilities, referring to the section “Typical Project Roles for Organizational Change Management” in the How do you set up Organizational Change Management for your Cloud Project accelerator. Align and agree with the project leadership team on role descriptions, and incorporate the documented information into the Change Concept accelerator.

ExtendedAttribute.Value: GROW Adoption Plan, Organizational Change Management

Task.Name: Staff Organizational Change Management Resources
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to ensure that organizational change management for the SAP project is carried out by qualified resources. In smaller implementation projects, a project team member may handle change management activities in addition to their primary project role. In larger and more complex programs, it may be necessary to assign multiple resources, either on a full-time or part-time basis. If internal resources are unavailable, engaging external consultants is recommended. This option becomes particularly valuable when there is a desire to develop internal change management expertise. Procedure: Identify potential organizational change management resources. Familiarize yourself with the video “Acting as a Change Manager in Cloud Projects,” accessible by scrolling down the Which Skills do you bring along to act as a Change Manager accelerator. Evaluate skills using the Individual Skill Assessment – Analysis accelerator. Interpret ratings with the Individual Skill Assessment – Results accelerator. Assign organizational change management resources and document their assignments, including their available time for project work, in the Change Concept accelerator.

Task.Name: Define Organizational Change Management Set-up
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to establish the integration of organizational change management within the project organization. This step is essential for determining the governance structure and reporting line. While often overlooked, it is equally important to discuss the delivery approach for organizational change management. This includes fundamental principles, success criteria, scope, and overall objectives. Reaching an agreement on these aspects within the core project team helps to create a shared understanding of organizational change management and sets the strategic direction of future activities. Procedure: Integrate organizational change management within the project organization, utilizing the video “Organizational Change Management in the Project Organization” accessible when scrolling down in the How do you set up Organizational Change Management for your Cloud Project accelerator, and define governance and communication structure. Develop and agree on the shared understanding of organizational change management for the SAP implementation project. Collaborate with the project leadership team to ensure alignment of the developed content, and incorporate the documentation into the Change Concept accelerator.

Task.Name: Change Plan
Task.Notes: The purpose of this deliverable is to provide a high-level overview of the organizational change management activities supporting the SAP implementation project. Typically, the change plan is organized into distinct sections, each addressing a specific area of action that will be managed by the change management team, such as change communication. The change plan is closely aligned with the overall project plan, ensuring synchronization. Change management activities are scheduled in accordance with the project milestones and reflect the specific requirements of the different project phases. Initially, the focus is typically on generating awareness and securing commitment for the project. As the project nears completion, the emphasis shifts towards adequately preparing users for the upcoming go-live. Whenever modifications are made to the project plan, the change plan must be adjusted accordingly.

ExtendedAttribute.Value: GROW Adoption Plan, Organizational Change Management

Task.Name: Determine Action Areas for Organizational Change Management
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to establish a focused approach to organizational change management, maximizing its value for the SAP implementation project. This involves differentiating between essential activities (“must have”) and optional activities (“nice to have”). By discussing priorities and determining general action areas for organizational change management, the project team gains clarity. This process also aids in managing expectations and defining the scope of organizational change management. The identified action areas serve as the foundation for developing a more detailed change plan. Procedure: Identify people-related challenges of the SAP implementation project. Explore both the current strengths and weaknesses of the organization in addressing these challenges. Collaborate with the project leadership team to identify essential areas of action for organizational change management, and document them in the Change Plan accelerator.

ExtendedAttribute.Value: GROW Adoption Plan, Organizational Change Management

Task.Name: Develop First Version of the Change Plan
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to break down the identified action areas in organizational change management activities. This step can be challenging due to the lack of complete information available. Therefore, the initial version of the change plan typically includes high-level activities, particularly for later project phases. These activities will need to be refined and detailed as the project progresses. However, it is recommended to establish an initial version of the change plan during the early stages of the project, as it serves as the “single point of truth” for all organizational change management activities. Procedure: Define high-level organizational change management activities for all action areas. Schedule activities according to project plan and project milestones. Document results in the Change Plan accelerator.

ExtendedAttribute.Value: GROW Adoption Plan, Organizational Change Management

Task.Name: Establish Updating Procedure for the Change Plan
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to ensure that the change plan is always well aligned with the project plan. Additionally, it involves integrating insights obtained throughout the project’s execution of organizational change management. This guarantees that the change plan consistently incorporates the most up-to-date information. This is important, as the change plan typically serves as a significant reference for reporting on the status of organizational change management. Procedure: Establish a regular updating cycle, such as biweekly or monthly, in accordance with project status reporting. Collect feedback on implemented activities, for instance, from business leaders, and assess the project timeline and milestones for any necessary changes. Incorporate updates in the Change Plan accelerator.

ExtendedAttribute.Value: GROW Adoption Plan, Organizational Change Management

Task.Name: Business Driven Configuration Assessment
Task.Notes: The purpose of this deliverable is to provide preliminary configuration and further insight into the customer's process based on the solution scope and the customer’s current operational processes. This information is used in planning and executing the fit-to-standard workshops (including maintenance of sample data to be used during fit-to-standard).

ExtendedAttribute.Value: 2nd Wave Project / Rollout Project, Artificial Intelligence Technology, Hybrid Deployment (Two-Tier ERP)

Task.Name: Perform Initial Business Process Assessment for SAP S/4HANA Cloud
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to discuss the customer’s current business processes to gain a foundational understanding of the business that can be used in the planning and the execution of the fit-to-standard workshops for SAP S/4HANA Cloud. The Business Driven Configuration Questionnaires can be leveraged by the configuration expert to help drive and document the business process discussion. Questions are written in business language, allow for customer responses, and provide a cross reference to self-service configuration activities. Procedure: Download the Business Driven Configuration Questionnaire accelerators that are applicable to the solution scope. Refine each questionnaire by eliminating questions that are not part of the implementation scope. Initiate a discussion with the Business Process Expert on the business’ process based on the refined questionnaires. Incorporate the findings in the planning of the fit-to-standard workshops. Add the links to the completed documents to this task in SAP Cloud ALM. Procedure Notes: The Business Driven Configuration questions are categorized by levels: Level 2 questions are geared to collect information prior to running the fit-to-standard workshops. The goal is to prevent stop/go execution of fit-to-standard workshops due to missing information. Level 3 questions provide more detailed information needed to make a business decision and define specific configuration values in the backlog during the Fit-to-Standard workshops. Note, level 1 questions are used during Discovery phase before signing contract. Use Digital Discovery Assessment tool when available. You must sign into the Roadmap Viewer to be able to view and download the Business Driven Configuration Questionnaires or other non-public accelerators. For customer who has an existing ERP system and adopting a Two-Tier enterprise resource planning (ERP) strategy to run their business with the S/4HANA Cloud implementation, use the Business Process Scope Questionnaire for Two Tier accelerator to determine the applicable scope for the implementation.

ExtendedAttribute.Value: 2nd Wave Project / Rollout Project, Artificial Intelligence Technology, Hybrid Deployment (Two-Tier ERP), Industry Cloud Apps, Localization, Parallel Project Line

Task.Name: Solution Scope
Task.Notes: The purpose of this deliverable is to determine and document the scope of the pre-configuration and, where applicable, data that will be deployed and available for the fit-to-standard workshops. The pre-configured system helps accelerate the implementation by providing commonly used executable scenarios in the SAP System to evaluate fit to the customer business processes.

ExtendedAttribute.Value: 2nd Wave Project / Rollout Project, Hybrid Deployment (Two-Tier ERP), Localization, Parallel Project Line

Task.Name: Determine Process Scope for SAP S/4HANA Cloud
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to determine the initial solution scope including standard content, integration, and extension scenarios for fit to standard workshops. This should also include a list of countries where localization is required. Scope developed during the Discovery phase and prior to the project start should be used as an input. Reference Discovery Assessment deliverable and tasks for details. Procedure: Review the results of the SAP Digital Discovery Report from the Discovery phase. For customer using SAP Cloud ALM, upload preselected in scope business processes from the report via Manage Scopes app. Review the scope items including country availability, descriptions, process flows, and test scripts. For customer using SAP Cloud ALM, access the information using the Processes app. The same information is also available in SAP Signavio Process Navigator for S/4HANA Cloud Confirm or revise what is in scope for the implementation project. For customer using SAP Cloud ALM, update scope in Processes app. Reference the Process Scoping section of the SAP Cloud ALM for Implementation - Expert Portal for more details. New solution processes can be created to account for scope not included in the solution process content for extension discussion during Fit-to-Standard workshops. For customers using SAP Cloud ALM, draft the new process using Processes app. Solution Processes that are not included in the solution process content but are fulfilled by integrated applications should also be captured and discussed during Fit-to-Standard workshops. Procedure Note(s): For customer who has an existing ERP system and adopting a Two-Tier enterprise resource planning (ERP) strategy to run their global business, select Two-Tier ERP in SAP Signavio Process Navigator for a list of supported processes. Please get in touch with SAP or Partner sales contact or email digitaldiscovery@sap.com to have a copy of discovery assessment if didn't export the report in Discovery phase. For Retail processes, review Retail Relevant Solution Processes and Scope Selection.xlsx to determine the project scope of industry-specific solution processes.

ExtendedAttribute.Value: 2nd Wave Project / Rollout Project, Hybrid Deployment (Two-Tier ERP), Industry Cloud Apps

Task.Name: Stakeholder Analysis
Task.Notes: The purpose of this deliverable is to get a systematic overview of the stakeholder landscape for the SAP implementation project. Project stakeholders are individuals or groups who can either be impacted by the project or have the ability to influence its outcome. Conducting a stakeholder analysis early on in the project is crucial as it provides clarity on how various individuals and groups view the project and the level of investment they hold in the project. Being aware of the stakeholders’ attitudes towards the SAP project and the power to influence the project success are the prerequisites for setting up a systematic stakeholder management.

Task.Name: Identify Stakeholders
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to get a comprehensive list and description of all impacted user groups and key individual stakeholders (e.g., top management members, IT and business leaders, process owners, or important project team members). This includes capturing information like the number, business unit allocation and geographic location of the various stakeholders. Stakeholders who share similar characteristics or requirements should be categorized into groups. This may include diverse user groups like controllers, recruiters, or production schedulers. The stakeholder identification is not only an input for the stakeholder analysis, but also the basis for setting up stakeholder specific training and communication activities. Overall, identifying stakeholders helps to customize organizational change management activities to the respective needs. Procedure: Identify IT and business areas affected by the project. Collect relevant data for stakeholder identification (e.g. org charts, user lists of legacy systems to be replaced, HR lists). Cluster and describe stakeholder groups in the Stakeholder List accelerator.

Task.Name: Assess Stakeholders
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to exchange and discuss the viewpoints and assumptions among designated project team members regarding the identified stakeholders of the SAP project, with the goal of establishing a common understanding. Using a matrix for positioning the various stakeholders allows to visualize existing assumptions regarding the stakeholders, to get a good mutual understanding of the stakeholders’ attitudes and engagement levels, and to anticipate the reactions towards the changes triggered by the implementation project. As a stakeholder assessment contains sensitive data, it is vital that the resulting documentation is handled with confidentiality. Procedure: Set up a workshop with the selected project representatives. Discuss the stakeholders’ level of influence and attitude towards the project and document the results in the Stakeholder Matrix accelerator. Map the stakeholders using the Stakeholder Matrix accelerator.

Task.Name: Derive Stakeholder Engagement Activities
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to identify interventions to influence the stakeholder landscape to both reduce concerns and resistance, and to foster understanding and commitment for the implementation project. Based on the results of the stakeholder assessment, the responsible project team members agree on activities such as rallying supporters, addressing and persuading opponents, organizing informational events, and scheduling training sessions. Deriving and documenting stakeholder management activities is not a one-time endeavor, but the starting point into an ongoing stakeholder management process. Procedure: Discuss results of stakeholder assessment. Document concrete stakeholder engagement activities in the Stakeholder Engagement Plan accelerator. Define review and update cadence.

Task.Name: Communication Analysis and Plan
Task.Notes: The purpose of this deliverable is to establish the foundation for effective and proficient change communication throughout the SAP project. Delivering the appropriate messages about the implementation project through the appropriate channels to the appropriate individuals at the appropriate time is crucial. It generates awareness and commitment for the SAP project, reduces uncertainty and resistance, and enhances motivation and user adoption. Therefore, it is recommended to allocate sufficient time for a comprehensive as-is analysis and a structured planning and implementation of the change communication during the initial stages of the implementation project.

Task.Name: Analyze Communication Channels
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to determine the best way to distribute information about the implementation project to the various stakeholder groups. To minimize the effort and expenses associated with change communication activities, it is recommended to utilize existing communication channels, such as collaboration platforms, intranet pages, newsletters, and meetings. Overall, it is important to ensure that the communication channels used by the implementation project are in line with the companies’ communication strategy and habits. Procedure: List and evaluate available communication channels using the Communication Channel Analysis accelerator. Select appropriate channels for different stakeholder groups. Define additional communication channels, if necessary.

Task.Name: Analyze Communication Needs
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to tailor change communication to meet the specific needs of the various impacted stakeholder groups. Typically, project stakeholders vary significantly in their knowledge level about the SAP implementation project and their information requirements to handle the changes associated with their respective roles. Furthermore, an SAP implementation project is often accompanied by distinct expectations, objectives, and concerns that must also be addressed. To effectively capture all relevant information while limiting the analysis effort to an appropriate level, the communication needs analysis should be conducted at an appropriate level of detail and with stakeholder groups clustered in a suitable manner. Procedure: Identify contact persons for each stakeholder group. Conduct short interviews to collect required information. Align and document interview results in the Communication Needs Analysis accelerator.

Task.Name: Create Communication Plan
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to provide a comprehensive outline of all intended communication actions concerning the SAP implementation project. The objective is to identify interrelationships and to synchronize different communication measures, regarding both the timing and messaging. Furthermore, taking a comprehensive approach to planning in advance ensures that the necessary resources for producing content and delivering communication activities are available. The communication activities should encompass a wide variety of approaches, for example: push channels (like e-mails), pull media (like videos), and both traditional and digital media. Moreover, it is important not only to provide information, but also to encourage and facilitate dialogue and engagement. Procedure: Review results from communication channel analysis and communication needs analysis. Derive and document concrete communication activities in the Communication Plan accelerator. Align communication plan with project management.

Task.Name: Fit-to-Standard Analysis Preparation
Task.Notes: The purpose of this deliverable is to prepare for the fit-to-standard workshops.

ExtendedAttribute.Value: Analytics, Application Design and Configuration, Extensibility, Integration
2nd Wave Project / Rollout Project, Artificial Intelligence Technology, Hybrid Deployment (Two-Tier ERP), Identity and Access Management
