Task.Name: Prepare for Fit-to-Standard Workshops
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to prepare for the Fit-to-Standard workshops. This involves reviewing project objectives, process scopes, solution design principles, and expected project value and benefits. Additionally, it includes preparing materials for the workshops and ensuring all participants have access to necessary tools and information. Prerequisites: Complete task Self-Enable on Fit-to-Standard Process. Procedure: Review project objectives, process scopes, solution design principles, and expected project value and benefits. Prepare material for workshops. For remote or hybrid fit-to-standard workshops, leverage the Fit-to-Standard Workshops - Mural Template accelerator to: Pre-fill with all the workshop enablement materials. Share with participants prior to the execution of workshops. Have participants fill out questions or topics in advance. Ensure all participants of the workshop have access to SAP Signavio Process Navigator for S/4HANA Cloud to understand standard business processes supported for the initial list of selected scope items from Discovery Assessment. For customers using SAP Cloud ALM, get familiar with the Processes app to view process information. Leverage sample template accelerators (i.e. Accel ID = PM_216, Accel ID = PM.45, Accel ID = S4H_966, Accel ID = PM.211) to create a tracker to capture requirements and notes to create a backlog. For customers who use SAP Cloud ALM, get familiar with the Requirements and Notes app. Determine how to categorize requirements (i.e., using Tag field or Workstream field for configuration vs customer-specific development, etc) to capture findings from the Fit-to-Standard workshop. Use the SAP S/4HANA Cloud Road Map Explorer or SAP S/4HANA Cloud - What's New Viewer to include the latest information when discussing potential customer-specific requirements. Access the Regulatory Change Manager tool to review current and upcoming regulatory changes and add topics to the fit-to-standard workshop in respective business process areas when needed. Schedule Fit-to-Standard workshops. Reference the sample schedules in the How to Approach Fit-to-Standard Analysis - S/4HANA Cloud.pptx accelerator to structure workshops by line of business, and, in some cases, more detailed workshops by business areas and subareas when needed. Ensure invites are sent and other logistics (i.e., meeting rooms, materials, tool access, etc.) are planned accordingly. Procedure Note(s): Although the Fit-to-Standard Workshops - Mural Template accelerator is specific for Mural, the template can be used as an example when creating a template in other collaboration tools. To create a new Mural from the Fit-to-Standard Workshops - Mural Template accelerator, a Mural license is required. Reference SAP Cloud ALM for Implementation - Expert Portal to learn about Fit-to-Standard Execution and Requirement Management using Process, Requirements and Notes apps. Digital Discovery Report with preselected in-scope business processes can be uploaded using the Manage Scope app in SAP Cloud ALM. See task Generate SAP Digital Discovery Report in Discovery phase on generating report. Output of the report can also be used in the Define Scope app in SAP Central Business Configuration. Reference task Set Up Starter Customizing and Development Tenants in SAP Central Business Configuration for details. Check Help - Regulatory Change Manager to learn more about how to use the tool. Select product-specific accelerator when applicable.

ExtendedAttribute.Value: 2nd Wave Project / Rollout Project, Hybrid Deployment (Two-Tier ERP)

Task.Name: Create Initial Integration and API List
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to create the initial integration and API list. Procedure: Download the template and make yourself familiar with the required information. Collect and document all known integrations (i.e. B2B, Third Party, etc.) from all sources (i.e. Digital Discovery Assessment, Board Decision, etc.). Provide this list to the participants of the fit-to-standard workshops and collect all current EDI integrations. Procedure Note(s): Store the list in a collaboration tool to avoid the creation of multiple lists with similar content. In case this is not possible, multiple lists need to be consolidated after the Fit-to-Standard workshops. The available APIs by SAP various products can be reviewed using the SAP Business Accelerator Hub Review accelerator API Data Download- Technical Setup Document to maintain communication management in S4HC environment. For any extract or download raw data from S/4HANA Cloud, review accelerator API Data Download Process which contain step-by-step process of downloading data. For SAP Integration with Concur solutions (SAP ICS) or any other customer-owned integration to connect your SAP Concur and SAP finance systems please see SAP Note Accel ID = S4H_2192.

Task.Name: Create Initial Artificial Intelligence List
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to prepare and distribute the template to be used to capture notes for various technology related to Artificial Intelligence (AI) during the fit-to-standard workshop. Procedure: Download the Artificial Intelligence - Questionnaire from the Accelerator section and answer the questions. Review the Situation Handling for SAP S/4HANA Cloud accelerator to become enabled on the situation handling types available and to help foster discussion on the types needed during the fit-to-standard workshops To view the relevant scope items, use the following accelerators SAP Build Process Automation : SAP Bot Store - Business Content for S/4HANA Cloud Machine Learning - Configuration Guide attached to SAP Best Practices - Embedded Machine Learning in S/4HANA Cloud Situation Handling - Help - Use Cases for Situation Handling For customer who uses Cloud ALM, Requirements and Notes app provides the ability to capture findings and Processes app has the ability to scope items for Artificial Intelligence enabled processes. Procedure Note(s): By selecting the appropriate Line of Business in Artificial Intelligence - Questionnaire, user can identify the AI related scope items as per their Business processes.

ExtendedAttribute.Value: 2nd Wave Project / Rollout Project, Artificial Intelligence Technology

Task.Name: Create Initial Analytics List for SAP S/4HANA Cloud
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to prepare and distribute the template to be used to capture notes for analytics (reports) during the fit-to-standard workshop(s). Procedure: Review the SAP S/4HANA Cloud Embedded Analytics - One Pagers accelerators to become enabled on the solution's analytical capabilities and help foster discussions on the reports and Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) needed during the fit-to-standard workshop(s). Download the Analytics List Template accelerator and distribute it to participants of the fit-to-standard workshop. Procedure Note(s): For customers who are using Cloud ALM, the Requirements and Notes app provides the ability to capture findings and Processes app has the ability to scope items for analytics.

Task.Name: Create Initial Application - Workplace List
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to create the initial Application - Workplace List that will be distributed to the fit-to-standard participants and used to capture notes for Identity and Access Management during the fit-to-standard workshops. The Application - Workplace List determines the application of each Scope Item and collects all required applications for the scope of the overall project. Procedure: Collect the Digital Discovery Assessment report. Review the How to Create Application - Workplace List accelerator to become enabled on how to download and create the Application-Workplace list. Create the Application - Workplace List and transfer the results of the Digital Assessment report to the list, selecting the relevant Scope Items. Filter the relevant Scope Items and applications in the Application - Workplace list and provide this list to the participants in the fit-to standard Workshops. Procedure Note(s): It is recommended to store the list in a central collaboration tool, for example SAP Jam, to avoid the creation of multiple lists with similar content. The SAP Fiori Apps Reference Library accelerator can be used to find S/4HANA Cloud apps. It is also the base to identify the required Business Catalogs and Business Roles. Use the IAM Information System app to determine the existing Business Catalogs that allow access to specific apps. To find the Business Catalogs, set the Main Entity = Application > enter the app name in the Search field > select 'Go.' Please consider that some applications in SAP S/4HANA Cloud aren't assigned to a specific Scope Item. You can find them in the Application-Workplace list, when you deselect the Scope Items.

ExtendedAttribute.Value: 2nd Wave Project / Rollout Project, Identity and Access Management

Task.Name: Review Data Protection Requirements and Functionality
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to prepare for implementing features that are relevant for data protection. Data protection is associated with numerous legal requirements and privacy concerns. It is important that data protection requirements and related solution functionality are considered during the fit-to-standard workshops. In addition to compliance with general data protection and privacy acts, it is necessary to consider compliance with industry-specific legislation in different countries. Procedure: Understand data privacy and protection regulation for the respective countries that are in scope for the project. Identify legal and corporate policies must be adhere to. Know the stakeholders, their roles and responsibilities in the process of data transfer. Understand company data and have use cases of features required. Get an overview of data protection topic that SAP supports, such as Consent, Read Access Logging, Information Retrieval, etc in the Accel ID = S4H_519. Review standard functionalities that help customer facilitate the compliance process in Accel ID = SSSP_DPP. For example: Data Protection and Privacy (5LE) Information Lifecycle Management (1KA) and Data controller and Purpose (6N9) Access the S/4HANA Cloud Data Model Considerations for Data Protection.pdf accelerator to understand the approach, the need and how solution features can help with compliance of data protection regulations. Procedure Note: SAP provides specific features and functions to support compliance with regard to relevant legal requirements. By nature of legal requirements, the conclusion whether these features are covering customer specific demands as well as the conclusion whether additional measures have to be taken is solely with the customer.

Task.Name: Review Tax Processing Solution
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to review tax solution in SAP S/4HANA Cloud and add agenda item for deep dive during Fit-to-Standard workshop. For example: US Jurisdictions Code Tax Code External Tax Package Time-Dependent Tax Calculation (TDT) Pro Rata VAT Registration for Indirect Taxation Abroad (RITA) Procedure: Review Help - Tax Processing accelerator for general tax processing related information, i.e. tax related to sales and purchases, withholding tax, etc. Select the country from the Help - Country/Region-Specific Functions accelerator, go to Finance section to review country specific information on tax. Go to Functions Relevant for Several Countries /Regions section in Help - Country/Region-Specific Functions accelerator. Review tax related information under Finance. Search knowledge base to find latest release and restriction information listed on tax solutions. Make sure these restrictions are understood and add to Fit-to-Standard workshop for discussion if needed. For example: See SAP note 2440096 for internal US tax calculation restrictions. See SAP note 2907372 for Registration for Indirect Taxation Abroad (RITA) supported countries, application and processes. In addition to SAP delivered internal tax calculation, for certain countries, customer can switch to the external tax solution to work with an external tax partner. Search for certified tax solution listed in the SAP Certified Solutions Directory accelerator or use SAP Business Accelerator Hub to search for tax related Product and API that works with S/4HANA Cloud. Procedure Note(s): For countries where Time-Dependent Tax Calculation (TDT) is in scope, time-dependent taxes are active as soon as you activate that target country. Reference Activate New Scope or Country/Region task during system preparation for Fit-to-Standard workshop. It is important to know that tax solution is set up at the country level. It is not possible to run both the internal and external tax solutions for the same country. Check Blog - External Tax Calculation Overview for S/4HANA Cloud for more information.

Task.Name: Fit-to-Standard System Preparation
Task.Notes: The purpose of this deliverable is to finalize the setup of the system for the Fit-to-Standard workshops. Before the Explore phase can begin, it is important to ensure that a functional system is available to be used for demonstration and visualization purposes during Fit-to-Standard workshops. This is an essential part of the overall implementation strategy as this is the foundation to start with a pre-configured solution during the explore phase.

Task.Name: Create Configuration Transport
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to create a default customizing request in the Starter System Customizing Tenant to prevent any errors when preparing any of the configuration for the Fit-to-Standard workshops. Apps Used: Export Customizing Transports (Starter System Customizing Tenant) SAP Business Roles Template Required: SAP_BR_ADMINISTRATOR SAP_BR_BPC_EXPERT Procedure: Create a customizing request in the Export Customizing Transports app. See the SAP Help – 3-System Landscape and Transport Management accelerator for further details on how to create the customizing request. Procedure Note(s): Further details on how to create a customizing request can be found in the following section: 3-System Landscape and Transport Management > Tools and Apps > Export Customizing Transports > Working in the Expert Customizing Transports App. Note: in the Starter System Customizing Tenant, there will be no transportation target for which the configuration will be sent. The transport is local and for technical reason only. The default customizing transport should be created before configuration, as some of the configuration requires the default customizing transport to be created ahead of time.

Task.Name: Verify Configuration for Fit-to-Standard Workshop for SAP S/4HANA Cloud
Task.Notes: The purpose of the task is to make sure all required configuration settings are in Starter Customizing Tenant in order to support discussion on selected business processes during Fit-to-Standard workshop. Prerequisites: Starter Customizing Tenant is activated. Reference tasks in Initial System Access for SAP Central Business Configuration and Initial System Access for SAP S/4HANA Cloud Starter System deliverables. Procedure: Check activated scope in evaluation project of SAP Central Business Configuration. Verify countries activated for the selected scope. Cross reference scope item available for the planned country using the Availability and Dependencies of Scope Items accelerator. Review pre-delivered organization structure and enhance in SAP Central Business Configuration if needed. Reference Help - Project Experience - Organizational Structure Management to get familiar with organization units. Review the configuration activities in Business Process Configuration app in SAP Central Business Configuration for selected scope. Update pre-delivered setting and make required setting for selected scope items per Business Driven Configuration Assessment results. Reference the Business Process Configuration section from Help - Project Experience accelerator on how to search or access hierarchically according to business areas and perform the activities. Reference task Activate New Scope or Country/Region to select additional scope or country/region if needed. Procedure Note(s): Customizing setting saved in Starter Customizing Tenant of Starter System cannot be transported. If you are changing SAP pre-delivered configuration, make sure to follow guidelines from SAP and discuss the impact of such changes during the workshop. Reference Industry specific information in accelerator(s) for scope item list, setup instruction, etc when applicable.

Task.Name: Verify Data and Settings for Fit-to-Standard Workshops for SAP S/4HANA Cloud
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to determine if additional data and settings need to be maintained in Starter Customizing Tenant for Fit-to-Standard workshops. SAP Best Practice comes with pre-delivered master data or demo/sample data. In task Set Up Starter System in SAP Central Business Configuration and in task Activate New Scope or Country/Region, demo data are created in Starter Customizing Tenant upon activation and deployment from SAP Central Business Configuration. These data are intended to be used with the Fit-to-standard analysis, making the exploring of pre-configured business processes much easier. Additional project specific data and settings can be created or maintained to help further facilitate the discussion around complex customer topics. In the Starter Customizing Tenant, extensibility for key users is deactivated by default. Prerequisites: Business processes to be demonstrated in the Fit-to-Standard workshops have been reviewed and determined. Procedure: Review Master Data accelerator or access Starter Customizing Tenant to determine if standard pre-delivered demo data is sufficient for all business processes to be demonstrated. Create additional sample data in the Starter Customizing Tenant to further enhance the business processes to be demonstrated. See the Create Your Own Master Data accelerator below for further details. For certain business processes, especially Non-Standard or License Scenarios, check additional master data section in the respective help portal to setup data or initialize functionality for the workshop. For example, see Treasury Management Data and Setting accelerator to find out respective information on master data and settings required when preparing Fit-to-Standard workshop for Treasury Management related optional scope items. Use Extensibility Setting app to activate Key User Extensibility objects when applicable. See the Output Management Set Up Instructions (1LQ) accelerator for more detailed information on the SAP S/4HANA Cloud set up process. Procedure Note(s): It is a best practice to create own data rather than modifying demo master data delivered by SAP in Starter Customizing Tenant. This will help prevent error for additional scope activation and content update and upgrade down the road. Not all data needs to be created ahead of time. Some master data creations are business processes that require dedicated session during Fit-2-Standard workshop to go through in details. Data needed for evaluating reports, or situation handling scenarios are best planned to be created during the Fit-to-Standard workshop as a result of walking through of related business process transactions in Starter Customizing Tenant. Changes of settings, like number ranges, could lead to incompatibilities during upgrade, scope extension and adding new countries. Reference SAP Note 3298955 - Demo Data for Starter System accelerator for more details. Extensibility for key users can be activated. However, extension items that are created in Starter System cannot be transported into other systems. Reference Industry specific accelerator for setup instructions when applicable.

Task.Name: Activate New Scope or Country/Region
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to activate a new solution scenario or a new country/region in the Starter Customizing Tenant in SAP S/4HANA Cloud using SAP Central Business Configuration. Procedure: Review scenarios in the ‘Define Scope’ activity in SAP Central Business Configuration. Reference Initiate Change and Defining Scope section in Help – Project Experience accelerator to select new scenario or country/region in SAP Central Business Configuration. The request for activation of Non-Standard and License Scenarios is done by the Service Center via an Incident/Service Request, with the following information: Subject: ‘Activation of New Licensed Scenarios’ Description: ‘Please activate the scenarios listed below in the Starter Customizing Tenant.' List the scenario title(s) as they appear in the Define Scope app of the SAP Central Business Configuration. Component: XX-S4C-OPR-SRV. Some optional process scenarios are now available for activation from SAP Central Business Configuration. Please refer to ‘Selectable in Scoping in SAP Central Business Configuration’ column of the Availability and Dependencies of Scope Items accelerator to see what can be activated from SAP Central Business Configuration. Check links in ‘More Information on Optional Provisioning’ column in the Availability and Dependencies of Scope Items accelerator for special provisioning instruction. For example, using component CO-PC-OBJ_EBR to request "IFRS 15 bundling functionality" if needed, in addition to the activation of optional Event Based Revenue Recognition process. Review sample organizational structure setup in Set Up Organizational Structure app. Reference Organization Structure Management section in Help – Project Experience accelerator for information on organizational units and how to use the app. Add additional organization structure element when needed. Reference Business Process Configuration section in Help – Project Experience accelerator to adjust system settings for selected scope or country/region. Procedure Note(s): When adding new scope or country/region, it is recommended to limit the number of countries/regions to no more than five. Content from this scope must be deployed to Starter Customizing Tenant before adding the next set of countries/regions. Check SAP Note 3151804 - Country Activation Guidance in Central Business Configuration for best practices. Scope finalization may take some time. Wait for its completion before starting next activity. Once the Confirm Scoping is Completed milestone is set, a scenario/ country cannot be deactivated or removed. Multiple scenarios can be selected in the same change project. Scenarios that require an additional subscription cannot be activated without a subscription contract. To view a list of process scenarios that are activated for a particular country/region, go to SAP Central Business Configuration, access My Selected Scope in Define Scope app. For legal entity operating in multiple countries/regions, consider activating Registration for Indirect Taxation Aboard (RITA) function for the plant aboard scenario instead of activating new country/region when applicable. Advance Valuation will be automatically activated by default when adding a new country/region version. Reference SAP Note 3139304 - Automatic Activation of Advanced Valuations for more details and steps to use Classic Valuations before making any postings. For customer using Cloud ALM and uploaded scopes with export from Digital Discover Assessment tool, reflect additional scope in Process app. Reference Process Scoping in the SAP Cloud ALM for Implementation - Expert Portal accelerator.

Task.Name: Multi-Country Approach and Plan
Task.Notes: The purpose of this deliverable is to create a multi-country approach for projects that will deploy and go-live with multiple country localizations. The deliverable explains how to validate and consider various aspects to decide the best approach for successful initial and future go-lives.

Task.Name: Develop the Multi-Country Approach and Plan
Task.Notes: This task is relevant to implementations that include a scope of multiple localizations. The purpose of this task is to ensure a well-organized rollout for projects that encompass multiple localizations. This task involves planning a multiple country rollout, which can be executed using a phased approach with incremental waves or a 'big bang' approach using a global template for all countries simultaneously. A defined multi-country plan is crucial for the preparation for the Fit-to-Standard workshop. This aligns key stakeholders with the project's priorities, timelines, and aids in risk mitigation. Data migration, integration and extensibility decisions resulting from the fit-to-standard should be reviewed to verify that they also align with the plan. Procedure: Analyze the countries required for rollout and determine the sequence and waves for the rollout. See Cloud Multi-Country Rollout.pptx for more information. The analysis should include the following: Prioritization of countries to be deployed and go-live Availability and Scope (Scope items) Central Governance for configuration and operations Legal requirements Change management End user training System upgrade schedule Document the plan. The final plan will depend on whether you choose to deploy via phased or ‘big bang’ approach.

Task.Name: Data Migration Approach and Plan
Task.Notes: The purpose of this deliverable is to capture and communicate the approach and plan for the data migration to the new environment.

Task.Name: Develop the Data Migration Approach and Plan
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to develop the data migration approach and plan. Procedure: Develop the approach and plan which includes following: Milestones for data delivery. Scope of data sets needed and source systems. Resource requirements, roles and responsibilities. Estimated volumes for various data sets. Tools required (legacy data extraction, data cleansing, migration cockpit, etc.). Data migration testing. Data validation. Data cleansing. Productive load and support. Reporting. Procedure Note(s): Always cross reference the Partner’s Statement of Work to assure that the strategy is consistent with scope, roles and responsibilities outlined in the agreement. Ensure that the data migration plan includes integrated applications. See accelerator list for samples.

ExtendedAttribute.Value: 2nd Wave Project / Rollout Project, Industry Cloud Apps

Task.Name: Prepare Integration Setup
Task.Notes: The purpose of this deliverable is to list the key integrations to be reviewed during the fit-to-standard workshop.

Task.Name: Select Key Integrations for Fit-to-Standard
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to create a list of integrations to be reviewed and demonstrated for the fit-to-standard workshops. Integrations are typically not setup in the SAP S/4HANA Cloud Starter System as the system will eventually be decommissioned. Procedure In collaboration with Project Manager and System Architect prepare a list of key integrations that need to be demonstrated during the fit-to-standard workshops. Check the SAP Signavio Process Navigator for available Scope Items and download the respective setup guide. For customer driven integration follow the SAP Help documentation to develop a setup guide and a process model. Procedure Note(s): The SAP S/4HANA Cloud Starter System will be automatically decommissioned by SAP 30 calendar days after the SAP S/4HANA Cloud Production System provisioning email is sent. Integration efforts spent on SAP S/4HANA Starter system will be lost eventually once the system is decommissioned.

Task.Name: Analytics Approach and Plan
Task.Notes: The purpose of this deliverable is to capture and communicate the approach and plan for the analytics workstream.

Task.Name: Develop the Analytics Approach and Plan
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to ensure the alignment of the customer analytics journey approach and planning. Procedure: Review the SAP Activate Analytics Strategy accelerator which includes the following: Key milestones Roles and responsibilities Tools and considerations (i.e. My Fiori Apps Reference Library, SAP Analytics Cloud, and other) Procedure Note(s): Proposing an advisory role from SAP will not only ensure the customer has the right vision and strategy regarding data and analytics but will also ensure the customer journey will continue on the right path with increased adoption of SAP solutions. Always cross reference the project statement of work to assure that the strategy is consistent with scope, roles and responsibilities outlined in the agreement.

Task.Name: Enablement Strategy
Task.Notes: The purpose of this deliverable is to analyze your current enablement activities and to provide detailed strategic direction based on this analysis. It will help the customer gain an understanding of the new learning enablement strategy and the enablement activities implemented to support the digital transformation process.

Task.Name: Review Enablement Strategy Research and Interviews
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to understand the current learning and enablement capabilities to support a successful rollout of new learning enablement plans; such as is there an existing training and education team, enablement tools and processes. Enablement activities are defined that are needed to support the digital transformation process and/or customer project. Procedure: Schedule and conduct interviews to assess training and adoption needs, evaluate the current status of learning enablement, and define the desired future condition. Find and conduct interviews with the Project Manager and Program Manager from the customer's organization involved in the SAP implementation project. Find and conduct interviews with the Education Manager, Organizational Change Manager, Head of Human Resources, and any other relevant key stakeholders within the customer's organization, as requested. Review both the Preparing an Enablement Strategy and Enablement Strategy Overview accelerators to understand the process of outlining an enablement strategy.

Task.Name: Document Enablement Strategy
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to document a learning enablement strategy plan to ensure the proposed enablement plan is a collaborative effort in lock step with all key stakeholders and line-of-business managers. Procedure: Assess current learning culture to leverage existing resources, learning and knowledge sharing channels and capabilities. Define the full enablement scope from the functional, organizational, geographical and technical perspective, with a focus on real-life business context. Build a best practice learning enablement methodology in conjunction with all key stakeholders. Aim for efficiency through a continuous learning enablement approach, determining the full scope of the learning enablement and knowledge management activities.

Task.Name: Learning Needs Analysis for Project Team
Task.Notes: The purpose of the learning needs analysis for project team deliverable is to identify the project team’s learning needs and proposed learning paths, based on the roles of the project team and the objectives of the project. It also evaluates any knowledge gaps and suggests future learning paths.

Task.Name: Identify Learning Needs for Project Team
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to begin the learning needs analysis for project team process; to identify the processes in scope and analyze the training required for the project team. Procedure: Align with the key project stakeholders on the learning needs and digital learning opportunities. Review the scope of the project. Conduct learning needs analysis interviews with the project team managers and/or members to identify learning requirements for each member of the project team. Review both Planning a Learning Needs Analysis and Learning Needs Analysis Project Team Overview accelerators to understand the methods for effectively analyzing and identifying learning requirements for project teams and business users. Analyze different learning methods and content types in SAP Learning Hub and standard SAP courses.

Task.Name: Create Learning Curriculum based on SAP Standard Learning
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to create a list of content types and learning methods to enable the project team. Procedure: Provide a fully scoped analysis of learning requirements for the project team. Review the SAP Learning Hub content and standard SAP courses to develop the project team curriculum, based on solutions and business processes in scope for the project. The course catalog should be categorized into functional process and sub-process areas including the key tasks and process overviews, the audience (business role), learning duration, method of delivery, and any pre-requisites required.

Task.Name: Conduct Business Review
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to present the learning needs analysis findings to the project team key stakeholders. Procedure: Create the learning needs analysis for project team report. Present the learning needs analysis findings to the project SMEs and key stakeholders for review and final sign-off.

Task.Name: Content Development Tool Deployment
Task.Notes: The purpose of this deliverable is to introduce an enablement content development lifecycle tool for editing and distributing the organization's enablement assets. This tool improves the overall end-user adoption and the efficiency of software programs across enterprises with learning content development that has been reviewed and approved by key stakeholders and line-of-business area managers.

Task.Name: Prepare and Install a Content Development Tool
Task.Notes: This task is relevant for customers with the SAP Enable Now Content Development Tool. The purpose of this task is to prepare and install a learning content development tool to ensure all relevant resources are enabled and trained on 'how to use' the tool. Procedure: Install and deploy the learning content development tool. Configure identity management or single sign on. Run client deployment and cloud security. Configure the system roles, workflows, and metadata required in order to use the embedded enablement content. Enable the end-users on how to use the tool effectively. Procedure Note(s) For SAP S/4HANA and SAP S/4HANA Cloud, configure Web Assistant by following the Set Up of Web Assistant for SAP S/4HANA Cloud accelerator.

Task.Name: Phase Closure and Sign-Off Phase Deliverables
Task.Notes: The purpose of the phase closure and sign-off deliverable is to: Ensure that all required deliverables from this phase and the project are complete and accurate, and close any outstanding issues Identify lessons learned during the phase to prepare for formal phase closure Capture customer feedback and potential Customer References

ExtendedAttribute.Value: 2nd Wave Project / Rollout Project, GROW Adoption Plan

Task.Name: Conduct Project Quality Gate
Task.Notes: The purpose of the Quality Gate is to ensure that both compliance and project management standards are being upheld within projects. A Quality Gate is a checklist milestone at the end of a project phase . Prior to moving into the next phase each project manager demonstrates that they have been compliant with the mandatory deliverables associated with a methodology while ensuring best practice standards have been applied to ensure quality. Procedure: Review the QGate Checklist Concept SAP Activate accelerator to ensure an understanding on what should be covered during the Quality Gate. Areas covered should include: Specifically checking deliverables been completed with recommended practices Assuring project planning Validating open risks and issues, and measuring customer satisfaction Conduct the Quality Gate utilizing the applicable Quality Gate Template accelerator. Procedure Note(s): New additional key deliverables need to be added in the quality gate checklist by the Project Manager to the different project types.

ExtendedAttribute.Value: 2nd Wave Project / Rollout Project, GROW Adoption Plan, Industry Cloud Apps

Task.Name: Obtain Customer Sign-Off for Phase Completion
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to ensure that all required deliverables from this phase and the project are complete and accurate, and close any outstanding issues. Use the Phase Signoff Template accelerator for this task. Procedure Identify and list all key deliverables from phase delivery. Confirm status of completion and any outstanding actions. Provide signoff document to signatory. Obtain phase signoff and agreement for any possible outstanding actions. Identify lessons learned during the phase Capture customer feedback and identify potential customer references When sign-off is obtained, the project can proceed to the next phase.

ExtendedAttribute.Value: 2nd Wave Project / Rollout Project, GROW Adoption Plan

Task.Name: Explore
Task.Notes: The purpose of this phase is to perform a fit-to-standard analysis to validate the solution functionality included in the project scope and to confirm that the business requirements can be satisfied. Identified delta configuration values are added to the backlog for use in the next phase. Explore Phase Activities: Project Management Execution, Monitoring and Controlling Customer Project Team Enablement Fit-to-Standard Analysis Configuration Definition Integration Prerequisites Confirmation Solution Extension Preparation Data Load Preparation Phase Closure In the Explore phase, solution experts lead a series of structured show-and-tell and solution design workshops. The goals of these workshops is to review the best practice functionalities of the SAP solution, identify delta requirements and determine the configuration of the SAP cloud solution.

Task.Name: Execution/Monitoring of Project
Task.Notes: The purpose of this deliverable is to carry out the planned and approved project work and measure project performances to identify variances from the plan. The execution goal is to manage the scope of the work to be done, while monitoring the execution, identifying variances from the plan, monitoring quality results, controlling progress against the plan, controlling changes throughout the project, assess and respond to risks, and communicate the project status. The Project Management Plan developed during the Prepare phase for each of the PM knowledge areas guides the team's approach to management, execution, monitoring, and control of project activities. This methodology provides steps to be considered when each activity is engaged, supported by the team's monitoring/controlling plans. The project manager is responsible for ensuring that the monitoring/controlling plans developed in the planning phase are applied at the appropriate level of control. Additional Information for Premium Engagement Implementations: The SAP TQM is responsible for oversight activities in projects that are run under the SAP Premium Engagement agreement (like Active Embedded or MaxAttention). The roles of SAP TQM and Project Manager are distinct responsibilities during the project delivery.

ExtendedAttribute.Value: 2nd Wave Project / Rollout Project, GROW Adoption Plan

Task.Name: Review the SAP S/4HANA Cloud Onboarding Journey
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to provide users with the essential knowledge and resources required to successfully navigate and contribute to projects and implementations involving SAP S/4HANA Cloud. Procedure: Explore the SAP methodology and gain familiarity with essential components, including the solution map, SAP tools and implementation, roles & authorization and system testing using the 3rd Onboarding session - Project Guidance one pager accelerator. Review the SAP S/4HANA Cloud Onboarding Journey one pager accelerator to get familiar with the onboarding journey from the welcome & introduction all the way to go-live preparation. Tune into both live and recorded onboarding webinars using the SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition Onboarding Resource Center accelerator.

Task.Name: Direct and Manage Project Execution
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is for the project manager and the project team to execute the project management plan and to accomplish the work defined in the project scope statement. Procedure: In executing the project work, the project team will perform the following types of activities: Perform project tasks to reach project objectives Expend effort and funds to accomplish project objectives Staff, train, and manage the project team members assigned to the project Obtain, manage, and utilize resources Implement and execute the planned methods and standards Create, control, verify, and validate project deliverables Manage the scope of the approved work Manage risks and implement risk response activities Manage issues to closure Adapt approved changes into the scope, plans, and project environment Establish and manage internal and external communications Collect project data and report on progress and performance In monitoring/controlling work results, the project team performs the following types of activities: Compare actual project performance to the project management plan Assess performance to determine whether corrective or preventive actions are necessary Monitor and control project risks Provide metrics to support progress and performance reporting and forecasting Monitor implementation of approved changes Take corrective action as needed See topic ‘Analytics’ in the SAP Cloud ALM for Implementation - Expert Portal accelerator for more information on project monitoring in SAP Cloud ALM. Management plans developed during the Prepare phase guide the team's approach to management, execution, and control of project activities. Note: See the “Prepare Project Management Plan” task in Prepare phase for details.

Task.Name: Update Project Management Documents
Task.Notes: The purpose of updating the project management documents task is to ensure that the project manager keeps the key project management documents up-to-date. The project management document is a comprehensive body of project documents that include the project schedule, budget/cost information, monitoring/controlling plans for each of the nine knowledge areas of the Project Management Body of Knowledge (PMBOK), and other information as appropriate. The project management plan document developed for each of the knowledge areas provide the foundation for the consistent application of project management practices. Procedure: Redefine the project schedule, project budget, and update the management plans, scope document and business case to reflect the detailed scope information created during the project. Provide updates to: Project management plan Project WBS Project schedule Project budget Business case Scope document Backlog document (created in Explore phase)

Task.Name: Manage Project Issues, Risks, and Changes
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to manage project issues, risks, and changes. A consistent and thorough approach to managing project issues is essential for an effective project management system. Efficient issue management entails the appropriate managerial decision-making and progress tracking in line with the project's issue management procedure. Identified issues are centralized and maintained within a single environment. Procedure: Utilize a dedicated issue tracking document based on the Open Issues List Template.xls accelerator. The management of issues entails the following steps: An issue is raised and appropriately categorized based on its relevance to system conversion, solution implementation, or solution operations within SAP technology. This issue is logged in the issue tracking tool, either by SAP, a customer, or an implementation partner. During the issue's creation, the individual raising the issue assigns its priority and identifies the responsible person for resolving it. The Project Manager conducts regular follow-ups on issues, in addition to adhering to the standard issue management process outlined in the project's management plans. Critical issues are reviewed as part of the input for each Quality Gate review meeting. Review and update open issues regularly, and communicate these updates to the relevant stakeholder groups as part of the routine project reporting and communication process. Issue tracking enhances visibility and transparency regarding open issues, problems, action items, and associated action plans for the project management team. Use a centralized issue tracking system to oversee and maintain lists of issues that require action and resolution, thereby guaranteeing the project's success.

ExtendedAttribute.Value: 2nd Wave Project / Rollout Project, GROW Adoption Plan

Task.Name: Communicate Project Status and Progress
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to prepare and communicate project status and progress reports. Procedure: Produce project performance reports for different purposes and audiences, as defined in the project communication plan. Clearly communicate the progress of the key activities, completion of the deliverables and status against the schedule and budget. Produce team member status updates every week and share them with the team lead. It is recommended that this report is kept very lightweight and provided to the team lead via e-mail or in a team meeting Produce team status reports on regular cadence, typically weekly. The team status reports are prepared by the team leads and are delivered to the project manager as an input for the project status report. Review the team status report in regular team review with Project Manager or provided in a predefined format. Produce Project status report, using the project status report template. Create this report every week, based on the input from individual teams and additional information like issues list, risk list, etc. Prepare executive status report on monthly or quarterly cadence and provide it to the project executive steering group. Generally, re-use some of the key information from the weekly project status report, expand on the value and benefits of the program and include discussion of the decisions that are needed from the executive steering group. Review and update the project communication matrix throughout the project. The communication matrix documents the project team’s approach to communication (including status reporting). It captures the analysis completed as part of communications planning and serves as a tool to guide the project team throughout the project.

Task.Name: Deliver Program Goal Alignment Survey
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to deliver a Program Goal Alignment survey to get feedback on the Core Team’s cloud mindset adoption, and to capture whether they have clarity on the transformation and definition of success. The survey also supports Organizational Change Management (OCM) efforts by providing insight into stakeholders’ views on team process, governance and empowerment. The feedback gained will shed light on the core team’s current engagement and sentiment before moving to the Explore phase. Prerequisites: The Readiness Assessment results from the Discover phase have been gathered and communicated The recommendations and findings from the Readiness Assessment are understood and, where applicable, corrective actions have been taken. Procedure: Review the recommendations of the ‘Program Goal Alignment’ section of the XM Transformation Procedures accelerator. Identify the survey and reporting recipient groups, listed in the above section of the accelerator, and inform them they are participating in the XM transformation program. Provide these groups (especially report recipients) with enablement on how to use the Program Goal Alignment survey and/or interpret the reporting results. Go to the ‘Survey Q’ tab of the XM Transformation Survey Questions accelerator and locate the survey questions, by filtering on the ‘Program Goal Alignment’ column. Adapt the survey to the current transformation, finalize and publish. Distribute the Program Goal Alignment survey. Once the survey response collection period is over, finalize the dashboard and use it to communicate the feedback to report recipients, with follow-up meetings to discuss the findings and recommend corrective measures accordingly. Document the outcomes in an executive summary for Sponsor and Steering Committee quarterly business review activities. Procedure Note(s): If the process is unclear, engage with XM Advisory experts from: your XM vendor, SAP or implementation partner for assistance.

ExtendedAttribute.Value: 2nd Wave Project / Rollout Project, XM Transformation

Task.Name: Communication Plan Execution
Task.Notes: The purpose of this deliverable is to enhance the information level of all stakeholders involved in the SAP implementation project, to foster understanding and commitment and facilitate a fast and sustainable user adoption. Achieving this objective includes tailoring communication efforts to suite the diverse requirements of the various target audiences, while ensuring a coherent message throughout. As a result, it is highly recommended to establish a change story that outlines the rationale and the benefits of the SAP implementation project. This narrative will serve as the foundation of all communication activities.

Task.Name: Prepare Communication Activities
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to ensure effective communication delivery. It is crucial to recognize the significance of a well-planned and comprehensive preparation of communication activities. Adequate time should be allotted as preparatory tasks can be quite time-consuming. For instance, creating communication assets such as presentations may require the involvement of corporate communication teams, while arranging information sessions like townhall meetings entails a multitude of operations duties (for example, reserving venues, briefing speakers, and conducting rehearsals). Procedure: Involve project team members and other experts (e.g. from communication or marketing departments) essential for upcoming communication activities, as documented in the existing Communication Plan accelerator. Create and revise communication material, and ensure that all operational requirements for delivery are fulfilled (e.g. arranging meetings, reserving venues). Align communication activities and obtain approval by project management or project sponsor.

Task.Name: Deliver Communication Activities
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to keep all stakeholder groups informed about the SAP implementation project, and to provide opportunities for interaction and discussion. At the beginning of the project, the shared information may be relatively general, such as project significance, structure, and timeline. It is only in later project phases that it becomes feasible to provide more specific details on the project’s actual implications for different stakeholder groups (e.g. process modifications, new roles, and responsibilities). To assess the effectiveness of the conducted activities, it is strongly advised to incorporate feedback mechanisms. Procedure: Execute communication activities according to the existing Communication Plan accelerator. Collect feedback on communication activities from target groups. Document communication delivery, including lessons learned.

Task.Name: Update Communication Plan
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to promote a successful and streamlined communication delivery, and to guarantee that the communication plan is completely synchronized with the overall project plan and milestones. Integrating insights from lessons learned gathered in previously executed activities into the communication plan enables targeting communication efforts to the requirements of the various stakeholder groups. Furthermore, it avoids investing project resources in communication efforts that have only little impact. Consistently updating the communication plan also helps in documenting and monitoring executed communication activities. Procedure: Review collected feedback on conducted communication activities. Verify if changes in overall project situation have occurred (e.g. timeline, scope, affected stakeholders). Finetune current activities and incorporate new activities into the existing Communication Plan accelerator, as necessary.

Task.Name: Fit-to-Standard Analysis
Task.Notes: The purpose of this deliverable is to conduct fit-to-standard workshops and capture requirements. The standard processes allow for a more efficient approach to validating the fit of the customer requirements to the standard solution. The fit-to-standard workshops are organized around the functional areas of the solution and are used to explore the functionality, to show how the solution can meet the business requirements, and to help enable business process experts on the execution of processes. Delta requirements are identified; discussed; and then added to the backlog. The fit-to-standard analysis uses an iterative approach to assure that integrated dependencies are addressed. During the workshops, configuration changes are determined and cataloged as outputs of the fit-to-standard process and are used as inputs for the Solution Configuration process in Realize. In each workshop, the following process takes place: Review standard processes Demonstrate business processes and concepts Discuss how the processes fit with customer requirements Identify delta requirements (such as analytics, output management, integration, extensibility, etc.) Identify required configuration Enable customer on execution of processes

ExtendedAttribute.Value: Analytics, Application Design and Configuration, Data Management, Extensibility, Integration
2nd Wave Project / Rollout Project, Artificial Intelligence Technology, Hybrid Deployment (Two-Tier ERP), Identity and Access Management, Output Management

Task.Name: Chart of Accounts - Conduct Workshop
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to define how the customer’s Chart of Accounts can be reflected in SAP S/4HANA Cloud. During the workshop, the project team will review the pre-delivered Chart of Accounts and map the customer’s Chart of Accounts to the delivered one and make the appropriate adjustments needed to reflect the customer's business in the solution. Procedure: See Chart of Accounts Configuration – Overview accelerator on the overall process of adapting a pre-delivered standard Chart of Account to customer specific needs. View the Chart of Accounts in the Starter Customizing Tenant using the Manage Chart of Accounts app. Access SAP Signavio Process Navigator to download and review the Account Determination (global) and Account Determination (local) templates. Capture backlog of any changes to the standard delivered accounts and configurations. Procedure Note(s): To access the account determination templates, navigate to the ‘Accelerators’ section under General Documentation. See Help - Chart of Accounts Maintenance: Overview accelerator for user roles related to Chart of Accounts. Navigate to the “Adapting the Standard Chart of Accounts to Your Needs” section for more information on renumbering G/L Accounts or defining an Account Group.

Task.Name: Organizational Structure - Conduct Workshop
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to define how the customer’s Organizational Structure will be reflected in the solution. During the workshop, the project team will review the pre-delivered Organizational Structure and map to the customer’s Organizational Structure. Additionally, they will make the appropriate adjustments to accommodate the customer’s organization needs. Procedure: Review the delivered Organizational Structure in SAP Central Business Configuration. Reference the chapter on Organizational Structure Management in Help - Project Experience accelerator to map customer organizational units to delivered structure. Define required adjustments needed for the Organizational Structure. Use Organizational Data Overview accelerator as a template to capture any changes to the standard delivered organizational structure needed to satisfy business requirements as backlog items. For Customer using SAP Cloud ALM, use the Requirement app to capture. Procedure Note(s): It is important to have a target organization structure documented as a result of the workshop. After activation and setup in Realize phase, organization structure can only be modified, but not deleted. Selecting additional country/region will result in new mandatory org structure maintenance for selected scenarios that are in scope.

Task.Name: Finance - Conduct Workshop
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to conduct workshop(s), demonstrate the solution and drive discussion with Businesses Process Experts using Starter Customizing Tenant, covering one or more following topic(s). Certain topic may require dedicated workshop to cover the topic entirely. Treasury Management Financial Operations Accounting and Financial Close Enterprise, Risk & Compliance Cost Management and Profitability Analysis Advanced Financial Operations Advanced Accounting and Financial Close Subscription Billing and Revenue Management Pre-requisite: Configuration Experts should use Finance - Conduct Workshop accelerator to create their own agenda for the workshop. For dedicated discussion on Treasury Management, reference the Treasury Overview accelerator for more details. Procedure: Business Process Experts should review all the necessary SAP Best Practices content (test scripts, process flows, etc.) related to the scope items. Access the SAP Signavio Process Navigator for the content and select the relevant country. It is also very important to note the activation details and prerequisites under the Additional Information section of the solution process when applicable. Review the implementation scope with participants in the Define Scope activity in SAP Central Business Configuration. Confirm Non-Standard or Optional scope items. Not all optional scope items can be activated in SAP Central Business Configuration. Some may require additional assistant from SAP. For example, for further information on event-based revenue recognition see the Event-Based Revenue Recognition accelerators. Some may need to be requested via a service ticket during the initial system activation and be included in the very first transport. For example, Group Valuation (5W2), Additional Depreciation Areas of Fixed Assts (5HG & 5KF). These scope items can't be implemented later, they need to be activated during initial scoping. Some may have dependency on other scope items, which then need to be activated together. Confirm License Scenarios. For example, additional subscription is needed for Collection and Dispute Management (BFC). For deprecated scope item, discuss and determine the replacement. For example, scope item BEV is deprecated as of 1905, consider using scope item 1NT instead. Deep dive on critical financial topics, evaluate options and confirm the settings. These setting can't be changed after initial activation and posting of transactional data. For example: Group currency Use Help - Ledger Scenario accelerator to choose the right ledger combination. Use Display Tax Information per Country app to view tax information for a country. Decide on Tax Processing solution details from task Review Tax Processing Solution. Review Supported Fiscal Year Variant accelerator to determine the default Fiscal Year Variant to be applied to all company code or use Fiscal Year Variant Implementation - Overview accelerator to assess the need to create customer specific value. Capture all backlog items including: Additional configuration activities or adjustment to pre-delivered setting. Integration setup that needs to be performed. For example, as described in How to Integrate SAP S/4HANA Cloud with Payment Service Providers accelerator. Master data needed for configuration settings. Additional data, setting or initializations required before system use. Output layout and conditions. Additional analytics and reporting not covered out of box. Functionality that needs to be enhanced by custom development. Artificial Intelligence use case to be implemented. For example, as described in Machine Learning - SAP Cash Application Intelligence (1MV) accelerator. Procedure Note(s): For customer who has an existing ERP system and adopting a Two-Tier enterprise resource planning (ERP) strategy to run their global business, make sure to review Solution Processes in Solution Scenario Two-Tier ERP and capture backlog items. For additional information on downloading financial statements to Excel, see accelerator Export Financial Statements to Microsoft Excel. See Forum - Finance accelerator for more information and discussions on topics in Finance. For example, use search terms like ‘ledger’, ‘currency’ for lessons learned on critical financial settings. For Asset Accounting, in addition to content in SAP Signavio Process Navigator, use Asset Accounting: Transaction Types.xlsx accelerator for an overview of transaction types used in asset accounting postings and delivered by standard content. For remote, or hybrid, fit-to-standard workshops utilize the pre-filled Mural templates, or another collaboration template, to capture all the questions and discussion points during the fit-to-standard workshop. See the Fit-to-Standard Workshops – Mural Template accelerator for more information. The backlog items captured from the discussion in the Mural templates will be migrated later into in a central Backlog. For Customer using SAP Cloud ALM, access business process content in the Processes app and use the Requirement app to capture all backlog items. Use ‘workstream’ field and ‘Tag’ field to further classify or categorize all requirements.

ExtendedAttribute.Value: 2nd Wave Project / Rollout Project, Artificial Intelligence Technology, Hybrid Deployment (Two-Tier ERP)

Task.Name: Conduct Workshop by Business Process Area
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to conduct workshops in respective business process areas and subareas to confirm implementation scope, identify delta requirements and create backlog. Followings are examples of business process areas in different line of businesses: Human Resources: Core HR and Time Recording, etc. Sales: Order and Contract Management, Subscription Billing and Revenue Management, etc. Source and Procurement: Operational Procurement, Sourcing and Contract Management, etc. Manufacturing: Production Operations, Production Processing, Quality Management, etc. R&D Engineering: Enterprise Portfolio and Project Management, Product Engineering, Product Lifecyle Management, etc. Supply Chain: Warehousing, Inventory, Shipping and Transportation, etc. Service: Service Master Data & Agreement Management, Service Operations & Processes, etc. Asset Management: Environment, Health and Safety, Maintenance Management, etc. Procedure: Business Process Experts should review all the necessary SAP Best Practices content (test scripts, process flows, etc.) related to the scope items. Access the SAP Signavio Process Navigator for S/4HANA Cloud accelerator for the content and select the relevant country. It is also very important to note the activation details and prerequisites in the Additional Information section of the solution process when applicable. Configuration Experts should demonstrate the solution processes and drive discussion with Business Process Experts using the Starter Customizing Tenant. Review the implementation scope with participants in the ‘Define Scope’ activity in SAP Central Business Configuration to confirm scope items. Not all optional scope items can be activated in SAP Central Business Configuration. Confirm non-standard, optional and/or licensed scenarios. Some may require additional assistant from SAP. Some may need to be requested via a service ticket during the initial activation and be included in the very first transport. Some may have dependency on other scope items, which then need to be activated together. For example, Mobile RF Devices in Warehousing (63V). Note down the list of applications that are in the scope for the project in the Application - Workplace list created in task Create Initial Application - Workplace List during Prepare phase. Create backlog including, for example: Additional configuration activities or adjustment to pre-delivered setting Standard Integration setup that needs to be performed Customer Driven Integration setup for integrated applications Master data needed for configuration settings Additional data, settings or initializations required before system use Output layout and conditions Additional dashboard and reporting not covered out of box Functionality that needs to be enhanced by custom development Artificial Intelligence use case to be implemented Procedure Note(s): For customer who has an existing ERP system and adopting a two-tier enterprise resource planning (ERP) strategy to run their global business, make sure to review Solution Processes in Solution Scenario Two-Tier ERP and capture backlog items. See Forum accelerators for more information and discussions on topics in respective business process area. For remote or hybrid fit-to-standard workshops, utilize the pre-filled Mural templates, or another collaboration template, to capture all the questions and discussion points during the fit-to-standard workshop. See the Fit-to-Standard Workshops – Mural Template accelerator for more information. The backlog items captured from the discussion in the Mural templates will be manually transferred later into in a central Backlog. For Customer using SAP Cloud ALM, access business process content in the Processes app and use the Requirement app to capture all backlog items. Use ‘Workstream’ field and ‘Tag’ field to further classify or categorize all requirements.

ExtendedAttribute.Value: Analytics, Application Design and Configuration, Extensibility, Integration
2nd Wave Project / Rollout Project, Artificial Intelligence Technology, Hybrid Deployment (Two-Tier ERP), Identity and Access Management, Industry Cloud Apps, Output Management

Task.Name: Data Protection - Conduct Workshop
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to conduct workshop to confirm implementation scope and configuration settings in the context of data protection. This involves understanding data protection requirements, reviewing SAP's design and concept for data protection, and discussing the scope and configuration possibilities with stakeholders. Procedure: Clarify data protection requirements that need to be adhered to by data protection experts. Review the SAP Help Portal to gain an understanding of SAP's design and concept for data protection, as well as all necessary SAP Best Practices content (test scripts, process flows, etc.) related to the scope items. This will help clarify the required data protection solutions. Key solutions include: Defining data controllers and purposes for processing personal information Blocking transactional data Blocking master data Information revival Read access logging Consent administration Have Configuration Experts demonstrate the solution processes and facilitate a discussion with data protection experts using the Starter Customizing Tenant. Review the implementation scope to confirm the required configurations and identify stakeholders who should provide inputs for configuration. Discuss the scope of implementation and configuration possibilities with the identified stakeholders in workshops. The following are examples of goals that should be achieved from the workshops: Conclude how to define data controllers Identify business processes and relevant End of Purpose (EoP) applications that process personal information Identify transactional data objects that require blocking and destruction Define retention policy and residence policy Conclude design for information retrieval Identify business processes where read access logging is required Procedure Note: Utilize Design and Configuration Documentation Template - Data Protection and Privacy.docx guide the discussion, document scope and configuration details.

Task.Name: Customer Execution of Standard Processes
Task.Notes: The purpose of this deliverable is for all business process experts to execute the standard processes demonstrated in the Fit-to-Standard workshops in the assigned system for the fit-to-standard. Executing the standard processes will help enable the business process experts in using the new solution and solidify the key decisions made during the Fit-to-Standard workshops.

Task.Name: Execute Standard Business Processes
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is for all business process experts to execute the standard processes covered during the fit-to-standard workshops in the Starter System. The SAP Best Practices test scripts and process flows, that were used by the Configuration Expert for the demonstration, are used. Prerequisites: Created credentials for starter system and have verified access Noted the Scope ID for the standard processes that were executed in the fit-to-standard workshop and are included in the implementation scope. Procedure: Navigate to the SAP Signavio Process Navigator using the accelerator below. Use the scope ID to search for the desired standard business process that will be executed. Open the scope item page and select the relevant localization and download the test script and process flow. Review the process flow to obtain a high-level overview of the process that will be executed. Use the test script and provided data to execute the standard process in the Starter System. Procedure Note(s): Not all scope items can be executed in the starter system. Examples are, but not limited to, integration and scope items requiring additional subscriptions. Not all scope items are available for all countries.

Task.Name: Fit-to-Standard Analysis Documentation
Task.Notes: The purpose of this deliverable is to ensure all documentation captured during the fit-to-standard workshops is complete. Any documentation not captured during or after the fit-to-standard workshops should be added as Requirements and Notes in the SAP Cloud ALM, or alternatively into the prefilled Backlog (tool or template). The documentation for all delta requirements will be further refined by technical experts during the Planning and Design workshop process later in the Explore phase.

ExtendedAttribute.Value: Analytics, Application Design and Configuration, Extensibility, Integration
2nd Wave Project / Rollout Project, Artificial Intelligence Technology, GROW Adoption Plan, Hybrid Deployment (Two-Tier ERP), Identity and Access Management, Output Management

Task.Name: Document and Maintain Business Process Flows
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to ensure the To-Be business processes, or the Target State of business processes, are clearly documented per fit-to-standard workshops. A complete end-to-end business process flow is an important input for the following activities: Planning and design tasks of extension, integration, analytics, etc. Organization change management tasks End user training User acceptance testing Update and upgrades Prerequisites: Have access to software that can support the edit of BPMN files. Procedure: Download process flows from SAP Signavio Process Navigator, if not already done so, for all implementation scope items which require additional maintenance (i.e. additional points of integration and extensibility). Gather business process model update requirements from the fit-to-standard workshops, and make adjustments to the process flows accordingly. For customer using SAP Cloud ALM, add target business process flow document links in this task. Procedure Note(s): Examples of software used for maintaining the business process flows are SAP PowerDesigner, or SAP Signavio Process Manager.

Task.Name: Document Requirements
Task.Notes: The purpose of the task is to ensure all requirements captured during the Fit-to-Standard workshops are documented and confirmed. For customer using SAP Cloud ALM, review information captured in the Requirements app from the workshop. Clarify, detail out requirements to high level solutioning with effort estimation that can be started for the Realize phase. Some requirements (i.e. extension, analytics, integration, Artificial Intelligence, Identity and Access Management, etc) will be further refined by technical experts in subsequent the Planning and Design tasks. Procedures: Use the Design and Configuration Documentation Template accelerator to create customer's own version to include target business processes with customer specific configuration values, integration points and extension requirements. Documentation can be by business process area like Supply Chain, Manufacturing, etc or by cross process area related topics like Data Protection and Privacy, etc. Document scope and settings for initial activation of system via SAP Central Business Configuration later in Realize phase. Use Availability and Dependency of Scope Item accelerator as a template to note down scope and its country relevancy. This should also include cross function, general setting scope items, ie. Embedded Analytics, Output Management, Integration scenarios, etc. Alternatively, for customer using Cloud ALM, use Process app to flag solution processes ‘In Scope’ with respective country. Confirm critical financial settings (i.e fiscal year variant, group currency). They are one-time setting that can't be changed after activation. Highlight those scope items that can only be included during initial scoping. Reference task Finance - Conduct Workshop for detail examples. Use Organizational Data Overview accelerator to capture the desired org structure. Make sure to include additional required org structures for optional scope items (i.e. Warehouse Management, etc.) Leverage Configuration Activity accelerator as a template to confirm detail changes. This should include adjustments to standard delivered analytics and reports. As indicated by ‘Delete Customer Records’ column in the Configuration Activity accelerator, deletion is not supported for all customer created configuration. If you are changing SAP pre-delivered configuration, make sure to understand the impact of such changes and plan on fully test the functionality after the change. Fill out the corresponding tab (i.e. 5D2 advanced intercompany sales, etc) in the Configuration Activity accelerator for Expert Configuration that can only be requested via service ticket during Realize phase. Create one document per each item and request during appropriate sprint. Use the Master Data (General) accelerator as a template to capture naming convention or details for master data like material, vendor, customer, and work center, etc. For finance related master data, capture updates or changes required from pre-delivered values. This is also an important input to data migration strategy. Document additional data and settings that needs to be entered in Development, Test and Production System respectively: Data used in transportable configuration settings One time activation settings Master data before transaction Use the accelerator Extensibility Functional Specifications Template to document the Extensibility requirements. Use the accelerator Integration Scenario and API List to document Integration requirements. For output management, make sure to specify communication channels, required layout changes from pre-delivered form templates and email templates. Review and add additional requirement in areas like Artificial Intelligence, Identity and Access Management, etc to complete the backlog for subsequent detail planning and design sessions. Procedure Note(s): For customer using Cloud ALM, use Documents app to store requirement details natively in the app. Check out Solution Documentation section in the SAP Cloud ALM for Implementation - Expert Portal for overview of function and features and best practices. Go to Documents section in Help - SAP Cloud ALM for Implementation for details instructions on how to use the app.

ExtendedAttribute.Value: Analytics, Application Design and Configuration, Data Management, Extensibility, Integration
Artificial Intelligence Technology, Identity and Access Management

Task.Name: Confirm Backlog
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to confirm all known requirements (data, system, process) captured as a result of Fit-to-Standard workshop including high level solutioning and effort estimation can be started for the Realize phase with business stakeholder (product owners) approvals. Requirements will then be handed over to the implementation team. This central backlog will be used for prioritization and sprint planning in Realize phase. Procedure: Review requirements in the Requirements app within SAP Cloud ALM or as a backlog item using the Backlog Template to make sure they are properly categorized. Use the ‘Workstream’ field within the Requirements app to classify the requirement, ie. Configuration, Extension, Integration, etc. Use the ‘Tag’ field within the Requirements app to provide additional details about the nature of Requirement, ie. Output, Artificial Intelligence, different types of integration (i.e. Master Data Integration, BTP Apps, Process Integration etc) or to distinguish Key User Extension with Developer or Side by Side Extension, etc. Understand the dependency and priority. Review and confirm requirements with stakeholders. For requirements require additional licenses or custom development effort, it is recommended to have a formal approval process. Consolidate all requirements into a central backlog for sprint planning and execution. Procedure Note(s): For additional details on using the Requirements app and the supported fields within it, including ‘Approval’ field to indicate if approval is required and track status using ‘Requirement Status’ field, please refer the Requirement Management section within the accelerator SAP Cloud ALM for Implementation - Export Portal. Using Cloud ALM, customer can also leverage the Analytics app and access the ‘Requirement Distribution’ and ‘Requirement Traceability’ report for consolidated view of process and status of all requirements.

ExtendedAttribute.Value: 2nd Wave Project / Rollout Project, GROW Adoption Plan

Task.Name: Execute Solution Validation Survey
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to deliver the Solution Validation survey to ensure that the program’s subject matter experts agree on the fit-to-standard solution and, customizations designed during the Explore phase. This feedback validates whether the solution is meeting the customer’s future-state business process requirements; under the scope of the implementation while keeping agreed feature roadmaps in mind. This survey also combines the questions from the Project Performance survey, so that relevant respondents will not have to answer two different surveys in a tight time period. Prerequisites: The fit-to-standard workshops, configuration design and feature roadmap have been agreed and completed. Procedure: Review the recommendations of the ‘Solution Validation’ section of the XM Transformation Procedures accelerator. Identify the survey and reporting recipient groups, listed in the above section of the accelerator, and inform them they are participating in the XM transformation program. Provide these groups (especially report recipients) with enablement on how to use the Solution Validation survey and/or interpret the reporting results.
