Go to the ‘Survey Q’ tab of the XM Transformation Survey Questions accelerator and locate the survey question, by filtering on the ‘Solution Validation’ column. Adapt the survey to the current transformation, finalize and publish. Distribute the Solution Validation survey. Once the survey response collection period is over, finalize the dashboard and use it to communicate the feedback to report recipients, with follow-up meetings to discuss the findings and recommending corrective measures accordingly. Document the outcomes in an executive summary for Sponsor and Steering Committee quarterly business review activities. Procedure Note(s): If the process is unclear, engage with the XM Advisory experts from: your XM vendor, SAP or implementation partner for assistance.

ExtendedAttribute.Value: 2nd Wave Project / Rollout Project, XM Transformation

Task.Name: Full Value Adoption Plan
Task.Notes: The purpose of this deliverable is to create a high level, long term plan of the features and functions that will be adopted beyond the initial go-live of the solution.

Task.Name: Create Full Value Adoption Plan
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to create a high-level, long-term plan of the features and functions that will be adopted beyond the initial go-live of the solution. Achieving 'Full-Value' from a SaaS solution is not realized at the first go-live but through the planning and execution of subsequent adoption efforts. Procedure: Create a high-level plan, outlining the principles of what will be included in the initial go-live, and what features, functions, entitlements, and optimizations will be planned for subsequent adoption waves. This plan should consider: Backlog from the Fit-to-standard workshops. Future functionality releases listed in the SAP Road Map Explorer for relevant solution. Rollout schedule.

Task.Name: Integration Planning and Design
Task.Notes: The purpose of the deliverable is to create a well-aligned and optimized list of integrations for implementation and testing during the Realize phase. The process involves the following steps: Handover of Business Requirements to Technical Expert. Check for SAP Best Practices. Define details of the integration to fulfill business requirements. Optimize and approve integrations. The ultimate decision regarding integration should be made after considering factors like technology, licenses, the availability of standard integration content, and the skill set of resources. This deliverable provides guidance on determining necessary technical details and exploring available options.

ExtendedAttribute.Value: 2nd Wave Project / Rollout Project, Artificial Intelligence Technology, Hybrid Deployment (Two-Tier ERP)

Task.Name: Determine Scenario Options for Integrations
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to determine the availability of SAP Best Practices to setup integration scenarios. Prerequisite: Integration scenario requirements and API list have been collected. Procedure: Review Integration Architecture Guide for Cloud and Hybrid Landscapes for guidance on choosing the right Integration Technology based on the scenario requirements. Use accelerators Help - Products with Integration Capabilities for SAP S/4HANA Cloud to review the list of products that SAP S/4HANA Cloud can Integrate with. Use Integration Guides Overview to identify Integration Guides corresponding to a particular Solution Scenario by using the ‘Source’ & ‘Target’ filters as necessary. Refer SAP Help - Architecture Overview for Data Integration for details on common scenarios for data extraction from SAP S/4HANA Cloud. Review the availability of Cloud Integration Automation Service procedures for the setup and document the findings in accelerator Integration Scenario and API List Document all details of B2B Integrations to be setup using EDI as entered in the EDI Technical worksheet of accelerator Integration Scenario and API List Set all Integrations that are not covered with Best Practices as “Customer Driven”. Review the Integration requirements for integrated application deployed on SAP Business Technology Platform and document them in the accelerator Integration Scenario and API List Customers having a Hybrid two-tier ERP deployment scenario should follow the approach mentioned below Review the Master Data & Integration approach section of the accelerator Hybrid Deployment with SAP S/4HANA Cloud and the Blog - Master Data and Integration approaches in Hybrid cloud deployment with S/4HANA Cloud to gain a better understanding of the available approaches for the different deployment scenarios. Check for availability of Hybrid Deployment specific Integration best practices using accelerator SAP Signavio Process Navigator - SAP S/4HANA Cloud for Hybrid Deployment If best practices are unavailable the integration scenario will have to built as a customer driven integration adhering to the approach outlined above. Procedure Note(s): Detailed instructions and examples for documenting the scenario options are included within the template. For SAP Integration with Concur solutions (SAP ICS) or any other customer-owned integration to connect your SAP Concur and SAP finance systems please see SAP Note Accel ID = S4H_2192.

ExtendedAttribute.Value: 2nd Wave Project / Rollout Project, Hybrid Deployment (Two-Tier ERP), Industry Cloud Apps

Task.Name: Determine Details for Customer-Driven Integrations for SAP S/4HANA Cloud
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to obtain all needed information for the customer-driven integration scenarios which are not covered under the out of box Integration scenarios listed within SAP Best Practices for S/4HANA Cloud Procedure: Use SAP Business Accelerator Hub to identify details of released APIs that can be leveraged in customer-driven Integrations. Review SAP S/4HANA Cloud - What's New Viewer to identify the newly added or updated APIs. APIs are now added on a regular basis as a part of the Continuous Delivery updates for S/4HANA Cloud. Customers having a Hybrid two-tier ERP deployment scenario should follow the approach mentioned below Review the Master Data & INtegration approach section of the accelerator Hybrid Deployment with SAP S/4HANA Cloud and the Blog - Master Data and Integration approaches in Hybrid cloud deployment with S/4HANA Cloud to gain a better understanding of the available approaches for the different deployment scenarios. Implement the Integration scenario using the middleware and guidelines provided above. Procedure Note(s): Select Category as "API' and use the "Valid as Of" filter in What's New Viewer to select the respective continuous delivery service(s). An updated version is indicated by the release upgrade followed by a suffix such as .1, or.2. For example, SAP S/4HANA Cloud 2202.1 is the first update after major release 2202. Customer can request missing APIs to be developed in the Customer Innovation Portal using the procedure described in accelerator Discover and request SAP S_4HANA_APIs

ExtendedAttribute.Value: 2nd Wave Project / Rollout Project, Hybrid Deployment (Two-Tier ERP)

Task.Name: Design SAP Business Technology Platform Integration iFlows for Customer-Driven Integrations
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to design the SAP Business Technology Platform Integration iFlows for the customer driven Integrations. Prerequisites: APIs were determined and tested for customer-driven integrations. All Information was collected in the Integration and API list. Procedure: Design the SAP Business Technology Platform Integration iFlows using the API information from the Integration and API list. A template to document the design is added in the accelerator section. Review the specification with the architect and the process expert.

ExtendedAttribute.Value: 2nd Wave Project / Rollout Project, Hybrid Deployment (Two-Tier ERP)

Task.Name: Review and Customer Sign-off List of Integrations
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is for the customer to sign off the list of integrations to be realized. After the list is aligned and reviewed by integration experts the customer should sign off the list. The list should contain all integrations that are proposed to be realized in the project with information on the to-be used interfaces. The customer should be made aware of any integration that are not using published APIs. Procedure: Customer signs off the list of integrations planned to realized in this project. Customer also sign off the list of business processes which need to be automated using Artificial Intelligence (AI). This will be included as a part of integration.

ExtendedAttribute.Value: 2nd Wave Project / Rollout Project, Artificial Intelligence Technology

Task.Name: Extension Planning and Design
Task.Notes: The purpose of the deliverable is to plan, design and sign off business process extensions. The process includes the following steps: Handover the requirements from fit-to-standard Check for sample scenarios to use and available products Collection of details to estimate efforts and feasibility Customer sign off Detail design of extension The customer makes the final decision on the extension, considering factors such as workload, technology utilized, licenses, and the skill set of resources. This deliverable provides guidance on determined necessary technical details and exploring options.

Task.Name: Handover of Requirements for Extensions to Developer
Task.Notes: The purpose of the task is to handover the business requirements to the technical experts for extensions. During the fit-to-standard business scenarios were reviewed using process flows, test scripts and demonstrations in the system. Business requirements that might be resolved with extensions were recorded in the business process model as requirements. Capture configuration and follow up action items as Requirements and Notes in SAP Cloud ALM, or alternatively as a backlog item in the Backlog Template. These need to be handed over to experts for extensions to analyze technical feasibility and needed tools. Procedure: Review all the requirements from fit-to-standard that require the extension of the business process with the configuration expert. Clarify all open questions on the expected outcome of the process. Within the Requirements app, break down the Extensibility Requirements captured into 'User Stories'. Procedure Note(s): For additional details on using the Requirements app and the supported fields within it, please refer the Requirement Management section within the accelerator SAP Cloud ALM for Implementation - Export Portal

Task.Name: Check for Sample Scenario in SAP Extensibility Explorer
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is explore the list of prebuilt extension scenarios in the SAP Extensibility Explorer that are available to be downloaded and used. Procedure: Examine each example for details about their scope, architecture, and process flow. See the links to GitHub (takes you to the source code), setup instructions, and other related materials. Develop the skills needed to perform Activate activities and onboarding tasks. See accelerator Accel ID = S4H.1090. Use the scenario’s source code as a template for building similar extensions that fit your requirements.

Task.Name: Check for Available Products
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to check for available products before an extension is self developed. Procedure: Review available solutions in the SAP Store for solutions that fit the requirements.

Task.Name: Collect Details for Extensions for SAP S/4HANA Cloud
Task.Notes: The purpose of the task is to collect technical details for extensions. Procedure: Refer the accelerator Extend SAP S/4HANA in the cloud and on premise with ABAP based extensions to view the guidelines available on choosing the right extensibility scenario based on customer requirements. Use accelerator Help - CDS Views to check for available CDS views. Use the accelerator SAP Note 3088062 - Identifying local APIs for S/4HANA Cloud to identify the released developer objects that can be used in Extensions. Use SAP Extensibility Explorer for tools and sample codes. You also find additional information sources in the Explorer. Use the accelerator SAP Business Accelerator Hub - Developer Extensibility Objects to identify released Developer Extensibility Objects added to API Business Hub Document all findings to estimate workload, technical feasibility, and skills needed to build the extension. Procedure Note(s): It is recommended to use the Starter Development tenant for exploring available APIs, CDS view and released developer objects. See Forum - Cross Area Topics accelerator for more information and discussions on topics that cross various areas.

Task.Name: Detail Design on Key-User Extensibility
Task.Notes: The purpose of the task is the detail design of a key-user extensions. The Key user Extensibility is a powerful tool that allows user to implement the typical extension in SAP S/4HANA mostly without a single line of code. It uses the Custom Fields and Custom Logic Fiori apps to implement a BAdI; use restricted ABAP (Custom fields, custom logic, custom business objects). Procedure: Review the requirements collected in Fit-to-Standard related to Key-User Extensibility. Create design documents about how to implement using Key-User Extensibility features. Add item for tracking into the backlog for Realize. Procedure Note(s): See Forum - Cross Topic Areas accelerator for more information and discussions on topics that cross various areas. As a default, Key user extensibility is deactivated. Read the SAP Note 3061520 - Key User Extensibility - Configure Setting accelerator to see how to activate the extensibility for Key user.

Task.Name: Detail Design for Developer Extensibility
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to define the detailed design of developer extensibility (Embedded Steampunk). The planned developer (on-stack) extensibility option will empower ABAP developers to extend standard SAP processes with custom extensions that require tighter integration with the SAP S/4HANA back-end while keeping the digital core isolated from the custom code. This will help minimize regression testing efforts during SAP S/4HANA upgrades. Procedure: Use the Requirements in SAP Cloud ALM to design extensibility of a business process extension via Developer Extensibility features. Capture the related business process area (i.e. Finance, MFG, etc) and the related scope items in Requirement app. Add all the extension items into the backlog for Realize Phase. Procedure Note(s): Refer the following topic pages for additional details on Developer Extensibility SAP Community - ABAP Development SAP Community - ABAP Extensibility SAP Community - SAP S/4HANA Cloud ABAP Environment

Task.Name: Detail Design of Side-by Side Extensibility for SAP S/4HANA Cloud
Task.Notes: The purpose of the task is the detailed design of a side-by-side Extension. Procedure: Use the information collected to design in detail the realization of a business process extension using the SAP Business Technology Platform. Add item to the backlog for Realize. Procedure Note(s): See Forum - Cross Topic Areas accelerator for more information and discussions on topics that cross various areas.

Task.Name: Review and Sign off Design of Extension
Task.Notes: The purpose of the task is to review the details on extensions and sign off for realization. Procedure: Collect all technical information on the business extension. Review feasibility. Collect estimate for workload, needed skills, and needed resources. Sign off with customer.

Task.Name: Analytics Planning and Design
Task.Notes: The purpose of this deliverable to ensure detailed planning of analytics is conducted, including technical feasibility, and sign off by the customer.

Task.Name: Handover of Requirements to Analytics Expert
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to handover all analytics requirements to the Analytics Expert. Procedure: Hand over all requirements on analytics to the Analytics Expert. Consolidate all requirements in the Analytics List Template accelerator. Procedure Note(s): When using SAP Cloud ALM, a complete list of all requirements can be found in the Requirements and Notes section.

Task.Name: Review My Fiori Apps Reference Library and Process Scenario
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to review the applications in the My Fiori Apps Reference Library for all applicable SAP Embedded Analytics app offerings for your project deployment with SAP S/4HANA Cloud and review the process scenario in the SAP Signavio Process Navigator. The apps in the My Fiori Apps Reference Library include all predefined analytical applications where you can review the content, product features, and implementation information. The SAP Signavio Process Navigator contains the process scenario for embedded analytics to support the project implementation with content including test scripts, configuration guides, descriptions, process flows, and additional details. Prerequisite: Notes on analytics have been documented Analytics requirements have been captured in the Analytics List Template accelerator Procedure: Learn and understand the latest content and documentation on SAP Fiori via the Help - SAP Fiori Overview accelerator. Refer to the SAP Community - SAP Fiori Embedded Analytics accelerator for information, content, and forums regarding the Fiori Embedded Analytics topic. Review the SAP Fiori App Reference Library for all available app options. Follow the path: SAP Fiori Apps Reference Library accelerator > Select “SAP S/4HANA Cloud” in the search bar and filter on the analytical apps using the filter option to narrow down on analytics components per UI Technology offerings. Review all predefined analytical application content in coordination with the UX team involved in the project available with SAP S/4HANA Cloud. Check that all requirements on analytics can be fulfilled with the pre-delivered content from SAP Signavio Process Navigator for embedded analytics. The scope item information can be found in the SAP Signavio Process Navigator accelerator or in the Process section of SAP Cloud ALM. Procedure Note(s): All new app offerings will be available to view in the SAP Fiori Apps Reference Library accelerator when they become available. Any standard scope which SAP offers can be found in the SAP Signavio Process Navigator. For any custom requirements, the project team manages the gaps and documentation where they can refer back to them in the future.

Task.Name: Initial Analytics Settings
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to configure the initial settings for analytics and is performed during the design phase for any SAP standard analytics to be evaluated in the task Fit-to-standard workshops. This task includes: Setting the default currency for any Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) and Reports to be evaluated Set the target thresholds for Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) and Reports to be evaluated Identify date functions for fiscal periods for reporting Optionally import SAP Analytics Cloud stories to the Fiori launchpad Prerequisites: Assign the business role Analytics Specialist The business role Analytics Specialist and its apps must have been activated in task Activate SAP Fiori in the Initial System and/or Activate SAP Fiori in the Starter System Procedure: Launch the SAP Fiori app F2814 Manage Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) and Reports Select each Key Performance Indicator (KPI) or Report you need to change, e.g. based on the analytics identified in task Create Initial Analytics List Edit Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) and Reports to adjust the default currency and thresholds for semantic information Optionally, on the Stories tab, you can import your SAP Analytics Cloud Stories Launch the SAP Fiori app F2595 Manage Date Functions Identify the date functions that matches the most relevant reporting periods for your fit-to-standard workshops, e.g. fiscal periods for your country Procedure Note(s): The SAP delivered content is adjusted as a starting point. During the Realize phase in task Configure Analytics, the following can be performed: Further adjust the settings for Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) and Reports Create new Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) and Reports, e.g. using SAP Fiori app F2814 Manage Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) and Reports Create custom analytics using SAP Fiori app F1572 Custom Analytical Queries Add SAP Analytics Cloud Stories which you want to include in your launchpad.

Task.Name: Determine Details for Customer-Driven Analytics and Extension of Reports
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to determine all details on the customer-driven analytics and any extensions to the report(s). Prerequisite: Customer-driven analytics and any extension to the existing report(s) are identified and documented as requirements or in the Analytics List Template accelerator. Procedure: Check with the respective expert to determine if the required extension of the business process is feasible. Use the setup guide from the accelerator section as input to determine all needed details to decide if they are doable. Document your findings as a requirement or in the Analytics List Template accelerator. Any custom requirements beyond the standard embedded analytics which need to be configured in the system need to be documented and validated in detail. Procedure Note(s): See Forum - Cross Area Topics accelerator for more information and discussions on topics that cross various areas. Custom requirements are configured and executed according to the business processes in the Realize phase.

Task.Name: Review and Customer Sign off for Analytics
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to review the details on analytics and sign off for realization. Procedure: Collect all technical information on evaluated reports. Review feasibility. Collect estimate for workload and needed skills and resources. Sign off with customer.

Task.Name: Artificial Intelligence Planning and Design
Task.Notes: The purpose of this deliverable is to start planning for Artificial Intelligence (AI) implementation. This includes completion of questionnaire and installation of various applications before running SAP Build Process Automation Bots.

ExtendedAttribute.Value: 2nd Wave Project / Rollout Project, Artificial Intelligence Technology

Task.Name: Review Processes for SAP Build Process Automation
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to identify the business processes which can be automated. Prerequisites: SAP Build Process related scope items are identified. All application mandatory and optional requirements (Desktop agent, SAP Task Center etc.) for running the Bots are installed and tested. Procedure: Verify that all questions are answered in the Business Driven Configuration Questionnaire - AI Automation accelerator. Review Help - SAP Build Process Automation for details for additional guidance implementing automation scenarios using SAP Build Process Automation. All available Business Content can be identified using the accelerator SAP Bot Store - Business Content for S/4HANA Cloud Demonstrate functionality by running an SAP Standard Process Automation content and incorporate end user feedback.

ExtendedAttribute.Value: 2nd Wave Project / Rollout Project, Artificial Intelligence Technology

Task.Name: Plan for Machine Learning
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to collect and identify the business processes using Machine Learning. Prerequisites: Machine Learning related scope items are identified using the accelerator SAP Best Practices - Embedded Machine Learning in S/4HANA Cloud Procedure: Verify that all questions are answered in the Business Driven Configuration Questionnaire - AI Automation accelerator. Download the SAP Best Practices Test scripts from each Scope Item(s) mentioned within the configuration guide attached to SAP Best Practices - Embedded Machine Learning in S/4HANA Cloud Procedure Note(s): Download the guide from accelerator 'Deploying Machine Learning scenario'.

ExtendedAttribute.Value: 2nd Wave Project / Rollout Project, Artificial Intelligence Technology

Task.Name: Identify Business Processes for Situation Handling
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to identify the business processes using Situation Handling. Prerequisites: Situation Handling related scope items are identified from the ‘Usecases for Situation Handling’ section of Help - Use Cases for Situation Handling Procedure: Verify that all questions are answered in the Business Driven Configuration Questionnaire - AI Automation accelerator. Download the Test scripts from each Scope Item(s) identified in Prepare Phase by each Line Of Business (LOB). Procedure Note(s): See the Situation Handling for SAP S/4HANA Cloud accelerator for more information on situation handling scenarios available in the solution.

ExtendedAttribute.Value: 2nd Wave Project / Rollout Project, Artificial Intelligence Technology

Task.Name: Artificial Intelligence Setup
Task.Notes: The purpose of this deliverable is to ensure that all the necessary applications are installed to facilitate the smooth execution of AI - like SAP Build Process Automation, ML, Situational Handling etc.

ExtendedAttribute.Value: Artificial Intelligence Technology, GROW Adoption Plan

Task.Name: Setup SAP Build Process Automation Components
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to install all the necessary applications to facilitate the execution of Bots – both delivered by SAP Best Practices as well as custom made Bots. Procedure: Subscribe to SAP Build Process Automation within your SAP Business Technology Platform Subaccount. A booster is available for a guided setup process if required. Check all System and Technical prerequisites and install the Desktop Agent Procedure Note(s): Refer to Help - SAP Build Process Automation for additional information on the setup procedure.

ExtendedAttribute.Value: Artificial Intelligence Technology, GROW Adoption Plan

Task.Name: Identity and Access Management Planning and Design
Task.Notes: The purpose of this deliverable is to ensure the detailed planning and design of the Identity and Access Management, including definition of customer Business Roles and the creation of an authorization concept document. The authorization concept should ensure: Correctness Completeness Confirmability Verifiability Availability Protection from misusage and manipulation It is recommended that all the requirements and outcomes for Identity and Access Management are documented in one consolidated Authorization Concept.

Task.Name: Plan and Design Identity and Access Management
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to plan and design the Identity and Access Management in SAP S/4HANA Cloud. Follow the procedure below to ensure an effective and efficient plan and design of the Identity and Access Management. Prerequisites: The applications for the project scope have been captured in the Application - Workplace List during the fit-to-standard workshops. The Backlog (tool or template) has been prefilled and updated with values from the fit-to-standard workshops. Procedure: Hand over all of the business requirements captured during and after the fit-to-standard. Consolidate all requirements in one Application-Workplace List (optional). Create a document to describe the scope and framework of the authorization concept. Establish a definition for the naming convention that can be used to realize the customer-specific authorization concept. Refer to the accelerator How to Set Up a Naming Convention for Business Roles, Spaces, and Pages (3-system landscape), for a detailed how-to guide. Define the workplaces that the respective Business areas must specify. Map the SAP S/4HANA Cloud Apps and the corresponding Business Catalogs to the defined workplaces in the Application-Workplace List. Collect all technical information on the identity and Access Management and sign off with customers. Procedure Note(s): An Authorization Concept should ensure the correctness, completeness, confirmability, verifiability, and availability of the data and protect it from misusage and manipulation. The Authorization concept document must be written clearly so that a third party can quickly see how business data is protected against misusage. Use the IAM Information System app to determine the existing Business Catalogs that allow access to specific apps. To find the Business Catalogs, set the Main Entity = Application > enter the app name in the Search field > select 'Go.' SAP Fiori for SAP S/4HANA Cloud new Launchpad functionality maps preassigned Fiori spaces and pages to your business roles. It enhances the user experience of the business roles as they perform their daily business functions. For more information, review the Blog - Get to Know the New Spaces Concept for SAP Fiori Launchpad accelerator. To enable the spaces for your users, use the Help-Enabling Spaces accelerator. For additional information on Identity and Access Management, see accelerator Help - Manage Your SAP S/4HANA Cloud - Identity and Access Management. The information from the Application-Workplace list can be used to support the testing activities (e.g. definition of testcases).

Task.Name: Learning Needs Analysis for Users
Task.Notes: The purpose of the learning needs analysis deliverable is to identify learning and enablement requirements and analysis of the digital learning opportunities. This provides a thorough evaluation of formal and informal learning mechanisms using a 'Push and Pull' methodology. The goal of the learning needs analysis is to ensure the right learning is readily available at the time of need. The focus is on intuitive, consumer focused content, activities and deployment methods that are directly relevant to the learner’s daily life.

Task.Name: Identify Learning Needs Identification Process
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to begin the learning needs analysis process by conducting workshops per line-of-business and workstream, together with the implementation project team, to identify the processes in scope and analyze the required end-user skills needed to achieve solution adoption. Procedure: Align with the key project stakeholders on the learning needs and digital learning opportunities. Review the fit-to-standard workshops to determine the scope of the project. Conduct learning needs analysis workshops per workstream with the subject matter experts to identify target user groups and learning requirements for each business process. Review both Planning a Learning Needs Analysis and Learning Needs Analysis Users Overview accelerator to understand the methods for effectively analyzing and identifying learning requirements for project teams and business users. Inform the business area manager about any and all skill gaps within their respective line-of-business area so that they can address these gaps pre-deployment. Analyze different learning methods and content types used in a learning enablement rollout plan.

Task.Name: Create Learning Curriculum
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to create a list of content types and learning methods that will be used in the learning enablement strategy. Procedure: Provide a fully scoped analysis of learning requirements per end-user group or line-of-business area. Develop the baseline curriculum, based on solutions and business processes in scope for the project. The course catalog will be categorized into functional process and sub-process areas including the key tasks and process overviews, the audience (business role), learning duration, method of delivery, and any pre-requisites required. Estimate resources needed for material creation and delivery. Document a high level content development plan, including which content types are to be developed such as videos, concept slides, e-learning, work instructions and simulations, learning exercises, role support, and knowledge assessments. Map the end-user roles to each learning intervention. Align the learning needs analysis to the change impact analysis (if available). Calculate how much time content development will take and how many resources are needed to develop and deliver enablement content. Enable the trainers to schedule the appropriate formal end-user training and deploy the online or digital learning platform as well.

Task.Name: Review Enablement Business Review
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task to present the learning needs analysis findings to the key business subject matter experts (SME) and key stakeholders. Procedure: Create the learning needs analysis report. Present the learning needs analysis findings to the project and SME's and key stakeholders for review and final sign-off.

Task.Name: Data Load Preparation
Task.Notes: The purpose of this deliverable is to begin data migration. Data migration is the process of taking existing data from a legacy system and preparing it for use in new SAP system. This process is executed iteratively based on the in-scope objects and begins as soon as objects are identified avoiding future delays to the project. The overall process involves the following: Determining the required objects and data sources. Creating plans to extract data, create data, and transform data. Extracting and transforming data. Cleansing unnecessary or incorrect data.

ExtendedAttribute.Value: 2nd Wave Project / Rollout Project, Hybrid Deployment (Two-Tier ERP)

Task.Name: Determine the Required Master Data for SAP S/4HANA Cloud
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to determine the master data objects, data sources, migration methods and extraction/load plan required for the scope of your implementation as determined in the fit-to-standard workshops. This information is crucial for the manual creation of test data and the initial steps of the data migration process. The master data can be generalized as migration objects in SAP S/4HANA migration cockpit. Migration objects contain fields that map to fields in the system. Historical transaction objects (i.e. completed sales orders, completed purchase order, etc) are not migrated to the new system. They are typically available via reporting or other archival retrieval tools. Procedure: Determine all master data objects and allowed values needed to support the business processes documented in the fit-to-standard workshops. See accelerators Master Data Overview.xlsx and Create Your Own Master Data for SAP S/4HANA Cloud for reference information related to the delivered content. Determine the data source for each object. See Help - Migration Objects for SAP S/4HANA Cloud for a list of objects. Determine the migration method for objects: migrate data using staging tables, migrate data directly from SAP system or manual data load. Read the migration object documentation available in the Help - Migration Objects for SAP S/4HANA Cloud for additional information on the fields that are supported. The list can be downloaded into spreadsheet and extended to be used as a tracking tool. Based on the object, source and approach, develop an extraction and data load plan. The dependencies information for every object are available in Help - Migration Objects for SAP S/4HANA Cloud. Choose the needed migration object and check the section Prerequisites. Procedure Note(s): The information about predecessors (dependent) migration objects are available in the Migrate your Data app during the project creation.

Task.Name: Determine Migration Cockpit Field Structures for S/4HANA Cloud (Staging Tables)
Task.Notes: This task is only relevant for migration using staging tables. The purpose of this task is to view the SAP S/4HANA Cloud data structures by downloading the template files and associating the structures with the data from the legacy system(s). After creating the migration project, you can select the migration objects that are relevant to your migration scenario. By using “Migrate Data using Staging Tables” approach, you can download the migration objects templates to view the data structure. Moreover, by filling the staging tables with the files, you need to download templates to specify data and upload it back to your project. If filling staging tables using 3rd party tools, the template files can be used as a guide to the table structures and required fields. Apps Used: Migrate Your Data Procedure: Follow the instructions in the Test Scripts document available via Data Migration to SAP S/4HANA from Staging (‏2Q2‏) to download the Migration Object Templates. Template samples are available in Accel ID = S4H_628. Review the Introduction, Field List and Structure tabs to familiarize yourself with the structures and mandatory fields. This information is relevant to the creation of specifications for data extraction from a legacy system. Understand the dependencies between the objects for prioritization purposes. Procedure Note(s): The templates generated are reflecting available fields as per current release. Always update or check your templates after each release upgrade to avoid errors. Loading the staging tables via file has a limitation for each XML file of 100 MB and it is recommended to use less than 50,000 records in one file. See Notes - Migration Cockpit Search in SAP for Me for Knowledge Bases Articles related to data migration. See Blogs - Migration Cockpit Search in the SAP Community with SAP S/4HANA Cloud tag for related blogs. To determine if objects related to the custom fields created through the Fiori app are extendable, see column “Custom Field Support” in Accel ID = S4H_831.

Task.Name: Extract and Transform Legacy Data
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to extract data from legacy systems and convert it into a format suitable for loading into the staging tables. This involves having a deep understanding of the data in the source systems, the extraction and transformation tools, as well as required formats for the staging tables. Since multiple objects may be involved, this task is carried out iteratively and in accordance with the extraction and transformation plan. Procedure: Extract the necessary data from the legacy systems using a tool that allows for data manipulation. This tool can be a spreadsheet, a database, or other data transformation software. Transform the data to conform to the target field attributes by considering the following points: Adding missing values Remove duplicates or unnecessary data Structure the data so that it can be easily transferred to the load templates Create load files based on the extracted data and load templates.

Task.Name: Data Migration Preparation (ByDesign to S/4HANA Cloud)
Task.Notes: This task is relevant for customers transitioning from SAP Business ByDesign to SAP S/4HANA Cloud. The purpose of this task is to provide guidelines on initializing the data extraction from SAP Business ByDesign system and preparing it for use in SAP S/4HANA Cloud system. This process is executed iteratively based on the in-scope objects and begins as soon as objects are identified avoiding future delays to the project. Procedure: The overall process involves the following steps: Extract the data from SAP Business ByDesign in the form of XML file Upload the iflows provided along with the Data Migration Accelerator to an SAP Business Technology Platform Integration Suite Package Deploy & Execute the Iflow Procedure Note(s): Complete the SAP Discovery Center - Missions: Migrate data from SAP Business ByDesign to SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public to understand the Data Migration process during SAP Business ByDesign to SAP S/4HANA Cloud Migrations. Review the accelerator Blog : Guide for Proposed Migration - SAP Business ByDesign to S/4HANA Public Cloud for detailed instructions on the migration procedure. Only steps 1-3 in the migration guide are to be executed in this task. Review the accelerator Blog - Data Migration Accelerator: SAP Business ByDesign to SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud to get access to the Data Migration Accelerator

Task.Name: Perform Data Cleansing Activities
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to cleanse the legacy data before loading into SAP target system. Inaccurate data or inconsistent formatting should be corrected. Unnecessary data should be removed from the legacy data to reduce the volume of data to load and keep the new system free from extraneous data. Data cleansing should occur on the legacy data as soon as the data migration objects are identified, otherwise this process may become a bottleneck for data migration. Data that populated via integration, such as two-tier systems, should be included in the data assessment and cleansing activities. Procedure: Review data from the legacy systems that will be migrated during the implementation project for relevancy, quality and completeness. Users of the different data can typically provide the best insight into the data quality. Delete or identify rules for omitting legacy objects that should not be included in the migration. Identify data inaccuracies, duplication and obsolesces. Develop plans to correct data issues. Procedure Note(s): In addition, some SAP tools/products such as SAP Data Services can be used to populate the staging tables, provide data transformation and cleansing capabilities. See SAP Data Services for additional information.

ExtendedAttribute.Value: 2nd Wave Project / Rollout Project, Hybrid Deployment (Two-Tier ERP)

Task.Name: Test Planning
Task.Notes: The purpose of this deliverable is to plan, design, and prepare for testing the configured or built system. Key deliverables during this phase include an agreed test strategy and test plan/test schedule. It is important to note the relevant prerequisites that should be in place before end to end takes places. It is necessary to consider and plan for the testing cycles required during testing activities and understand what needs to be completed for testing. During this deliverable, existing tests, quality management processes, and procedures which may occur can be leveraged to support the project. It is recommended that customers appoint a Test Manager to the project at the earliest opportunity. The Test Manager is then able to work with the module process leads as well as technical leads to build up knowledge of business processes before executing the User Acceptance Testing.

Task.Name: Create Test Strategy for SAP S/4HANA Cloud
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to agree on the key elements of the test strategy and document them in the test strategy document. Typically, one signed and approved test strategy will cover the entire project duration and is often owned jointly by the customer and the implementation partner. This step is crucial as it defines how testing will be performed and completed in the project. Before testing starts, all project members and stakeholders must agree and align to the coordinated approach. The test strategy contains the following: Project Testing Objectives and Assumptions: A statement of the objectives and the assumptions around the objectives High-level Test Plan(s): High-level schedule of testing activities Test Scope: Testing activities that are relevant to the project High-Level Processes: List of high-level processes that need to be tested Test Cycle: The commonly used phases of testing within the test execution are listed below: Unit Testing (if applicable) Business Process (String) Testing Integration Testing Data Conversion Testing User Acceptance Testing Testing Approach: A detailed description of how different test types relate to each other (i.e., a successful unit test is a prerequisite for doing a string test, or migration test results may lead to a prerequisite for user acceptance testing) An understanding of how the test phases will be planned and executed What is the content of the test type is Entry and exit into the test phases Who will be involved Testing Deliverables: Test processes per phase, test environment, and test tools Test Automation (Recommended): How will the scope be determined? When will the test automation work start? How and when will the automation test scripts be used? Testing Tools: The following tools are used to perform different tests (i.e., manual test management tool, test automation tool, defect tracking tool) If you use SAP Cloud ALM for Test Management, please check the capabilities. If you are using SAP Cloud ALM, then different test automation tools are available; please check which ones and how to set them up. If you are implementing Hybrid two-tier Deployment Scenarios', Check the SAP Cloud ALM Test Management capabilities for tracking the test results. Defect Management: Description of how defects will be documented (i.e., what information must be documented, any standards that need to be followed) Detail of the defect lifecycle and various statuses Detail of priority and severity of defects Roles and Responsibilities: Description of required test roles and responsibilities (i.e., Test Lead and responsibilities of individual project team members related to testing) Procedure: SAP S/4HANA Cloud customers can review the Test Strategy Template S4HANA Cloud and Test Strategy Recommendations for 3SL Customers in the accelerators section. Additionally, Review the Test Management Guide accelerator. Define and create the project-specific test strategy document. Sign off on the agreed test strategy by all project members and stakeholders.

ExtendedAttribute.Value: 2nd Wave Project / Rollout Project, Hybrid Deployment (Two-Tier ERP)

Task.Name: Create and Schedule Test Plan
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to create test plan for test types and test cycles selected during test planning. A test plan is a group of test cases and processes that reflects the business process sequence and dependences. It should include the timing of execution from project timeline stand point and specify the type of testers should be made available. For example, Business process test at end of each Sprint by business process experts including custom developments. User adoption test as form of end user training before deployment. Procedure: Define the test scope, containing: Test cases Dependencies Prerequisites Test scope agreement by the project team (customer and implementer), involved business process experts, and stakeholders. If you are using SAP Cloud ALM, this is managed by creating your project scope and adding the relevant business processes to it. Optional: Plan resources and timelines. Please refer to the Detailed Test Schedule Template accelerator below. It can be used for tracking and monitoring purposes during the testing phase. A detailed schedule can either be created for the entire project, or for each individual test phase. It contains: Key prerequisite testing activities Scope items (test cases) and unique test case IDs Dependencies and milestones Test execution start dates and duration Resource allocation Timeline showing the testing tasks and when they will occur Test status tracking (if required) Optional: If you are using SAP Cloud ALM, you can prepare your test plans in the tool to visualize the exact timeline of testing. The test cases might not be ready at this time. The test planning can already occur though.

Task.Name: Determine Test Scope
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to define the scope of testing for a project, regardless if the project is executed independently or as part of a release; it needs to be determined in order to ensure the testing environments and testing artifacts are available for execution. With such a variety of testing cycles (e.g. Integration, Regression, Business Process, PUT, User Acceptance, etc.) available, it is important to define the cycles that are required such as supporting the planned conversion event, security roles and profile testing, testing the Hybrid two-tier Deployment Scenarios', Extensibility objects associated with a business process, and interface objects which are not related to business processes. Procedure: Evaluate the existing process and procedures to determine the different testing cycles required to support the project. Use existing processes and procedures to guide decision-making in selecting test cases and scripts. Reference the SAP Signavio Process Navigator for an example of a test script and process flow in the "SAP Best Practices - Process Flow and Test Script (Example)" accelerator. For the effective compilation of test cases and scripts, prioritize critical business apps/reports, evaluate frequently used apps/reports, and analyze past production support issues. If you are implementing Hybrid two-tier Deployment Scenarios', Consider them in the scope of the implementation project when identifying the Integration testing test cases and scripts. Determine the overall test data approach by aligning with the overall data migration approach. The test data approach will be documented as part of the testing strategy. Document the scope in the test strategy document, and execute the test scope in SAP Cloud ALM, or other selected test management tools. As an alternative, use the Intelligent Test Scoper application under Test Automation Tools to generate scope. The same is available in 3SL system as well. Set the required filters to view the optimized scope based on SAP’s standard code changes. Push the generated optimized scope to Manage Upgrade Tests (MUT) by creating a new execution variant. Procedure Note(s): You can push the optimized scope to MUT only when the Application Area filter is applied or when no filters are applied. The button remains disabled in other cases. For more details, see the Help – Filter Optimized Scope Items. Give a suitable name and description to the execution variant you create every time you push the optimize scope to MUT. For more details, see the Help – Push Optimized Scope to Manage Upgrade Tests. As a result, a test strategy, and a defined set of test cycles, test cases, and test scripts in scope to support the conversion project are created.

ExtendedAttribute.Value: 2nd Wave Project / Rollout Project, Hybrid Deployment (Two-Tier ERP)

Task.Name: Phase Closure and Sign-Off Phase Deliverables
Task.Notes: The purpose of this deliverable is to formally close the phase and conduct deliverable sign-off. During this time the project team will: Ensure that all required deliverables from this phase and the project are complete and accurate, and close any outstanding issues Conduct formal Project Quality Gate and identify lessons learned during the phase Capture customer feedback and identify potential customer references

ExtendedAttribute.Value: 2nd Wave Project / Rollout Project, GROW Adoption Plan

Task.Name: Conduct Project Quality Gate
Task.Notes: The purpose of the Quality Gate is to ensure that both compliance and project management standards are being upheld within projects. A Quality Gate is a checklist milestone at the end of a project phase . Prior to moving into the next phase each project manager demonstrates that they have been compliant with the mandatory deliverables associated with a methodology while ensuring best practice standards have been applied to ensure quality. Procedure: Review the QGate Checklist Concept SAP Activate accelerator to ensure an understanding on what should be covered during the Quality Gate. Areas covered should include: Specifically checking deliverables been completed with recommended practices. Assuring project planning. Validating open risks and issues, and measuring customer satisfaction. Conduct the Quality Gate utilizing the applicable Quality Gate Template accelerator.

ExtendedAttribute.Value: 2nd Wave Project / Rollout Project, GROW Adoption Plan, Industry Cloud Apps

Task.Name: Assess Project Performance
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to deliver the Project Performance survey to the appropriate stakeholder groups throughout the remainder of the implementation. This includes the core project management team and each team working to transform a ‘Line of Business’ (LoB) business process (supply chain, finance, etc). Each team will provide project team-related feedback in terms of governance, processes and empowerment during the Explore, Realize and Deploy phases. Procedure: Review the recommendations of the ‘Project Performance’ section of the XM Transformation Procedures accelerator. Identify the survey and reporting recipient groups, listed in the above section of the accelerator, and inform them they are participating in the XM transformation program. Provide these groups (especially report recipients) with enablement on how to use the Project Performance survey and/or interpret the reporting results. Go to the ‘Survey Q’ tab of the XM Transformation Survey Questions accelerator and locate the survey questions, by filtering on the ‘Project Performance’ column. Adapt the survey to the current transformation, finalize and publish. Determine the appropriate frequency of survey (at least quarterly or at end of a phase), noting where other surveys (i.e. Solution Validation) incorporate the same questions, so that they do not coincide with what is already distributed to these same user. Distribute the Project Performance survey. Once the survey response collection period is over, finalize the dashboard and use it to communicate the feedback to report recipients, with follow-up meetings to discuss the findings and recommend corrective measures accordingly. Document the outcomes in an executive summary for Sponsor and Steering Committee quarterly business review activities. Procedure Note(s): If the process is unclear, engage with the XM Advisory experts from: your XM vendor, SAP or implementation partner for assistance. For LoB teams only, the ‘Tracking Goals’ survey takes over from the Project Performance survey, at that phase.

ExtendedAttribute.Value: 2nd Wave Project / Rollout Project, XM Transformation

Task.Name: Obtain Customer Sign-Off for Phase Completion
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to ensure that all required deliverables from this phase and the project are complete and accurate, and close any outstanding issues .Use the Phase Signoff Template accelerator for this task. Procedure: Identify and list all key deliverables from phase delivery. Confirm status of completion and any outstanding actions. Provide signoff document to signatory. Obtain phase signoff and agreement for any possible outstanding actions. Identify lessons learned during the phase Capture customer feedback and identify potential customer references When sign-off is obtained, the project can proceed to the next phase.

ExtendedAttribute.Value: 2nd Wave Project / Rollout Project, GROW Adoption Plan

Task.Name: Realize
Task.Notes: The purpose of this phase is to incrementally build and test an integrated business and system environment that is based on the process requirements identified in the previous phase and captured in the backlog. During the Realize phase, the project team loads customer data into the system, plans adoption activities, and prepares cutover plans and plans for operationally running the solution. Realize Phase Activities: Monitor project activities. Configure the solution in the Development system using incremental build in time-boxed iterations. Replicate the solution in the Test environment. Migrate for data in preparation for testing. Conduct overall end-to-end testing of the business processes the Test environment. Conduct project team and key user training. Set up the production environment. Finalize end user training materials and documentation. Plan cutover activities. Track and report on value delivery. During the Realize phase, the project team uses a series of iterations to incrementally configure, test, confirm, and document the entire end-to-end solution and to load data. The project team actively works with business representatives to ensure good fit of the built solution. The project team releases results of multiple iterations to the business users to accelerate time to value and provide early access to finalized functionalities.

Task.Name: Execution/Monitoring of Project
Task.Notes: The purpose of this deliverable is for the project team to carry out the planned and approved project work and measure project performance to identify variances from the plan. The execution goal is to manage the scope of the work to be done, while monitoring the execution, identifying variances from the plan, monitoring quality results, controlling progress against the plan, controlling changes throughout the project, assessing and responding to risks, and communicating the project status. The Project Management Plan developed during the Prepare phase for each of the PM knowledge areas guides the team's approach to management, execution, monitoring, and control of project activities. This methodology provides steps to be considered when each activity is engaged and supported by the team's monitoring/controlling plans. The project manager is responsible for ensuring that the monitoring/controlling plans developed in the planning phase are applied at the appropriate level of control.

ExtendedAttribute.Value: 2nd Wave Project / Rollout Project, GROW Adoption Plan

Task.Name: Review the SAP S/4HANA Cloud Onboarding Journey
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to provide users with the essential knowledge and resources required to successfully navigate and contribute to projects and implementations involving SAP S/4HANA Cloud. Procedure: Explore the SAP methodology and gain familiarity with measuring project progress & milestones, cutover concept and identification of SAP offerings and services to support the implementation using the 4th Onboarding session - Project Guidance one pager accelerator. Review the SAP S/4HANA Cloud Onboarding Journey one pager accelerator to get familiar with the onboarding journey from the welcome & introduction all the way to go-live preparation. Tune into both live and recorded onboarding webinars using the SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition Onboarding Resource Center accelerator.

Task.Name: Direct and Manage Project Execution
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to execute the project management plan and accomplish the work defined in the project scope statement for the project manager and the project team. Procedure: In executing the project work, the project team will perform the following types of activities: Perform project tasks to reach project objectives Expend effort and funds to accomplish project objectives Staff, train, and manage the project team members assigned to the project Obtain, manage, and utilize resources Implement and execute the planned methods and standards Create, control, verify, and validate project deliverables Manage the scope of the approved work Manage risks and implement risk response activities Manage issues to closure Adapt approved changes into the scope, plans, and project environment Establish and manage internal and external communications Collect project data and report on progress and performance In monitoring/controlling work results, the project team performs the following types of activities: Compare actual project performance to the project management plan Assess performance to determine whether corrective or preventive actions are necessary Monitor and control project risks Provide metrics to support progress and performance reporting and forecasting Monitor implementation of approved changes Take corrective action as needed See topic ‘Analytics’ in the SAP Cloud ALM for Implementation - Expert Portal accelerator for more information on project monitoring in SAP Cloud ALM. Management plans developed during the Prepare phase guide the team's approach to management, execution, and control of project activities. Note: See the “Prepare Project Management Plan” task in Prepare phase for details.

Task.Name: Update Project Management Documents
Task.Notes: The purpose of updating the project management documents task is to ensure that the project manager keeps the key project management documents up-to-date. The project management document is a comprehensive body of project documents that include the project schedule, budget/cost information, monitoring/controlling plans for each of the nine knowledge areas of the Project Management Body of Knowledge (PMBOK), and other information as appropriate. The project management plan document developed for each of the knowledge areas provide the foundation for the consistent application of project management practices. Procedure: Redefine the project schedule, project budget, and update the management plans, scope document and business case to reflect the detailed scope information created during the project. Provide updates to: Project management plan Project WBS Project schedule Project budget Business case Scope document Backlog document (created in Explore phase)

Task.Name: Manage Project Issues, Risks, and Changes
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to manage project issues, risks, and changes. A consistent and thorough approach to managing project issues is essential for an effective project management system. Efficient issue management entails the appropriate managerial decision-making and progress tracking in line with the project's issue management procedure. Identified issues are centralized and maintained within a single environment. Procedure: Utilize a dedicated issue tracking document based on the Open Issues List Template.xls accelerator. The management of issues entails the following steps: An issue is raised and appropriately categorized based on its relevance to system conversion, solution implementation, or solution operations within SAP technology. This issue is logged in the issue tracking tool, either by SAP, a customer, or an implementation partner. During the issue's creation, the individual raising the issue assigns its priority and identifies the responsible person for resolving it. The Project Manager conducts regular follow-ups on issues, in addition to adhering to the standard issue management process outlined in the project's management plans. Critical issues are reviewed as part of the input for each Quality Gate review meeting. Review and update open issues regularly, and communicate these updates to the relevant stakeholder groups as part of the routine project reporting and communication process. Issue tracking enhances visibility and transparency regarding open issues, problems, action items, and associated action plans for the project management team. Use a centralized issue tracking system to oversee and maintain lists of issues that require action and resolution, thereby guaranteeing the project's success.

ExtendedAttribute.Value: 2nd Wave Project / Rollout Project, GROW Adoption Plan

Task.Name: Communicate Project Status and Progress
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to communicate project status and progress. Throughout the project, several project performance reports need to be produced for different purposes and audiences, as defined in the project communication plan. The project manager and project team are responsible for clearly communicating the progress of the key activities, completion of the deliverables, and status against the schedule and budget. Procedure: Produce team member status updates typically every week and share them with the team lead. It is recommended that this report is kept very lightweight and provided to the team lead via e-mail or in a team meeting. Report team status reports on regular cadence, typically weekly. The team status reports are prepared by the team leads and are delivered to the project manager as an input for the project status report. The team status report may be reviewed in regular team review with the Project Manager or provided in a predefined format. Use the project status report template for project status report. Create the project status report on weekly basis, based on the input from individual teams and additional information like issues list, risk list, etc. Prepare executive status report on monthly or quarterly cadence and provide it to the project executive steering group. Generally, in this report re-use the key information from the weekly project status report. Expand on the value and benefits of the program and include discussion of the decisions that are needed from the executive steering group. Review and update the project communication matrix as more is known. The communication matrix documents the project team’s approach to communication. It captures the analysis completed as part of communications planning and serves as a tool to guide the project team throughout the project.

Task.Name: Manage Transports
Task.Notes: The purpose of the task is to provide an overview on managing transports in the SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 3-system landscape. The process involves saving changes first in the Development System, then transporting them to the Test System, and finally to the Production System. For a comprehensive landscape overview with a diagram, refer to Accel ID = S4H_1028. Initially, the Development System is activated starting from SAP Central Business Configuration. It comprises two tenants, Customizing Tenant and Development Tenant, each requiring independent setup. Transports created in the Development Tenant are “local” and cannot be subsequently transported. To activate the Test System and the Production System, it is crucial to use the first activation transport from SAP Central Business Configuration, saved in the Customizing Tenant. Different type of changes (i.e. initial activation, org structure from SAP Central Business Configuration, subsequent configuration activities, roles, output objects, other key user extension and developer extension) use different apps when moving the changes across the landscape. For a detail analysis and comparison of different types, refer to the Transport Management Summary section table in Accel ID = S4H_1028. When planning project activities during Realize phase, consider the following regarding transports: There are system checks (ie. foreign key, dependency, sequence, etc) upon deployment of setting from SAP Central Business Configuration, and release of transports in Development System. It is a best practice to manage transports: By sequence - especially for transports originated from SAP Central Business Configuration before subsequent configuration activity transports. By group - when rolling out a country or a specific business process area as described in activating new scope or country/region. By feature – where related customization and extension changes are required to go together as identified during sprint planning. Trigger import within timelines that is compatible to the downward compatibility rule. Transport released in Development System with version N, should be imported, at the latest, before Test/Production System is upgraded to version N+2. For example, All transports released from Development System in 2202 version, can be imported into to Test/Production system that are on the 2202 version. Most transports released from Development System in 2202 version can still be imported to Test/Production system that is upgraded to the 2208 version (N+1). Some restriction applies to key user extension objects. All transports released from Development System in 2202 version can NOT be imported to Test/Production system that is upgraded to the 2302 version (N+2). Most transports will need to be recreated in the new version to be imported, with the exception of transports deployed from SAP Central Business Configuration, which includes scope, country/region activation and delta transports from updates and upgrades. Become familiar with the process to import collection versions and thus make extension items available for productive usage. Details can be found in the Accel ID = S4H_1814. Select Simple or Flexible transport mode, which has an impact on the business process configuration transports, to suite your project needs. For example, project doesn't have multiple country rollout in scope, have limited business process activations, or with little extension considerations can simplify its overall transport process with Simple Transport Mode. Reference Help - Transport Modes for more details. Both partners and customers need to discuss and evaluate the feasibility of Git-Enabled Change and Transport Management (gCTS App) within the context of Multi-Off Delivery. If gCTS App is used, then partners should refer to task Develop and Transport Developer Extensions for additional information. Procedure: Use Tag ‘Transport Management’ to access the list of tasks related to Transports. Review all tasks' description, steps, and notes including accelerators. Adjust project activities accordingly. Procedure Note(s): Review the enablement session 3-System Landscape - Transport Management Fundamentals on SAP Learning Hub. Before you can access the link, a one-time registration in the SAP Learning Hub, edition for SAP Enterprise Support, is required. Follow the step-by-step guide to complete your registration here. Reference blog post Blog - Transport Management in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 3-System Landscape... for more details about the transport management system capabilities.

ExtendedAttribute.Value: Application Design and Configuration, Extensibility, Project Management, Technical Architecture & Infrastructure

Task.Name: Detailed Change Impact Analysis
Task.Notes: The purpose of this deliverable is to gain insights into how the implementation of the SAP system will affect specific groups of stakeholders. The implementation of a new SAP system goes beyond being solely an IT project and has wide-ranging impacts on the entire organization. Evaluating these impacts requires a good understanding of both the current situation and the envisioned future state. A change impact analysis is best conducted in a workshop setting, where experts from various organizational units and diverse backgrounds can engage in discussions that often uncover valuable insights to facilitate the organizational transition. This collaborative approach promotes a shared understanding of upcoming challenges among project stakeholders. Following the assessment, it is essential to address the identified areas for action with appropriate activities.

Task.Name: Prepare Change Impact Workshops
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to bring the right people together for the assessment and ensure a smooth execution of the workshop. A crucial step in this process is to reach a consensus regarding the appropriate level of detail for discussing the impacts on the new SAP business processes. Breaking down the business process into excessively granular components can result in unnecessary effort, while keeping the discussion too abstract may risk overlooking essential information. Typically, workshop participants consist of managers of the affected business units, alongside selected process owners, subject matter experts, or key users who possess in-depth knowledge of the processes involved. It is recommended to divide the overall implementation scope, possibly by process scope areas, and plan for several short sessions to ensure focused discussions. Additionally, it is essential to prepare the necessary templates in advance. Procedure: Compile a list of relevant SAP business processes and create assessment templates using the Detailed Change Impact Analysis accelerator. Identify and assign workshop participants. Schedule change impact workshops.

Task.Name: Conduct Change Impact Assessment
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to identify the implications of the new SAP business processes for various groups of stakeholders. It is beneficial to have the workshops led by an impartial facilitator. This fosters a comprehensive examination of the change impacts, encompassing not only process and technological changes, but also considerations related to organization and people. The facilitator can also support the group in reaching a consensus on quantifying the change impacts, using categories like high, medium, low, or no impact. These ratings aid in identifying the extent of impact for each business process and stakeholder group, enabling the prioritization of mitigation activities. It is imperative to document both pertinent insights into change impacts and suggestions for specific actions during the workshop. Procedure: Introduce the workshop approach, using the Guiding Questions accelerator. Discuss and and assign ratings to change impacts for all relevant SAP business processes, involving all stakeholder groups responsible for executing these processes using the Detailed Change Impact Analysis accelerator. Document relevant insights and proposals for concrete activities.

Task.Name: Manage Change Impacts
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to facilitate a seamless transition for all affected stakeholder groups to the new SAP solution and the adoption of best practice processes. Representing the workshop outcomes, especially the quantitative ratings visually (e.g., in the form of a heat map), enables the swift identification of areas requiring attention. The initial ideas already collected during the workshops should then be further developed and refined. Typically, some of these activities fall within the scope of organizational change management. Others may concern training, cut-over procedures, or measures to be implemented within the individual business units. Therefore, it is the responsibility of the change manager to ensure that all activities are consolidated into an action plan with clearly defined roles and responsibilities for execution. Procedure: Consolidate and visually represent the outcomes of the workshops, utilizing the Result Visualization accelerator. Collect additional suggestions for addressing identified areas requiring action. Define an action plan and assign distinct responsibilities for each activity using the Action Plan accelerator.

Task.Name: Request the SAP S/4HANA Cloud Development System / Initial Setup
Task.Notes: The purpose of this deliverable is to request the Development system and set up the related implementation projects in Central Business Configuration.

Task.Name: Request the SAP S/4HANA Cloud Development System
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to request the SAP S/4HANA Cloud Development System. There are two tenants in the Development System: Customizing and Development. The 'IT Contact' makes the requests in SAP for Me and will then receive an email with the URL and Login instructions. Prerequisite: Receive SAP S/4HANA Cloud Starter System (Starter Customizing and Starter Development tenants) Procedure: Request the SAP S/4HANA Cloud Development Systems in SAP for Me via the SAP for Me - Dashboards > Systems & Provisioning > Provisioning accelerator. Locate the 'SAP S/4HANA Cloud Customizing tenant' in the ‘Provisioning’ section under ’Product Available for Provisioning' and click on 'Start Provisioning.' The Development tenant will be triggered automatically after Customizing tenant is provisioned successfully. The request will trigger the system provisioning, and an email will be sent to the 'IT contact' when the system is available. Procedure Note(s): SAP recommends not to request the SAP S/4HANA Cloud Development System during the upgrade window; the System can be requested before the start of the upgrade or after it is completed. Refer to the Upgrade and Maintenance Schedule - 3 System Landscape accelerator for a complete overview of the upgrade schedule of SAP S/4HANA Cloud.

Task.Name: Set Up Customizing Tenant in SAP Central Business Configuration
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to perform the initial configuration of the Customizing tenant, and trigger the system activation. After these tasks are complete, the system will be ready for project team access. The activities are guided and executed via SAP Central Business Configuration. Prerequisites: Starter System must be available, and Development System has been requested Completed task Conduct Project Quality Gate for Explore, including the following: Fit-to-standard Analysis completed Configuration definition completed Organizational Structure Defined Chart of Accounts defined Fiscal Year Variant defined Group Currency defined Procedure: Log on to the Project Experience in the SAP Central Business Configuration and create a project for the Customizing tenant. See section 'Selecting Your Project (Initial Logon)' in the Help - Project Experience accelerator for the detailed steps to complete the activity. Complete the SAP Central Business Configuration activities and milestones for setting up the Development System. See the " Implementation Project" section in the Help - Project Experience accelerator for additional information on completing the activities. While defining configuration values, please ensure that Organizational Structure, Fiscal Year Variant, Group Currency and Group Ledger are correct before triggering the activation. These values cannot be changed after activation. Below is a summary of the activities: Scoping Assign a Deployment Target Milestone Confirming Scoping is Completed Setup Org Structure Primary Finance Settings Milestone Completing the Scope and Organizational Structure Phase Procedure Note(s): When defining the initial scope or adding a new scope or country/region, it is recommended to limit the number of countries/regions to no more than five. Content from this scope must be processed and transported to Production before adding the next set of countries/regions. Check SAP Note 3151804 - Country Activation Guidance in Central Business Configuration for best practices. A Transport Request is created in Customizing Tenant of S/4HANA Cloud Development System upon completion of this set up. Task in the Transport Request is automatically released upon a successful consistency check performed in the background. In case of any error, support ticket will be automatically created for SAP Cloud Operations team to address with customer. The Transport Task will remain in status "Modifiable" and workspace in SAP Central Business Configuration will remain locked until issue is resolved. The Transport Task status will be set to "Released“ upon issue resolution and customer can then proceed with moving the transport request across systems. To avoid transport dependency issues, it is recommended that customer to release this initial transport request before carrying out further configuration activities. JSON file of your scope selection from Digital Discovery Assessment can be uploaded in Define Scope app. Reference the Importing Scope section under Scoping in Help - Project Experience accelerator.

Task.Name: Set Up Development Tenant in SAP Central Business Configuration
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to perform the initial configuration of the Development tenant, and trigger the system activation. After these tasks are complete, the system will be ready for project team access. The activities are guided and executed via SAP Central Business Configuration. Prerequisites: A starter System must be available, and Development System has been requested Completed task Conduct Project Quality Gate for Explore, including the following: Fit-to-standard Analysis completed Configuration definition completed Organizational Structure defined Chart of Accounts defined Fiscal Year Variant defined Group Currency defined Procedure: Logon to the Project Experience in the SAP Central Business Configuration and create a project for the Development tenant.
