See section 'Selecting Your Project (Initial Logon)' in the Help - Project Experience accelerator for the detailed steps to complete the activity. Complete the SAP Central Business Configuration activities and milestones for setting up the Development System. See the " Implementation Project" section in the Help - Project Experience accelerator for additional information on completing the activities. While defining configuration values, please ensure that Organizational Structure, Fiscal Year Variant, Group Currency and Group Ledger are correct before triggering the activation. These values cannot be changed after activation. Below is a summary of the activities: Scoping Assign a Deployment Target Milestone Confirming Scoping is Completed Setup Org Structure Primary Finance Settings Milestone Completing the Scope and Organizational Structure Phase Procedure Note(s): We recommend the customer to at least setup Org structure for the business process area(s) and add the scope items captured from task Detail Design for Developer Extensibility

Task.Name: Initial System Access for SAP S/4HANA Cloud Development System
Task.Notes: The purpose of this deliverable is to receive the SAP S/4HANA Cloud Development system, prepare key user access, and adapt the Chart of Accounts prior to requesting the Test System. There are two tenants in the Development System: Customizing and Development. This deliverable supports the SAP S/4HANA Cloud without Employee Central (S4-EC). Please note: G/L account renumbering is only possible in the Development System before the first posting has been made in the production system. See Request Production System deliverable for more information.

ExtendedAttribute.Value: Identity and Access Management, Transport Management

Task.Name: Initial Access to the Development System
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is for the 'Initial Admin User' to receive the e-mails with the activation links for the Development System, access it, and create users. This process is followed twice: once for the Customizing tenant and once for the Development tenant. The Identity Authentication service is shared with the Starter System, and a new provisioning email will not be sent. The exception is if the 'Initial Admin User' has been changed after the Starter System activation, then the new Initial Amin User will be given administrative privileges and a new email will be sent. Prerequisite: Request the SAP S/4HANA Cloud Development System Set Up Customizing Tenant in SAP Central Business Configuration Set Up Development Tenant in SAP Central Business Configuration Procedure: Locate the provisioning email sent to the ‘Initial Admin User.’ Click on the access link (URL) provided (it is single sign-on enabled, and there is no password). Create users in the development system by following the instructions provided in the Help - Initial System Access to SAP S/4HANA Cloud accelerator. Procedure Note(s): For the SAP S/4HANA Cloud system, the initial user has administration rights. It can be used to create additional users with the same administration responsibilities. If the person receiving the cloud system emails (IT Contact) is incorrect, enter an incident under the component XX-S4C-OPR-SRV and Title 'Request update to the Contact Person IT.' In the text, please request an update to the IT Contact and Communication User. Only one person is assigned as an IT Contact. This person receives the system provisioning notifications and is the primary contact for the systems. Multiple people can be assigned as Communication Contacts. These people receive general communications related to the SAP S/4HANA Cloud system. These assignments can be requested via the SAP for Me - Manage Cloud Service Availability Notifications accelerator. For additional information on the cloud product availability and maintenance, refer to the Cloud Availability Center & Cloud System Notification Subscriptions accelerator. The SAP S/4HANA User Name in the Development System must match the User Name in the Starter System (if existing) for access to both. These should match the Login Name in the Identity Authentication service. The user name can be changed manually after the upload in any of the systems if required. The Person ID and User ID are internal numbers and do not need to match the User Name. The app IAM Information System can be used to determine the existing roles that allow access to specific apps. To find the roles, set the Main Entity = Application, enter the app name in the Search field, and press 'Go.'

Task.Name: Request the SAP S/4HANA Cloud Test System
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to request the Test System. The 'IT Contact' makes the requests in SAP for Me and will then receive an email with the URL and Login instructions.

Task.Name: Request the SAP S/4HANA Cloud Test System
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to request the Test System via Accel ID = S4H_888. It is recommended to request the Test System only when transports are ready to be released from the Development System and Imported to the Test System for testing. The Test System will be provisioned without the initial configuration. Before performing other manual rework in the Test System, the initial configuration must be released from the Development System to the Test System. Prerequisite: Receive SAP S/4HANA Cloud Development System(Customizing and Development tenants) Procedure: Request the SAP S/4HANA Cloud Test System in SAP for Me via the SAP for Me - Dashboards > Systems & Provisioning > Provisioning accelerator. Locate the 'SAP S/4HANA Cloud Test System' n the ‘Provisioning’ section under ’Product Available for Provisioning' and click on 'Start Provisioning.' The request will trigger the system provisioning, and an email will be sent to the 'IT contact' when the system is available.

Task.Name: Initial System Access for SAP S/4HANA Cloud Test System
Task.Notes: The purpose of this deliverable is to receive the SAP S/4HANA Cloud Test system, prepare key user access and trigger the transport of configuration from the Development System to the Test System. This deliverable supports the SAP S/4HANA Cloud without Employee Central (S4-EC).

ExtendedAttribute.Value: Identity and Access Management, Transport Management

Task.Name: Initial Access to the Test System
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is for the 'Initial Admin User' to receive the Test System provisioning e-mail with the details to access it, perform the initial configuration transport to the Test System, and create users. The Identity Authentication service is shared with the Development System, and a new provisioning email will not be sent. The exception is if the Initial Admin User has been changed after the Starter System activation, then the new Initial Admin User will be given administrative privileges and a new email will be sent. Prerequisite: Request the SAP S/4HANA Cloud Test System Review task Manage Transports Procedure: Locate the provisioning email sent to the ‘Initial Admin User’ and access the System with the information provided in the email. Perform the initial configuration transport from the Customizing Tenant of the Development System to the Test System. The procedure is required for customers who just received their initial Test System. The transport request must be released from the Customizing Tenant of the Development System and imported to the Test System before the Test System can be used. Follow the instructions in the Help - Initial System Access to SAP S/4HANA Cloud accelerator for step-by-step instructions on the initial transport to Test System. Create users in the Test System. Refer to the instructions in the Help - Initial System Access to SAP S/4HANA Cloud accelerator for user creation in the Test System. Additional videos and templates are in the accelerator section. Procedure Note(s): For the SAP S/4HANA Cloud system, the initial user has administration rights. It can be used to create additional users with the same administration responsibilities. SAP recommends triggering the initial import as soon as possible within the timelines compatible with the downward compatibility rule. Transport released in the Development System in version N should be imported, at the latest, before the Test System is upgraded to version N+2. Please refer to the task Manage Transports in the Realize phase under the deliverable Execution Monitoring of the Project. There are two tenants in the Development System: Customizing and Development. From the Development tenant in the Development system, no transport of customizing and key user extensibility objects is possible. A default customizing transport request is technically required but not used to transport content to any other system. The initial transport from SAP Central Business Configuration can’t be recreated in another release version. SAP strongly advises customers to import this initial transport, at the latest, after one release upgrade. In case of any errors during the initial configuration deployment or the transport request release, a support ticket will be automatically created for the SAP Cloud Operations team. If that is the case, the transport tasks will remain in status ‘Modifiable,’ and the SAP Central Business Configuration workspace will remain locked until the issue is resolved. The transport task status will be set to ‘Released’ upon issue resolution, and the release and import of the transport request can proceed. For customers using SAP Cloud ALM, the Feature app serves as a tool to consolidate all related configuration and extension transports that can be transported together. The Feature Traceability functionality within Analytics offers an overview of the deployment progress. If the person receiving the cloud system emails (Initial Admin User) is incorrect, enter an incident under the component XX-S4C-OPR-SRV and Title 'Request update to the Contact Person IT.' In the text, please request an update to the IT Contact and Communication User. Only one person is assigned as an IT Contact. This person receives the system provisioning notifications and is the primary contact for the systems. Multiple people can be assigned as Communication Contacts. These people receive general communications related to the SAP S/4HANA Cloud system. These assignments can be requested via the SAP for Me - Manage Cloud Service Availability Notifications accelerator. For additional information on the cloud product availability and maintenance, refer to the Cloud Availability Center & Cloud System Notification Subscriptions accelerator. The SAP S/4HANA User Name in the Test System must match the User Name in the Starter System (if existing) for access to both. These should match the Login Name in the Identity Authentication service. The user name can be changed manually after the upload in any of the systems if required. The Person ID and User ID are internal numbers and do not need to match the User Name. The app IAM Information System can be used to determine the existing roles that allow access to specific apps. To find the roles, set the Main Entity = Application, enter the app name in the Search field, and press ‘Go.’ Business Roles can be downloaded and uploaded to different systems eliminating redundant maintenance.

Task.Name: Request the SAP S/4HANA Cloud Production System
Task.Notes: The purpose of this deliverable is to request the Production System. This should occur only after the initial configuration is made available in the Test System. After the Production System is delivered, the configuration between both the Test System and the Production System are kept synchronized using the transport process.

Task.Name: Evaluate the Need for a Sandbox Tenant
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to review and determine if there is a need for an SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition, sandbox tenant. The SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition, sandbox tenant, is a standard, non-productive, and stand-alone tenant provisioned with SAP sample data by choice. This single-system environment is isolated from the customer's Development, Test, and Productive systems making it ideal for evaluating and testing application configurations and add-ons. In addition, new scope items can be activated and explored. The sandbox tenant provides an alternative environment for fit-to-standard workshops after the Starter system has been decommissioned and is highly recommended to support expansion of countries, functionality or scope items after the initial go live. The sandbox tenant requires an additional subscription. Procedure: Review the SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition, sandbox tenant Factsheet (3-system landscape) accelerator to become enabled on the tenant and determine if it meets the customer's needs. Determine if the use case, the system specifications, and the add-ons are enabled to meet the customer’s needs. Become enabled on the conditions, operations procedures, and considerations to understand the system and process behavior. Order the SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition, sandbox tenant through an SAP representative or partner as required. Request the SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition, sandbox tenant via SAP for Me once the subscription has been signed and processed. Access the SAP for Me - Dashboards > Systems and Provisioning > Provisioning accelerator. Locate the 'SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition, sandbox tenant' in the ‘Provisioning’ section under ’Product Available for Provisioning' and click on ‘Start Provisioning.’ The request will trigger the tenant provisioning, and an email will be sent to the 'IT contact/initial admin user' when the tenant is available. Locate the provisioning email sent to the ‘IT Contact’ and click on the access link (URL) provided (it is a single sign-on enabled, and there is no password needed).

Task.Name: Request the SAP S/4HANA Cloud Production System
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to request the Production System via Accel ID = S4H_888. Once the system is requested, the SAP S/4HANA Cloud Starter System will be automatically decommissioned by SAP 30 calendar days after the SAP S/4HANA Cloud Production System provisioning email is sent. SAP for Me will prompt you to acknowledge the SAP S/4HANA Cloud Starter System will be decommissioned once the Production System is triggered. It is important to understand that this action cannot be undone, so ensure that all project activities requiring the Starter System can be completed by the planned decommission date. The Production System should be requested before the Development System is on two releases prior, especially when transports are released in the buffer waiting for import. There are restrictions on how long a transport can remain in the buffer before it is imported into the Test or Production systems. Transports created in Development System two releases prior can’t be imported into the Production System. The Production System will be provisioned without the initial configuration. Before performing other manual rework in the Production System, the initial configuration must be released from the Development System to the Test System and successfully forwarded into the Production System. See the ‘Managing the Initial Content Transport and the Custom Business Roles Transport’ section of Help - Initial System Access to SAP S/4HANA Cloud from the Accelerators for details. Prerequisites: Receive SAP S/4HANA Cloud Test System Configuration transported from Development System to Test System Procedure: Request the SAP S/4HANA Cloud Production System in SAP for Me via the SAP for Me - Dashboards > Systems & Provisioning > Provisioning accelerator. Locate the 'SAP S/4HANA Cloud Production System' in the ‘Provisioning’ section under ’Product Available for Provisioning' and click on 'Start Provisioning.' The request will trigger the system provisioning, and an email will be sent to the 'IT contact' when the system is available.

Task.Name: Initial System Access for SAP S/4HANA Cloud Production System
Task.Notes: The purpose of this deliverable is to access the Production System, set up the initial user access and transport configuration into the Production System.

Task.Name: Initial Access to the Production System
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is for the 'Initial Admin User' to access the Production System, forward initial configuration from Test System to the Production System before using the system, and create users. For the initial transport to the Production System, his initial transport into the Customizing Tenant of Development System from SAP Central Business Configuration can’t be recreated in another release version. SAP strongly advises customers to import this initial transport, at the latest, after one release upgrade. Prerequisite: Request and receive Production System Procedure: Locate the provisioning emails sent to the ‘Initial Admin User' and access the Production System via the link (URL) provided (it is single sign-on enabled, and there is no password). Locate the single activation email for the Identity Authentication service and reset the Identity Authentication Service Administration Console password. Forward the initial configuration from the Test System to the Production System. This transport must be done before the Production System can be used. The procedure is required for customers who just received their initial Production System and need to adapt the original configurations made in the Test System. Follow the step-by-step guide in the Help - Initial System Access to SAP S/4HANA Cloud accelerator. Create users in the Production system by following the instructions in the Help - Initial System Access to SAP S/4HANA Cloud accelerator. Additional videos and templates are in the accelerator section. For login issues, please create an incident using the component XX-S4C-OPR-INC. Procedure Note(s): For the SAP S/4HANA Cloud system, the initial user has administration rights. It can be used to create additional users with the same administration responsibilities. If the Production System is integrated with SAP SuccessFactors Employee Central, users are created in SAP SuccessFactors Employee Central and transferred to the SAP S/4HANA Cloud. However, the business roles must still be assigned in the SAP S/4HANA Cloud. The app IAM Information System can be used to determine the existing roles that allow access to specific apps. To find the roles, set the Main Entity = Application, enter the app name in the Search field, and press ‘Go.’ Business Roles can be downloaded and uploaded to different systems eliminating redundant maintenance. Additional help can be found in the SAP S/4HANA Cloud Help Portal accelerator. The changes to the standard chart of accounts and organizational structure will be transported into the Production System. For customers using SAP Cloud ALM, the Feature app serves as a tool to consolidate all related configuration and extension transports that can be transported together. The Feature Traceability functionality within Analytics offers an overview of the deployment progress and can be used to track if the transport is already assigned to a feature.

Task.Name: Enablement Content Development
Task.Notes: The purpose of this deliverable is the development of readily-accessible, easily digestible and end-user specific enablement content. This helps to facilitate and ensure an easy and effective adoption of solution knowledge and skills needed by the organizations end-users for higher system adoption and productivity.

Task.Name: Create a Content Development Plan
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to create a content development plan with defined roles and responsibilities for the developers creating the content. Content development should be monitored against the project deadlines. Procedure: Structure and divide the learning topics identified in the learning needs analysis report into the different learning modules. Analyze the suitability of different learning content types in terms of end-user needs, learning complexity and quantity. Content should reflect the business criticality of the role carrying out the work, process area and subjects covered, while focusing on the end-user experience. Define the review process and workflows for each piece of content. Review both Managing Content Development and Enablement Content Development Overview accelerator to comprehend how to recognize the crucial elements and prerequisites for creating enablement content. Create the content development plan with defined roles and responsibilities for the developers creating the content. Monitor development progress against project timelines: formally track review and sign-off for each piece of enablement content that is developed.

Task.Name: Manage Content Design and Content Development
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to undertake the learning enablement content design and development work with the clearly defined content development plan, a clear quality assurance process and to monitor against project timelines. Procedure: Review what existing in-product learning tutorials for SAP S/4HANA Cloud are relevant for the project. Identify which of these standard in-product learning tutorials should be customized to fit the project requirements. List the additional learning topics that will need to be created in addition to the standard tutorials. Identify and engage subject matter experts for business process knowledge transfer to the content developers. Deliver a workshop to the content designers and developers to introduce each deliverable template, branding and communications standards, the content review and final sign-off process and content publishing channel(s). Introduce the content development tracker to the team and explain how content development is tracked on a regular basis (to be determined by the Training Manager). Provide authoring tools, templates, and/or style guides to support the coherent look and feel of the learning enablement content. Adhere to branding standards and the organizational tone of voice. Adhere to the learning content review and sign-off process. Publish content to the agreed channels. Procedure Note(s): In-Product Tutorials are not available for all products. Additional product tutorials may have to be created based on the customer scope.

Task.Name: Sprint Planning and Execution
Task.Notes: The purpose of this deliverable is to plan sprints iteratively and close upon completion of solution delivery.

ExtendedAttribute.Value: Analytics, Application Design and Configuration, Extensibility, Integration, Project Management
2nd Wave Project / Rollout Project, Artificial Intelligence Technology, Hybrid Deployment (Two-Tier ERP), Identity and Access Management, Output Management, Transport Management

Task.Name: Plan the Sprint for SAP S/4HANA Cloud
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to iteratively plan the execution of a sprint. A clear set of features should be identified for solution realization from the central backlog of requirements from Fit-to-Standard workshops to enable defined target business processes. Conduct sprint planning meetings to set the scope and highlight dependency of work from different workstreams to ensure collaboration of project team members during the sprint. The goal of these sprints is to incrementally and iteratively build the solution capabilities captured in the backlog, test them and review their completion with the customer process owners (product owner in agile terminology). At the beginning of the sprint the project team runs a planning meeting during which, select item from the overall backlog item list taking into consideration of the priority of items and resource availability. For customer using SAP Cloud ALM, use Feature app in SAP Cloud ALM to capture the requirements and user stories to be realized in the sprint. Procedure: Conduct planning meeting to: Decompose each backlog item further to tasks that need to be completed during the sprint. These tasks may be configuration, coding, unit testing, data preparation, documentation and others. Validate the original estimates for each backlog item. Ensure all details in the backlog item so the team can complete the topic as efficiently as possible. In addition, ensure that team has sufficient capability to finalize all items in a timely basis. Ensure that the sprint schedule is in alignment with the backlog schedule for integrated applications as well. Project team should align on their respective responsibility and activities for the sprint. Business Process Experts should understand the business processes being enabled by the solution development carried out during the sprint and be prepared for testing Configuration Experts should plan to have one Default transport request to capture business process setting change s in a sprint. They should also plan for data and settings required for customizing to be maintained in respective system to be aligned with transportable settings. Extension Experts should plan to have one transport request for each feature that they are working on and align with other project team member (i.e. Configuration Expert, Analytics Expert, etc) to synchronize on the moving of developments across the system landscape that has dependencies. System Administrator should plan to make sure all related configuration and developments are moved across the system landscape consistently. For customer using SAP Cloud ALM, leverage the Feature app to track all related configuration and extension transports for the sprint scope. Procedure Note(s): Reference single and multi-country deployment accelerator on best practice. It is recommended to have a dedicated sprint for Upgrade. It is a good practice to move transport requests through entire system landscape upon completion of a sprint.

ExtendedAttribute.Value: Analytics, Application Design and Configuration, Extensibility, Integration, Project Management
2nd Wave Project / Rollout Project, Artificial Intelligence Technology, Identity and Access Management, Industry Cloud Apps, Output Management, Transport Management

Task.Name: Execute the Sprint
Task.Notes: The purpose of the task is to execute the tasks that have been planned. Procedure: Keep track of the progress on the team board. The team board contains swim lanes showing the status of each backlog item and each task. Use boards on the wall and use the post-it notes to keep visual track of their progress. Regularly update the burn-down chart that is used to track the progress of completing the individual tasks and backlog items. Review the progress daily in the daily stand-up meeting. The daily stand-up meeting is not a project status meeting, but rather a session designed to help the team communicate the progress with each other. During the daily stand-up meeting the team members review the: Progress they have made since last meeting; Plans for activities and tasks until the next meeting Any issues of blockers that may prevent them from completing the tasks they are working on. Reference deliverables for sprint execution details in respective areas: Solution Configuration and New Scope Activation Integration Setup New Scope Activation Artificial Intelligent Analytics Identify and Access Extension Testing Procedure Note(s): Data migration, enablement content development and delivery, and cut over preparation are usually executed independent of a sprint and follows their own respective timeline in Realize phase.

ExtendedAttribute.Value: Analytics, Application Design and Configuration, Extensibility, Integration, Project Management
2nd Wave Project / Rollout Project, Artificial Intelligence Technology, Identity and Access Management, Output Management, Transport Management

Task.Name: Close the Sprint
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to close sprint with demo or solution walkthrough, a retrospective meeting and obtain formal acceptance and signoff of the sprint, if applicable. Procedure: Prepare and conduct the sprint demo meeting, where project team walks through the solution by demonstrating to the business owners or stakeholders the completed functionality. Seek acceptance of the completed features. During this meeting the business owner may request additional items to be added to the backlog. In case some features are not accepted they are brought back into the project backlog as requirement, properly prioritized and included in planning for next sprint. SCRUM Master organizes and facilitates the retrospective meeting for the team. Schedule the meeting shortly after the sprint demo meeting. Continuously improve the Scrum process using lessons learned from the sprint execution. Ask meeting participants to answer the following questions: What went well during the sprint? What do we want to preserve? What can be improved for the next sprint and how? Selects one or two improvement opportunities and put it into the backlog for the next sprint. This way the agile process gets improved in an incremental way and remains responsive to the changing environment of the project. Procedure Note(s): Solution walkthrough with business users, decisions makers prior to the close of the sprint is highly recommended. It ensures understanding of how solution will be used to run the business.

ExtendedAttribute.Value: Analytics, Application Design and Configuration, Extensibility, Integration, Project Management, Testing
2nd Wave Project / Rollout Project, Artificial Intelligence Technology, Hybrid Deployment (Two-Tier ERP), Identity and Access Management, Parallel Project Line, SAP BTP Apps

Task.Name: Required Configuration Before System Use - SAP S/4HANA Cloud
Task.Notes: The purpose of this deliverable is to complete the initial required configuration in SAP S/4HANA system based on the decisions made during the fit-to-standard analysis workshops. This configuration is required before transactions are executed in system.

Task.Name: Configure Tax Solution
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to configure the tax solution in SAP S/4HANA Cloud if one of the following scenarios is relevant: Setting up US Jurisdictions Code Integration to an External Tax Package Adding Tax Code Time-Dependent Tax Calculation (TDT) Pro Rata VAT Registration for Indirect Taxation Abroad (RITA) Procedure: Setup Jurisdictions Code (For US Only) - The tax jurisdiction codes and related tax rates must be created in the system and assigned to location specific objects. See SAP note 2440096 for internal tax calculation restrictions. Follow the instructions in the Setup of Internal Tax Jurisdictions accelerator. Note that the Tax Jurisdictions setup must be performed prior to any other configuration or organizational structure extensions. Transport the change project to the P-System. Activate the Tax Jurisdiction in the P-System via the Import Tax Codes after Transport app. Integration to External Tax Partner SAP S/4HANA Cloud delivers internal tax calculation by default. For certain countries, you can switch to the external tax solution to work with an external tax partner. Please note that your tax solution is set up at the country level. It is not possible to run both the internal and external tax solutions for the same country. Tax calculation must be configured before extending any organizational structures. For the US, review the following: It is imperative that the information listed in SAP Notes and guides are understood prior to implementing the external solution. SAP note 2598888 for integration information for the external US tax calculation including the configuration guide for integration SAP_COM_0177. SAP note 2528016 with the current restrictions regarding external US tax calculation. The external US tax calculation in SAP S/4HANA Cloud and any reporting based on this calculation may not meet all the reporting requirements of US tax laws. All available tax APIs can be found in the SAP Business Accelerator Hub. Select the SAP S/4HANA Cloud tile and search for “External Tax”. The tiles for the six APIs are displayed. Please note that "External Tax - Mass Redefine Tax Jurisdiction Code" and "External Tax - Get Changed Jurisdiction Code List" are optional services that are used for the mass update feature. You need to integrate these two services if you wish to use the mass update feature. The mass update consists of two service calls that run in sequence. The first, the “Get Changed Jurisdiction Code List” service, communicates with your tax partner to retrieve a table of tax jurisdiction codes that have changed within a specified period. The second, the “Mass Redefine Tax Jurisdiction Code” service, sends your tax partner a list of address information for those items where there were changes and your partner’s system returns a list of updated jurisdiction codes. This feature can be used for periodic maintenance. The certified tax partners are listed in the SAP Certified Solutions Directory accelerator and tax applications available can be found in the SAP App Center accelerator. See the Setup Guide for External Sales and Use Tax Calc (0177) accelerator for additional setup procedures. Prerequisites are an activated SAP S/4HANA Cloud system and SAP Business Technology Platform, corresponding certificates have been uploaded, and administrator access to SAP S/4HANA Cloud and CPI. For Brazil, review the following: External tax calculation for Brazil is supported by SAP S/4HANA Integration with External Tax Calculation Engine. A subscription to your preferred tax partner engine is also required. All available tax APIs can be found in the SAP Business Accelerator Hub. From the SAP Business Accelerator Hub, select product “SAP S/4HANA Cloud” tile. Go to “API” tab and select “SAP S/4HANA Integration with External Tax Calculation Engine” tile below “Packages” on the page. For Brazil, select “Tax Determination and Calculation via Integration Flow (Brazil)“. The certified tax partners are listed in the SAP App Center accelerator. For Adding Tax Codes Verify that additional tax codes are supported for your country/region by reviewing the list in the Expert Configuration for Tax Codes Common template (if applicable). If your country/region is not supported, please see the SAP Customer Influence Council task. In countries where time-dependent tax calculation (TDT) is active, certain tax rates are effective within user-specified timeframes to allow you to adapt the current or planned changes to tax rates (see topic Time-Dependent Taxes in Help - Tax Processing). Review the standard SAP S/4HANA Cloud delivered tax codes using the Display Tax Information per Country app (no tax rates are displayed for Canada and US) and determine the additional tax codes needed. Fill out the Expert Configuration for Tax Codes template with the additional tax codes. Use the Expert Configuration for Tax Codes Common template. Create an Incident/Service Request with the Subject ‘Request expert configuration for new tax code’, Description ‘Please perform expert configuration per the attached document’ and component XX-S4C-SRV-CON. Once expert configuration is complete, DO NOT CLOSE SERVICE REQUEST. The incident will be needed to activate the change in Production. Review the new tax codes using the Display Tax Information per Country app (no tax rates are displayed for Canada and US) and check, that the codes are created as requested. Perform the required tax determination in Sales and Purchasing business areas. Test all your business processes which are tax relevant with new tax codes. Some master data and configuration may be required to execute a test. Using the previous Service Request, request that the service center transports and activates the new Tax Codes in the P-System. If the request was closed, create a new request. For Countries Where Time-Dependent Tax Calculation (TDT) is in Scope If you have not previously activated the target country in SAP S/4HANA Cloud, time-dependent taxes are active as soon as you activate that target country. If you have previously activated the target country in SAP S/4HANA Cloud, then you need to migrate your existing custom-created and transactional data. Follow the steps described in the topic Activating Time-Dependent Taxes under the Help - Tax Processing accelerator. For Countries Where Pro Rata VAT is in Scope Create pro rata tax codes that can trigger the automatic splitting of deductible and non-deductible portion (Configuration Step 101016 - Define Tax Codes for Sales and Purchases) Define pro rata coefficients (Configuration Step 103619 - Define Pro Rata Coefficients) Based on this configuration, the system can then automatically split the input VAT into deductible and non-deductible portions when an incoming invoice is posted, using the valid coefficient for the company code and the tax code on the relevant date. The coefficient represents the portion of the input tax that can be deducted. For example, if the pro rata coefficient is 90% and the standard VAT rate is 21%, then 18.9% (21% × 90%) is deductible and 2.1% (21% × 10%) is non-deductible. Registration for Indirect Taxation Abroad (RITA) enables indirect tax calculation and reporting for multiple countries/regions within a single legal entity. To activate: Consider to the Prerequisites Prepare and schedule RITA migration, following the steps as described in help. Migration uses configuration item(s) with guided statuses to reduce complexity. You can run tests in your Q system for migration in status 4. Refer to Verify and Complete the Migration to RITA. When you decide to use the solution productively, open a ticket so that SAP services can complete the migration. Once completed, configuration can be initiated as instructed here. Procedure Note(s):

Task.Name: Adapt Chart of Accounts
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to adapt and confirm your Chart of Accounts that was defined in the Explore phase. The Chart of Accounts (CoA), a list of all G/L Account master records, is part of the pre-delivered SAP Best Practices reference content. YCOA is the global standard operating CoA in SAP S/4HANA Cloud and it is assigned to all company codes pre-delivered by SAP. Chart of Account renumbering is only needed when there are changes needed for standard pre-delivered Chart of Accounts (YCOA, YGR1, pre-delivered Local CoAs). If no changes are required, and you want to keep the SAP Best Practices account IDs and descriptions, the only requirement is to confirm the CoA settings provided. Please note: G/L Account renumbering is only possible for the G/L Accounts where postings do not exist in Production System, G/L account renumbering can only be executed in a Devlopment System. Prerequisites: Development System is provisioned. SAP Central Business Configuration, set to the ‘Product-Specific Configuration’ phase. During the execution of the renumbering via Convert Renumbered G/L Accounts app only the configuration expert is logged on to the Development System. Procedure: Access SAP Central business Configuration > Business Processes Configuration > Renumber G/L Accounts to specify mappings for G/L Accounts that require renumbering. Use the Convert Renumbered G/L Accounts app to convert the values for G/L accounts based on the mappings defined. Procedure Note(s): The G/L Account renumbering can be repeated multiple times as long as no postings are entered in the Production System. To access the Chart of Accounts Determination templates (Global and Local), use the SAP Signavio Process Navigator accelerator and follow the path provided: SAP Best Practices for SAP S/4HANA Cloud > select Country localization in ‘Version’ > navigate to the ‘Accelerators’ section> select ‘Account determination (local)’ or ‘Account determination (global)’ under the ‘Implementation’ grouping. See Chart of Accounts Configuration – Overview accelerator for more information on the overall process for configuring Chart of Accounts. See the Help - Chart of Accounts Maintenance: Overview accelerator and navigate to the 'Adapting the Standard Chart of Accounts to Your Needs' section for more information on renumbering G/L Accounts or defining an Account Group. For more information on the special procedure for Chart of Accounts maintenance during upgrade, new scope item activation, or country extension see Help - Chart of Accounts Maintenance - Special Cases accelerator.

Task.Name: Maintain Profit Center Configuration
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to maintain the profit center configuration. This is required to execute finance related transactions. The creation of the profit center master data must be executed in the Development, Test and Production System. This setup must be completed before posting transactions to the system. If choose not to use the value in pre-delivered customizing, make sure to update and transport the new setting in addition to maintaining the master data in respective systems. Apps Used: Manage Profit Center Groups Manage Profit Centers SAP Business Roles Template Required: SAP_BR_DIVISION_ACCOUNTANT SAP_BR_BPC_EXPERT Procedure: Use the Manage Profit Center Group app to: Create a Profit Center Group 'YBPH' as profit center Standard Hierarchy. Maintain the standard hierarchy group by creating additional group if needed. Use the Manage Profit Centers app to create all profit centers For automatic document splitting, the default profit center is defined as YB900 in S/4HANA Cloud. Additionally, in 'SAP Central Business Configuration > Business Process Configuration > Assign Default Profit Center to Accounts', default profit center can be defined for each company code and G/L account or G/L account interval. Make sure all profit centers used in configuration are created. See the Create Profit Center (BNH) accelerator for details. Procedure Notes: Standard Hierarchy ‘YBPH’ is assigned to pre-configured controlling area ‘A000’. If you do not want to use the SAP’s default value, make sure to maintain assignment of the new value in ‘SAP Central Business Configuration > Configuration Activities > Define Profit Center Standard Hierarchy in Controlling Area’. Reference task Transport Configuration to move the setting to Test and Production System. If you do not want to use the SAP's default value YB900 for automatic document splitting, make sure to maintain the new value in ‘SAP Central Business Configuration > Business Process Configuration > Edit Constant for Nonassigned Processes’. Reference task Transport Configuration to move the setting to Test and Production System.

Task.Name: Maintain Cost Center Master Data
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to provide guidance for cloud cost center groups in SAP S/4HANA Cloud. The creation of cost center group master data must be executed in the Development, Test and Production System. Procedure: Create cost center master data and assignment to the standard hierarchy using the Manage Cost Center app. Cloud default content is always shipped with Standard Hierarchy 0001. Standard Hierarchy 0001 is the default structure and during cost center master data creation all cost centers get assigned to 0001 or any other group from this hierarchy. The Standard Hierarchy top node 0001 is always fixed, but lower level cost center groups can be added using the Manage Cost Center Groups app. Reference the Create Cost Center and Cost Center Group (BNM) accelerator for additional information. Create Alternative Cost Center Hierarchy using the Manage Cost Center Group app. Customers can create an alternative cost center hierarchy as this is freely defined/maintained by customers and any lower level groups can be assigned. Each cost center must be specifically added to your defined alternative cost center hierarchy via the Manage Cost Center Group app. The recommended example structure is shown below but others are possible: Top Level: A000 (controlling area) Second Level: company code Third level: further grouping by functions/location (ex. Finance/ Admin etc.) Fourth level: individual cost centers Repeat the process in the Production System. The setup is master data and thus cannot be transported.

Task.Name: Maintain Takeover Date Information for Asset Accounting
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to confirm values for the data takeover date, the status, and the document type for entering legacy assets into Asset Accounting in SAP S/4HANA Cloud. This confirmation is a mandatory step after initial activation and must be completed before posting transactions, in Asset Accounting, to the system. The takeover date defines the current fiscal year and the last closed fiscal year in Asset Accounting. It is critical for system processing, as it identifies the point in time that asset values are loaded and is usually the prior year end day (assuming you only want to mention the Transfer at End of Fiscal year). For example, if the system is in FY-2019 and the company is on a standard calendar Fiscal Year, the TAKEOVER DATE is 12/31/2018. Caution - This implies the loading of legacy assets is as of the Year End 2018. These settings must be executed in the Development, Test and Production Systems. Apps Used: Make Company Code Settings (Asset Accounting-Specific) SAP Business Roles Template Required: SAP_BR_AA_ACCOUNTANT Procedure: Use the Make Company Code Settings (Asset Accounting-Specific) app to set values for the data takeover date, the status, and the document type for entering legacy assets. Open the Make Company Code Settings (Asset Accounting-Specific) app. The Display Settings for Company Code in Asset Accounting screen is displayed. To switch between change and display mode, choose Change/Display. Select your company code on the left side of the screen and choose Select Company Code. Choose the General Settings tab. Check the status for your Company. The General Information tab shows your Company Code settings. The Company Code Status should be “For Testing.” In the Legacy Data Transfer section, check or change the following entries (if required, create a new legacy transfer segment first by choosing Create Legacy Transfer Segment): Transfer Date: set this date to the last day of the Prior Fiscal Year End (for the Transfer Date value, this is usually a year end date for a prior year). If you are instructed to use a mid-year date, this would be a month-end date. The date should always move forward (do not change it backward). Legacy Data Transfer Status: set this status to Ongoing or Ongoing (Other Postings Allowed). Document Type: set this to UE – Data Transfer. For the Legacy Data Transfer Status value, you have four options: In Preparation: The system allows incomplete customizing settings for the legacy data transfer (for example, the document type for posting of the legacy data transfer can be missing). Ongoing: Only legacy data transfer postings are permitted (for example, other types of postings, acquisition, retirements are not permitted). Ongoing (Other Postings Allowed): Both legacy data transfer postings and other postings are permitted. This status makes sense when you perform further legacy data transfers in a company code that is already productive. Completed: The legacy data transfer is completed. Legacy Data Transfer postings are not allowed and you are not allowed to create legacy assets. After the legacy data transfer is completed set the Legacy Data Transfer Status to Completed. Before making any postings in Asset Accounting in your Production System, repeat the above steps to confirm values for data the takeover date, the status, and the document type for entering legacy assets already done in the Development System.

Task.Name: Configure Customer Specific Fiscal Year Variant (Optional)
Task.Notes: This task is only required for implementations where the SAP S/4HANA Cloud customer has chosen to configure their own specific Fiscal Year variant and not adopt the standard K4 or one of the pre-delivered Fiscal Year Variants. The purpose of this task is to configure the customer specific Fiscal Year Variant (FYV), that has the ID SZ, according to the business requirements. The Fiscal Year Variant definition is required to define the relationship between the calendar year and your fiscal year. Fiscal Year Variants specify the number of periods and the start and end date of the fiscal year. This setup must be completed before posting transactions to the Test System and the Production System. Prerequisites: SZ (configurable template) has been chosen as the corporate FYV using the Fiscal Year Variant configuration in the Test System during the pre-activation setup. No journal entries have been posted in the Test System and the Production System. Apps Used: Depreciation Key: Display Details Configuration Used: Maintain Fiscal Year Variants SAP Business Roles Template Required: SAP_BR_BPC_EXPERT Procedure: Execute the desired Fiscal Year Variant configuration, see the Fiscal Year Variant Implementation – Overview accelerator for additional procedure steps.

Task.Name: Maintain Data and Setting for Treasury Management (Optional)
Task.Notes: The purpose of the task is to maintain settings and data required before start testing and using applications of Treasury Management in respective systems. This includes Development Customizing Tenant for initial unit tests, Test System for integrated business process tests, and Production System upon completion of a sprint for productive use. It is very common that transportable customization settings have dependency to these setting and data maintained directly in respective systems, and vice versa. Pre-requisite: Optional scope items are requested and activated. See task Activate New Scope or Country/Region for details. Procedure: Create/Import Banks and Bank Accounts for Cash Management processes. Before using cash management, set up the bank and bank account master data using Manage Banks and Manage Bank Account app. The set up must be done either manually or via Excel import (bank accounts). Once house banks and house bank accounts are maintained, the respective standing instructions can be assigned via the business partners. Maintain setting for front office/back office related processes: Assign role counterparty (TR0151 – Counterparty) using Maintain Business Partner app. Within this role the company-code dependent settings must be maintained and the authorizations for the relevant product and transactions type must be allowed. Otherwise, it is not possible to enter a transaction with a business partner. Following Business Roles are required to use the app: SAP_BR_TREASURY_SPECIALIST_BOE, SAP_BR_BUPA_MASTER_SPECIALIST. Securities Master Data like Class Master Data (Manage Security Classes - FWZZ) must be created in respective system before entering security transactions. The same approach is necessary for the Securities Account (Maintain Securities Account – TRS_SEC_ACC) to manage and value your positions in the securities area. You can only create a securities account once you have defined the depository bank (TR0152 – Depository Bank) as a business partner. Prerequisite: the relevant business partners must be created and additionally the respective role (TR0150 – Issuer) must be assigned. Apps used: Manage Securities Classes, Manage Securities Accounts Business Roles Required: SAP_BR_TREASURY_SPECIALIST_BOE Correspondence Master Data: If the Correspondence Framework is being used, master data is required. Therefore, the following settings must be maintained in respective systems: Definition of Fixing References for the confirmation of NDFs using SWIFT MT300 (FTR_FIX_DEF) Definition of Values for Expiry Time for FX options (FTR_EXPIRY_TIME_DEF) Assign BIC (Bank Identifier Code) and External Securities Acc. ID to Business Partner (FTR_BP_BIC) Assign Business Partner Group and Profiles (FTR_INT_ASSIGN & FTR_EXT_ASSIGN) Traders and Trader Authorizations: After you have defined traders in your system directly you can use Define User Data app to assign the traders to users, such as users in role Treasury Specialist - Front Office. Using the Manage Trader Authorizations app, you can restrict the transactions a trader may conclude to the individual values. Additionally, the maintenance of the transaction authorization needs to be done on every system individually via Fiori App Manage Trader Authorizations or TBT1. Maintain following data and setting for Risk Management related functionalities. Definition of Time Pattern for Hedging Areas: The time patterns that you define are relevant for the target quota table of the hedging area. These settings are necessary for the Hedge Management Reporting via the Hedge Management Cockpit. This information is required to be maintained on each system directly (TOE_TIME_PATTERN). Definition of Hedging Areas: The hedging area is an entity that represents a section of your hedging policy. In the hedging area, you define the level of granularity with which you want to monitor your foreign exchange risk. You also specify in the hedging area which exposures and hedging instruments are relevant for the hedging area (TOE_HEDGING_AREA). The hedging area is the basic master data of Hedge Management reporting and needs to be maintained directly in each system. It controls the execution of the Hedge Management Cockpit. Market Data: Market data can be transferred to the system from a file interface or via real-time data feed. You can use the function for market data transfer from spreadsheets. In addition to the backend functions, you can also use the SAP Fiori Launchpad to access the Import Market Data app for the data transfer, and other apps for the manual entry. Dependent on your decision to import the respective market data, the import needs to be done before entering a transaction to have the relevant market data available. Apps used: Import Market Data, Import Foreign Exchange Rates, Request Current Market Data – Data feed Business Roles Required: SAP_BR_TREASURY_SPECIALIST_BOE Perform initial activation steps: Initializing Cash Management: This activity is to set up transactional data that will be used by Cash Management applications. SAP S/4HANA Finance for cash management consumes data from the One Exposure from Operations table (database table FQM_FLOW). It contains cash management data such as memo records, and data from other components like accounting, end-of-day bank statements, TRM, CML, FI-CA, and integrated data from remote systems. To use SAP S/4HANA Finance for cash management, perform the following data setup activities: Build key information in accounting documents (database table BSEG) Load data into One Exposure from Operation Load data from Treasury and Risk Management (TRM), Loans Management (FS-CML), Contract Accounts Receivable and Payable (FI-CA), and integrated remote systems, into the One Exposure from Operations hub. Initializing Parallel Valuation Areas: The initialization process to generate new valuation areas in the Treasury subledger (Treasury Ledger) must be done in all system directly, otherwise it is not possible to enter new transactions (TPM_INITIALIZE).

Task.Name: Integration Setup in the Test System
Task.Notes: The purpose of this deliverable is to setup the integration in the Test system. Some integrations have prerequisites that need to be completed before the integration is setup. In case you chose to use the Cloud Integration Automation Service follow the instruction of the Service.

ExtendedAttribute.Value: 2nd Wave Project / Rollout Project, Hybrid Deployment (Two-Tier ERP)

Task.Name: Set Up Integrations in the Test Tenant
Task.Notes: The purpose of the task is to set up standard and customer driven integrations in the Test Tenant. Prerequisites: The integration scenarios has been identified using SAP Signavio Process Navigator and documented in the accelerator Integration Scenario and API List in the task ‘Determine Scenario Options for Integrations’ The Setup Instructions for standard integrations have been downloaded from the accelerator section of the corresponding Solution Process within SAP Signavio Process Navigator. Detailed scenario options and Business Technology Platform Integration Suite iFlow design for Customer Driven Integrations has been documented in the Explore phase Procedure: Standard Integration Setup Set up the integration according to the developed or downloaded setup guide. Set up the monitoring using Application Interface Framework (AIF) by assigning recipients to users in the tile "Assign Recipients" in “Message Monitoring.” Standard Integration Setup using Cloud Integration Automation Service Review the setup instructions in the Cloud Integration Automation Service User Guide accelerator. Open the link in accelerator Cloud Integration Automation Service - Integration Solution and Scenarios and select the solution and it's scenario(s) as per your project scope. If the Integration scope item has been included within the scope of your project defined in SAP Cloud ALM, you can access the Cloud Integration Automation procedure directly as follows. If the scope item containing the Cloud Integration Automation Service procedure has been set as being in scope, a task for the integration setup is automatically generated and assigned. Open the corresponding Task within the Task app and navigate directly to the Cloud Integration Automation Service procedure within your Cloud Integration Automation Service tenant using the ‘Open Application’ option under the ‘More’ section. Execute the Cloud Integration Automation Service procedure to configure the integration. Customer Driven Integration Setup Set up Customer-Driven Integrations based on iFlow design documented in task Design SAP Business Technology Platform Integration iFlows for Customer-Driven Integrations Set up integrations for integrated applications as documented in the task 'Determine Scenario Options for Integrations' Procedure Note(s): Details regarding the Integration scenarios and setup have already been captured in tasks ‘Determine Details for Customer-Driven Integrations’ and ‘Determine Scenario Options for Integrations’ of the Explore phase. This task needs to be performed for each signed off integration. A fiori app 'Message monitoring for Integration Experts' can be alternatively used for monitoring integrations. The Subscribe to Cloud Integration Automation Services in BTP is referred in Prepare Phase in SAP Supporting Implementation Tool Access deliverable. The following are examples of simplified implementation of SAP BTP Apps using Cloud Integration Automation Service procedures and Boosters Cloud Integration Automation Service - SAP Cloud for Real Estate Cloud Integration Automation Service - SAP Market Rates Management, Bring Your Own Rates data option Cloud Integration Automation Service - SAP S/4HANA Cloud for Projects Cloud Integration Automation Service - SAP Subscription BIlling Cloud Integration Automation Service - Central Invoice Management Cloud Integration Automation Service - SAP Ariba Buying

ExtendedAttribute.Value: 2nd Wave Project / Rollout Project, Hybrid Deployment (Two-Tier ERP), Industry Cloud Apps, SAP BTP Apps

Task.Name: Solution Configuration
Task.Notes: The purpose of this deliverable is to configure the Development system utilizing the Requirements and Notes in SAP Cloud ALM, generated during the fit-to-standard planning and design workshops in the Explore phase. The notes, or backlog items, are arranged into sprints lasting 1 to 2 weeks, and they undergo an iterative configuration process: Configuration Test Execution Business Verification Adjustments are implemented as needed, transferred, and tested in the Test system before progressing to the Production system.

ExtendedAttribute.Value: 2nd Wave Project / Rollout Project, Output Management, Transport Management

Task.Name: Configure Additional Organizational Entities
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to extend the organization structure in SAP Central Business Configuration in addition to those defined during initial Development System activation. Procedure: Use the Initiate Change functionality in SAP Central Business Configuration to extend organization structure defined in preceding phases. Follow steps in Initial Change section of Help - Project Experience accelerator to select Organizational Structure entry point. Create additional organizational structure entities in the Organizational Structure App as described in Using the Set Up Organizational Structure App section of Help - Project Experience accelerator. Procedure Notes: New company codes must be transported prior to adding banks and lockbox definitions in Development System or Production System for the new company codes to avoid activation errors in the Production System. If using the internal tax calculation, it must be configured before extending the organizational structure. Selecting additional country/region will result in new mandatory org structure maintenance for selected scenarios that are in scope. Organization structure can't be deleted once setup.

Task.Name: Maintain Additional G/L Accounts
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to create the additional G/L Accounts for the Chart of Accounts based on the definition developed in the Explore Phase. Apps Used: Manage G/L Account Master Data SAP Business Roles Template Required: SAP_BR_GL_ACCOUNTANT Procedure: Update the descriptions of standard delivered accounts using the Manage G/L Account Master Data app. Create new accounts using the Manage G/L Account Master Data app. The accounts are created from reference accounts and using the Copy button. Transport to Production System. Procedure Notes: See Chart of Accounts Configuration – Overview accelerator and solution help for more information on the overall process for configuring Chart of Accounts. For more information on the special procedure for Chart of Accounts maintenance during upgrade, new scope item activation, or country extension see Help - Chart of Accounts Maintenance - Special Cases accelerator.

Task.Name: Configure SAP S/4HANA Cloud
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to configure the solution based on the fit-to-standard analysis and the customer specific configuration definition. This involves adjusting pre-delivered settings to meet specific customer needs as identified during Fit-to-Standard workshops. The configuration changes are then saved and tested to ensure they meet the business requirements. Procedure: Review the configuration requirements captured during Fit-to-Standard workshops. Access Configuration Activities from SAP Central Business Configuration under Product-Specific Configuration phase to adjust pre-delivered setting per customer specific need based on decision made in Fit-to-Standard workshops. Save setting changes in one or more modifiable transports. Reference Help - Transport Modes to understand the selected transport mode for your project and save changes accordingly. Unit test to confirm the configured business process meets business requirement. Reference Transport Configuration task to move transports cross the system landscape. Procedure Note(s): The list of available configuration activities is dependent on the activated scope and is organized hierarchically according to their business areas. Reference the Business Process Configuration section in the Help - Project Experience for how to search and execute the configuration activities. Configuration changes are recorded in a transport request in the Customizing Tenant of SAP S/4HANA Cloud Development System. The change log of configuration activities can be accessed from SAP Central Business Configuration. Reference the Change Log section in the Help - Project Experience for more details. It is a best practice to use sprints of 1 to 2 weeks to fulfill requirements and enable business processes. Have one default transport for each sprint for all configuration settings. Create a manual type for corrections. Reference industry-specific or non-standard scope item-related accelerators for setup instructions when applicable.

Task.Name: Request Expert Configuration
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to request the Service Center to complete the pre-approved expert configuration identified and documented during the fit-to-standard in the Explore phase. The expert configuration should not be requested all at one time. It should be part of a sprint where one or more processes are configured; transported and tested in the Test System; and then moved to the Production system. Procedure: Create an Incident/Service Request with the following: Subject: ‘Request Expert Configuration for <<topic>>’ Description: ‘Please maintain the expert configuration as defined on the attached expert configuration worksheet.’ Component: XX-S4C-OPR-SRV Attach the file to the Incident/Service Request. Procedure Notes: Expert configuration is only performed on the Development System. It is transported to the Test System and the Production System via the transport process. The list of pre-approved expert configuration can be found in the Configuration Activity accelerator.

Task.Name: Request the IFRS 15 “Bundling Functionality” (Optional)
Task.Notes: This task is only relevant for implementations that have International Financial Reporting Standards and that need to support multi-element arrangements in contracts with customers (IFRS 15). The purpose of this task is to notify development that the “bundling functionality” is required for the implementation. Development will assist in verifying consistency of the customer requirements with the solution and guide the customer through the configuration process in the Development System. If the IFRS 15 requirements are not known prior to conducting the fit-to-standard workshop, the notification should be entered once the requirement is identified. Procedure: Create an Incident/Service Request with the Subject ‘IFRS 15 bundling’, Description ‘Our project requires the use of IFRS 15 functionality. Please provide instructions on how we should proceed.’ using the component CO-PC-OBJ_EBR. Follow the instructions that will be provided in the request. Procedure Note(s): See SAP note 2524569 for additional information

Task.Name: Enable Data Protection and Privacy Features
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to configure data protection solutions per design documented from Fit-to-Standard workshop. Procedures: Define data controller. Define retention policies for transactional data. Define residence policies for transactional data. Define retention policies for master data objects. Define residence polices for master data objects. Define and maintain Purposes for information retrieval. Configure read access logging (if it is in scope) Configure consent administration (if it is in scope) Reference Transport Configuration task to move transports cross the system landscape. Procedure Note(s): Unit test in Development System is not relevant for Data Protection and Privacy configuration settings due to data requirements. Testing of functionality should be planned in Test System sequenced at the end of testing cycles where process related documents at various status are available.

Task.Name: Setup Output Management
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to set up the output management, including the connection of devices, customization of forms, and the determination logic. Procedure: Setup printer. Define the technical set up for printing business documents. This is executed by defining print queues in the SAP S/4HANA Cloud system and installing the SAP Cloud Print Manager for Pull Integration on the local network Setup email. Define the technical setup for sending emails in SAP S/4HANA Cloud. This includes defining the sender domains, sender email addresses and email addresses for testing. Customize form template. Create customer specific form based on the SAP provided templates using Adobe LiveCycle Designer. Activities include downloading the form templates, modifying and testing them locally, and uploading them back to the system for further testing. SAP delivers standard form templates for many business applications as well as for different layout definitions. If a new form has been assigned within the corresponding configuration step, import all changes together to respective systems before testing. Customize email template. Create customer specific email templates based on the SAP S/4HANA Cloud provided templates. Activities include copying an SAP email template, modifying its content, and defining business rules for its usage. SAP delivers standard email templates for many business applications. Procedure Note(s): Use accelerator Output Management Set-up Instructions (1LQ) and Adobe LiveCycle Learn & Support accelerators for more details in procedure steps. Reference Blog accelerators or search in the community with keyword ‘Output Management’ or tag ‘Cloud Print Manager’ for tips & tricks, lessons learned. Forms must be cleared from the Production System import queue prior to the Production System upgrade.

ExtendedAttribute.Value: 2nd Wave Project / Rollout Project, Output Management, Transport Management

Task.Name: Verify Configuration with Business Process Requirements
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to verify that the configured solution meets the expectation of the Business Process Expert. After the solution is configured and unit tested, the Business Process Expert along with the Configuration Expert execute the business processes and verify the process meets the business needs. Multiple iterations may be necessary until the business process is complete. Once satisfied, the Business Process Expert approves the process as complete. Procedure: Review process configured against the corresponding business process flow with the Configuration Expert. If any additional changes are required: Update Design and Configuration documentation accordingly. Reference Document Business Process Target State and Document Configuration Values for tasks for template used and document created in Fit-to-Standard workshop. Reflect additional work required in backlog. Carry out the additional configuration steps. Confirm business requirements are met. Procedure Note(s): For customer using SAP Cloud ALM, update information captured in Requirement and Notes app accordingly.

Task.Name: Transport Configuration
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to release transports in Customizing Tenant of Development System, import to Test System and forward to Production System upon successful testing. Using sprints of 1 to 2 weeks, business processes are configured in Customizing Tenant of Development System, moved to the Test System and tested. At completion of the sprint, transport requests are forwarded and imported into Production System. Apps Used: Export Customizing Transports (Customizing Tenant of Development System) Import Collection (Test System and Production System) SAP Business Roles Template Required: SAP_BR_BPC_EXPERT Procedure: Plan the functionality that will be configured in the sprint. This includes configuration, expert configuration, and master data. Configure in Customizing Tenant of Development System and perform unit and string testing. All configuration is automatically recorded for transport. Any dependent master data must be manually recreated in the Test and Production System before the changes are transported. Release all configuration changes using the Export Customizing Transports application in the Customizing Tenant of Development System. Import the configuration transport with the Import Collection application in the Test System. Forward all the changes to the Production System after E2E, SIT and UAT testing in the Test System, by clicking the ‘Forward’ button in the Import Collection application in Test System. Import the above transport in the Production System by using the Import Collection application. Repeat the process for each configuration sprint. Each sprint should be 1-2 weeks in duration to limit the size of the new content. Procedure Note(s): Configuration dependent master data must be manually recreated in the Test and Production Systems before releasing the transport (i.e. forms, bank definitions, tax jurisdiction codes, calendars, etc.). For an overview of Transport Management, access the SAP Help - 3-System Landscape and Transport Management accelerator. To understand dependencies in transports, reference the Transport Dependencies section of the accelerator. It is recommended, when possible, to release customizing transports in sequence by their creation date. A sequencing check is performed in the background upon release of Transport Request in Development, import to Test and Production. This check applies to transports deployed from SAP Central Business Configuration. Use Default transport request for changes planed during the sprint. Create Manual transport request when needed for corrections during the sprint. Transports created and released in Customizing Tenant of Development System two releases prior need to be recreated in the current release before it can be imported into Test and Production System For customer using SAP Cloud ALM, Feature app can be used to group all related configuration and extension transports that should be moved together. Feature Traceability in Analytics provides a quick overview of the deployment status. Reference Transport Automation section of Help - Importing a Software Collection to turn on automation settings for Import and Forward. To compare configuration setting between Development, Test and Production systems and tenants using Implementation Activities app, reference Help - Implementation Activities accelerator for more details.

ExtendedAttribute.Value: 2nd Wave Project / Rollout Project, Transport Management

Task.Name: Manage Settings in Test / Production System
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to manually maintain settings in the Test and Production System that cannot be transported from the Development system or are changeable directly in Test or Production System. This process can be required anytime changes are transported to the Test and Production System for the following: Initial provisioning and activation of the Test or Production System New country/countries New scope activations Procedures: Access the Implementation Activity app in Test or Production system, filter for settings which are “Editable in all systems” and apply changes for those settings should not be transported. Review Help - Implementation Activities accelerator on applying filter parameters when working in the app. Review Help - Manual Rework Activities in a Target System accelerator and perform manual rework activities in Test or Production system when applicable. Procedure Note(s): Availability of implementation activities that are available after launching the Implementation Activities app is based on the authorization of the user. Document intervals are typically not included in the recording of customizing changes. It is recommended to maintain these intervals for each business process area in target system directly.

ExtendedAttribute.Value: 2nd Wave Project / Rollout Project, Parallel Project Line

Task.Name: New Scope Activation
Task.Notes: The purpose of this deliverable is to review, evaluate and activate the SAP S/4HANA Cloud new solution scope or new country/region in the Starter or, Development System using SAP Central Business Configuration. It is possible that new features will be delivered during the duration of the project. The project team must decide if they would like to take advantage of the new scope and if it is acceptable within the project schedule, or if they should delay the decision until after Go-Live. The release can occur during any phase of the project. Additional planning and configuration may be required.

ExtendedAttribute.Value: Application Design and Configuration, Technical Architecture & Infrastructure

Task.Name: Verify Requirements for New Country/Region
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is for the project team to verify that the new country requirements are consistent with the existing cross-country configuration. A new country activation should be treated as a new project. Already existing countries are not impacted by new country activation, however, once a new country is activated it cannot be removed. Please note when using the Development System, some configurations cannot be changed and changes to global configurations may have a direct impact on existing countries. Procedure: Use S/4HANA Cloud Road Map Explorer accelerator to review the product roadmap to determine if the country is available for activation. Validate all necessary scope items are available for the planned country using the Availability and Dependencies of Scope Items accelerator. Validate that the planned country to be added complies with the existing global settings and with your planned countries’ legal regulations. Global settings to consider are: Scope bundle Leading group fiscal year variant Leading ledger Chart of Accounts Group currency Currency type (additional consideration) Determine if any of the existing roles and authorizations will be impacted. Determine if any of the existing integrations will be impacted.

Task.Name: Set Up Exchange Rates for New Country/Region
Task.Notes: This task is only necessary if new countries are being added to the configuration scope. The purpose of this task is to configure the translation ratios for currencies and enter the exchange rates related to new countries/regions. The configuration and exchange rate data are necessary prior to requesting a new country/region to be added. Apps/Configuration Steps Used: Maintain Exchange Rates Configuration Used (SAP Central Business Configuration): Define Translation Ratios for Currency Translation SAP Business Roles Template Required: SAP_BR_BPC_EXPERT SAP_BR_GL_ACCOUNTANT Procedure: Create entries for Exchange Rate Type ‘M’ and ‘P’ for the currency of the new country/region being requested using the configuration step Define Translation Ratios for Currency Translation. Four entries are required per currency requiring exchange rates. See the system help for additional information. Note that some pairs are delivered with the solution and therefore do not require new entries. (SAP_BR_BPC_EXPERT) Enter the exchange rates for the local and global currencies for exchange Rate Type ‘M’ and ‘P’ using the Maintain Exchange Rates app. Four entries are required per currency. See the system help for additional information. (SAP_BR_GL_ACCOUNTANT) Transport the change project to Production System. See task Execute Configuration Transport Sprints for more details on how to transport configuration. In the Production System, enter the exchange rates for the local and global currencies for exchange Rate Type ‘M’ and ‘P’ using the Maintain Exchange Rates app. Four entries are required per configured country currency. See the system help for additional information.

Task.Name: Activate New Scope or Country/Region
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to review, evaluate, and activate a new solution scope or a new country/region using SAP Central Business Configuration, and then move business configuration settings across the landscape upon successful testing. Procedure: Review the new solution scope related to the latest SAP S/4HANA Cloud release in the SAP S/4HANA Cloud - What’s New Viewer accelerator. Evaluate the SAP Best Practices Process Model and Test Script document related to the new/inactive scenario to determine if the functionality is needed. The scenario details are provided in the SAP Signavio Process Navigator for SAP S/4HANA Cloud accelerator.
