Reference Initiate Change and Defining Scope section in Help – Project Experience accelerator to select new scenario or country/region in SAP Central Business Configuration. Scope finalization may take some time. Wait for its completion before starting the next activity. Once the Confirm Scoping is Completed milestone is set, a scenario/ country cannot be deactivated or removed anymore. Some Non-Standard and License required scenarios cannot be selected directly from Define Scope app in SAP Central Business Configuration. The request activation of Non-Standard and License Scenarios is done by the Service Center via an Incident/Service Request, with the following information: Subject: ‘Activation of New Licensed Scenarios’ Description: ‘Please activate the scenarios listed below in the Development System.’ List the scenario title(s) as they appear in the Define Scope app of the SAP Central Business Configuration. Component: XX-S4C-OPR-SRV. Review and complete related organizational structure setup in Set Up Organizational Structure app. Reference Organization Structure Management section in Help – Project Experience accelerator for information on organizational units and how to use the app. Deploy scope or country activation. Upon deployment, a Transport Request is created in Customizing Tenant of S/4HANA Cloud Development System. The Transport Request Task is automatically released upon a successful consistency check performed in the background. To avoid transport dependency issues, it is recommended that customer to release this Transport Request before carrying out further configuration activities. Use Export Customizing Transports app to locate the transport using Type ‘Central Business Configuration’ and Change On date in order to Release the Transport Request. Reference Business Process Configuration section in Help – Project Experience accelerator to adjust system settings for selected scope or country/region. Follow the transport steps to move the settings across the system landscape. See task Transport Configuration for more information. Test and verify to make sure the new scenario or country/region work as expected and does not impact existing functionalities. Execute manual rework activities in the target system. See task Manage Settings in Test / Production System for more information. Procedure Notes: When defining initial scope or adding new scope or country/region, it is recommended to limit the number of countries/regions to no more than five. Content from this scope must be processed and transported to Production before adding the next set of countries/regions. Check SAP Note 3151804 - Country Activation Guidance in Central Business Configuration for best practices. Some Non-Standard process scenarios are now available for activation from SAP Central Business Configuration. Please refer to the Availability and Dependencies of Scope Items accelerator to see what can be activated from SAP Central Business Configuration. Multiple scenarios can be selected in the same change project. Scenarios that require an additional subscription cannot be activated without a subscription contract. To view a list of process scenarios that are activated for a particular country/region, go to SAP Central Business Configuration, access My Selected Scope in Define Scope app. When selecting country/region, be aware that there will be new mandatory organizational structure requirements that need to be maintained for selected scenarios. Alternatively, for legal entity operating in multiple countries/regions, consider activating Registration for Indirect Taxation Aboard (RITA) function for the plant aboard scenario instead of activating a new country/region when applicable. Reference task Configure Tax Solution for more details on activation. Organizational structure enhancements, adding new scope or country/region and access to configuration activities from SAP Central Business Configuration is possible during upgrade period with some exceptions. Check SAP Note - 3215993 - Software Update & Upgrade for SAP Central Business Configuration behavior during the software upgrade of SAP S/4HANA systems for exceptional cases. In case of error during consistency check during deployment from SAP Central Business Configuration, a support ticket will be automatically created for SAP Cloud Operations team to address with customer. The Transport Task in Customizing Tenant of S/4HANA Development System will remain in status "Modifiable" and workspace in SAP Central Business Configuration will remain locked until issue is resolved. The Transport Task status will be set to "Released“ upon issue resolution and customer can then proceed with moving the transport request across systems. The new G/L accounts entries may not have direct relevance to the requested scenario(s). The renumbering of new G/L accounts is only possible in the Test System if no entries have been posted in the account in the Production System. See task Adapt Chart of Accounts for more information. If you require further assistance for the newly added G/L accounts after the scenario(s) activation, please create an incident with component FI-CNT-GL. Advance Valuation will be automatically activated by default when adding a new country/region version. Reference SAP Note 3139304 - Automatic Activation of Advanced Valuations for more details and steps to use Classic Valuations before making any postings. For customer using Cloud ALM, reflect additional scope in Process app. Reference Process Scoping in the SAP Cloud ALM for Implementation - Expert Portal accelerator.

Task.Name: Revise Business Roles and Business Catalogs
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to adapt existing Business Catalogs and Business Roles resulting from the addition of new scope items or an upgrade. In SAP S/4HANA Cloud, Business Catalogs are periodically revised. Some Business Catalogs will be deprecated and replaced by new ones. The deprecated Business Catalogs in the customer system will be removed two releases later. Hence, it is essential to review the retired Business Catalogs after each release and addition of new scope items and make the necessary changes as soon as possible. You can find more information in the SAP S/4HANA Cloud Identity and Access Management (IAM) Release Activities - Action Required accelerator. The SAP Business Role Template Configuration Expert - Business Process Configuration (SAP_BR_BPC_EXPERT) should be checked and adjusted periodically. This role performs business process configuration and other tasks required for implementing SAP solutions. Apps: Business Catalogs Maintain Business Roles Business Role Templates Procedure: Trigger the automatic replacement of deprecated Business Catalog Roles with the new catalog roles from the Business Catalogs app. See the SAP S/4HANA Cloud Identity and Access Management (IAM) Release Activities - Action Required accelerator for step-by-step procedures. Add the new catalogs to existing Business Roles. From the Business Role Templates app, review and apply all missing business catalogs to the Configuration Expert – Business Process Configuration business role. Procedure Notes: It is recommended to use the SAP Business Role Templates only in the Starter System and Development System (e.g., for the fit-to-standard workshop and testing in general). For the Business Roles in the Production System, it is strongly recommended to create your custom business roles based on the identified workplaces. As part of compliance, these custom business roles should then be created and maintained only in the Development System, transported into the Test System, and then forwarded into the Production System via Software Collections. Changing business roles directly in the Production System could cause an error that would put the productive environment and the productive data at greater risk.

Task.Name: Release and Update Cycles for SAP S/4HANA Cloud
Task.Notes: The purpose of the deliverable is to manage updates and upgrades of SAP S/4HANA Cloud. With 3-system landscape architecture, software and business configuration or content lifecycles are decoupled. Software updates of S/4HANA systems and reference content upgrades in SAP Central Business Configuration are governed by SAP with predefined schedule. Active business content updates and upgrades are deployed by SAP and scheduled for imports that can be revised by customer. The Release Navigator consolidates essential release content from SAP Product Engineering, SAP User Assistance, SAP Learning, SAP Enterprise Support and other areas of the SAP ecosystem organized by Lines of Business (LoB’s), Industries, and Cross-Topics. Built-in guided tours, created with native SAP Enable Now software, will teach you how to use various SAP tools and websites to locate content when a release comes. The following Release Navigators are available for SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition and SAP Business Technology Platform Release Navigator for SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition Release Navigator for SAP Business Technology Platform Use the accelerator Help - How to get the most of the Release Navigator for SAP BTP for useful information on the usage of Release Navigator. SAP Activate for Upgrade of SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition (3-system landscape) roadmap highlights steps before, after during an upgrade. Also reference the Automation Settings and Planned System Behavior for Lifecycle Events accelerator for transport management related details.

ExtendedAttribute.Value: Application Design and Configuration, Operations and Support, Technical Architecture & Infrastructure
2nd Wave Project / Rollout Project, GROW Adoption Plan, Upgrade

Task.Name: Evaluate New Functionality
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to evaluate new features and functions that are released. These new features and functions are deployed during upgrades and periodic updates. It is important to evaluate new features and functions for the following purposes: Determine new functions and features for implementation to meet continuously changing business needs. Fulfill delta requirements that require custom development efforts and didn't make to the project backlog. Replace custom developments with SAP standard functions to reduce implementation and maintenance efforts. Procedure: Review product road map for features and functions planned for upcoming release using SAP S/4HANA Cloud Road Map Explorer. Use What's New Viewer accelerator to review the latest features and functions that are released with updates and upgrades. Some features require activation. Refer to the Evaluate and Activate Feature from Continuous Delivery task for additional details. Others need to be deployed from SAP Central Business Configuration. Refer to task Review and Process Hotfix Collection and Prepare and Process Upgrade for business content activation details. Understand the impact of the changes to your current implementation scope by accessing the SAP S/4HANA Cloud Release Assessment and Scope Dependency accelerator via S-user ID. Check SAP S/4HANA Cloud Release Restriction accelerator to be aware of exception cases with current release. Reference Upgrade and Maintenance Schedule accelerator to find out the release time of new functionalities. Initiate planning of project to introduce new feature and function to users. Procedure Note(s): Use Valid as Of filter in What's New Viewer to select the respective release(s). Updates are indicated by a suffix like .1, .2, following major release number. For example, SAP S/4HANA Cloud 2108.1 is the first update after major release 2108. Impact analysis is based on customer's used and activated scope in Test or Production System. Reference Blog - Release Assessment and Scope Dependency posts in SAP community to see updated information with regard to the tool. For customer using SAP Cloud ALM, access Upcoming Event card or tile in the Overview app to see upcoming upgrades and use the Impact Assessment link to access the RASD from SAP Cloud ALM.

ExtendedAttribute.Value: 2nd Wave Project / Rollout Project, GROW Adoption Plan, Upgrade

Task.Name: Review and Process Hotfix Collection
Task.Notes: The purpose of the task is to review information associated with the release of hotfix collection that is deployed to all systems on the same weekend every 2 weeks in the months where no upgrade is planned. Customer should use this information to: Inform the user about the timing of a fix to a previously reported issue Allow planning of business activities around downtime Plan ongoing project tasks around systems' lock phase period before downtime Complete changes in SAP Central Business Configuration and align configuration in all SAP S/4HANA Cloud systems Procedure: Follow the steps described in Knowledge-Based Articles for Known Regression Issues accelerator to understand possible workarounds and find out the Hotfix Collection delivery date when a fix to a previously reported issue will be delivered. Review information in Upgrade and Maintenance Schedule for the latest on: Starter, Development, Test and Production system downtimes. System locks for Import and Export of transports in Development, Test and Production System locks for Configuration and Extensibility Refrain from scheduling activities into development sprints and plan around the downtime and system lock phase period. Check limitation and recommendation details (i.e transports, scope activation, etc) before and during the SAP pre-processing window in the Software Lifecycle Management accelerator. If business content is included in the Hotfix Collection: Notification message of ongoing update will appear in SAP Central Business Configuration Project Experience UI. These updates will be automatically deployed to SAP S/4HANA Cloud Starter system (if not retired) and Development system. A Transport Request is created in Customizing Tenant of the system during deployment. This Transport Request of updated content and associated Task are automatically released upon successful checks performed in the background. This Transport Request is scheduled to be imported to Test System, forwarded to Production System, and then imported to Production System. Customer can revise or suspend the default schedule for moving the transport across the landscape using Import Collection app. In case of error during deployment, SAP Cloud Operations team will be notified to address with customer. Task within the Transport Request can only be released by SAP. Additional Transport Request may be created by SAP to fix issue. Customer may need to release dependent transports and release transport request(s) related to the content updates manually. Procedure Note(s): When reference to Production system, activities are only applicable to live customer. It is recommended as a good practice to immediately deploy business content updates to all S/4HANA system each time when there is one. To view a list of corrections included in the Hotfix Collection, go to the Patch Collection Information note in the useful link section of the Upgrade and Maintenance Schedule accelerator, and download the pdf document that contains a list of affected component ID and description of corrections. Access to Business Process Configuration app from SAP Central Business Configuration is possible until SAP S/4HANA Cloud system enters down-time. Check Upgrade and Maintenance Schedule accelerator for exact timing. Organizational structure enhancements, adding new scope or country/region is possible until the content update is triggered and the project in SAP Central Business Configuration is locked. Check SAP Note - 3215993 - Software Update & Upgrade for actual project block timing. Reference Hotfix Collection Deployment Restrictions for a summary of limitations on project activities.

Task.Name: Review Reports for Release Updates
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to review the reports for any product release enhancements and/or changes. As enhancements of the solution are released or retired, the project team should verify the reports are running as expected or if there are any areas of the reports which need to be updated or modified accordingly such as new reporting features, new filtering options, and new content which can be reported on within the solution. Procedure Step(s): Review the latest release notes for the solution to ensure there is no impact to the reports which are used in the project such as features, display, filtering, tables, and data. Review all custom reports to ensure the latest product features do not impact the reports in the solution and make any adjustments as necessary to run the reports successfully. Make any adjustments to the reports (standard and/or custom). Test and verify the reports are running as expected. Procedure Note(s): This task should be routinely reviewed with each solution release where updates are applicable.

Task.Name: Evaluate and Activate Feature from Continuous Delivery
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to evaluate and activate, when needed, new functionalities provided in frequent updates from SAP between major upgrades. These updates will give customers access to new capabilities in a nondisruptive manner. Continuous Delivery for S/4HANA Cloud accelerator provides an overview of this service. Some features require customer activation when initially released. Functionality which can be activated has the following characteristics: It is by default not available in the customer system landscape until it is activated in Activate Features app. Activation needs to be performed in each system, Starter (if not retired yet), Development, Test and Production system, respectively. Activation of functionality via this app is NOT reversible. Proper testing should be executed before activation in Production system. A toggle introduced in an update has a limited lifetime. In the next release or the one following, the functionality will be released for all customers. Procedure: Use the What's New Viewer accelerator to get an overview of new and updated features and functions. Understand the impact of the changes to your current implementation scope by using the SAP S/4HANA Cloud Release Assessment and Scope Dependency accelerator via S-user ID. Reference Upgrade and Maintenance Schedule accelerator to find out the release time of new features. Use "Preparation Required" filter in What's New Viewer accelerator to view feature requires preparation work from customer. Follow steps in the Help - Activate Features accelerator to switch on selected feature, when applicable. Perform activation and business configuration setting adjustments from SAP Central Business Configuration, when applicable. Test and release the new feature. Procedure Note(s): Use the "Valid as Of" filter in What's New Viewer to select the respective continuous delivery service(s). An update version is indicated by the release upgrade followed by a suffix such as .1, or .2. For example, SAP S/4HANA Cloud 2108.1 is the first update after major release 2108. Availability of feature updates can be found in the Upgrade and Maintenance Schedule with label YYMM.n, indicating continuous delivery service n for product version YYMM. Feature updates are executed the same way as Hotfix Collection technically. Reference task Review and Process Hotfix Collection for transport request behavior and process for content updates. Impact analysis is based on customer's used and activated scopes in the Test or Production System. Reference Blog - Release Assessment and Scope Dependency posts in SAP community to see updated information with regard to the tool. Customers have the option to perform regression test, if desired, by leveraging the Post Upgrade Tests from the Test Your Process app, under the Post Upgrade Test tab. To access Activate Features app, search it in tree view of Implementation Activities app in S/4HANA Cloud or Business Process Configuration app in SAP Central Business Configuration, Product-Specific Configuration phase.

ExtendedAttribute.Value: Application Design and Configuration, Operations and Support

Task.Name: Prepare and Process Upgrade
Task.Notes: The purpose of the task is to execute periodic upgrade of S/4HANA Cloud. Customer should use the specific Upgrade project in SAP Cloud ALM and tasks from SAP Activate S/4HANA Cloud Upgrade roadmap to prepare for the upgrade, complete regression testing, update business roles and business content when appropriate. It is recommended to start the preparation steps at least 2 weeks before the start of Test system upgrade. It is a best practice to have a dedicated sprint for upgrade related activities and focusing on regression testing. Procedure: Review Upgrade and Maintenance Schedule - 3 System Landscape accelerator for actual timing and Software Lifecycle Management accelerator for behind-the-scenes details. Launch and start upgrade project. Follow tasks in SAP Activate for Upgrade of S/4HANA Cloud roadmap to prepare and complete regression testing in Test System. Revise business roles immediately after the software upgrade in Production system. See task in upgrade roadmap for more details. Plan and execute the business content upgrade with regression testing before the next major release. See task in upgrade roadmap for more details. Procedure Note(s): To access the upgrade roadmap from SAP Activate Roadmap Viewer main page, go to Explore All Roadmaps and select the Upgrade Methodology tab. For customer who uses SAP Cloud ALM, select ‘SAP S/4HANA Cloud 3-system landscape - Upgrade task template' when setting up project in Projects and Setup app. For customer who has an existing ERP system and adopting a Two-Tier enterprise resource planning (ERP) strategy for the S/4HANA Cloud implementation, it is important to notify users running the existing ERP system with regard to the downtime and plan business and project activities accordingly.

ExtendedAttribute.Value: 2nd Wave Project / Rollout Project, Hybrid Deployment (Two-Tier ERP), Upgrade

Task.Name: Artificial Intelligence setup in Test System
Task.Notes: The purpose of this deliverable is to get the Test system ready for running SAP Build Process Automation Bots. This include the installation of all applications as discussed in Artificial Intelligence (AI) Setup deliverable in Explore phase and importing the necessary SAP delivered Package(s).

ExtendedAttribute.Value: 2nd Wave Project / Rollout Project, Artificial Intelligence Technology

Task.Name: Prepare System for SAP Build Process Automation
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to make the Test Tenant ready for execution and testing of various SAP Build Process Automation related Bots. Prerequisites: Scope item(s) related to SAP Build Process Automation are identified. Procedure: Connect the Desktop Agent to the Test Tenant for SAP Build Process Automation to test the scenarios according to the scope items identified. Create a Project, manage the Agent and create automations as defined in the configuration guide of the corresponding scope item. Use the Test Scripts attached to the scope item to confirm completeness of automation capability.

ExtendedAttribute.Value: 2nd Wave Project / Rollout Project, Artificial Intelligence Technology

Task.Name: Analytics Configuration in the Development Tenant
Task.Notes: The purpose of this deliverable is the configuration of Analytics as detailed and signed off in the Explore phase.

Task.Name: Setup and Enable Embedded Analytics
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to enable embedded analytics in the solution. Procedure: Follow and review the configuration, technical setup, and enablement published in the SAP Signavio Process Navigator via the following path: Embedded Analytics with SAP S/4HANA accelerator > navigate to the “Accelerators” section > choose the Technical Setup and Enablement for SAP S/4HANA Embedded Analytics file.

Task.Name: Configure Analytics in the Development Tenant
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to configure Analytics according to the previously developed setup guides. Procedure: Configure reports to the specifications determined in the Explore phase. Execute pre-delivered test scripts where available. Procedure Notes: This task needs to be executed for all reports.

Task.Name: Identity and Access Management Configuration in the Development System
Task.Notes: The purpose of this deliverable is to create, size, and test the business roles in the system according to the previously developed concept. All business roles will be created and maintained only in the Development System and afterwards transported via download and upload into the Test System and then forwarded to the Production System.

ExtendedAttribute.Value: 2nd Wave Project / Rollout Project, Identity and Access Management, Transport Management

Task.Name: Configure Identity and Access Management in the Development System
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to create, maintain restriction field values, and test the business roles in the Development System. Prerequisites: All technical information on the identity and access management have been collected and signed off by the customer. Apps: Business Catalogs Maintain Business Roles Business Role Templates Procedure: Create the custom business roles based on the naming convention and the identified workplaces. The assignment of the business catalogs is based on the Application-Workplace List. Refer to the Help - Manage Your SAP S/4HANA Cloud - Maintain Business Roles accelerator for more details related to the creation and maintenance of custom business roles. Ensure that all required associated catalogs are identified and assigned to the custom business roles. It is recommended to perform a completeness test as part of this step. Define and maintain restriction field values for the custom business roles. Create the required Test Users for each workplace in the Development System and assign the required business roles. Plan and organize the authorization testing throughout all business areas. The testing should include the following: Functional tests of end-to-end processes of the applications Verification of completeness of the business roles Conduct negative testing for sensitive data Execute the authorization tests through the business areas managed by the Authorization Coordinators. Responsibilities are assigned after the test schedule, and test scripts are created. Refine and validate the production business role assignment plan after the responsible line of businesses has tested and signed off the business roles. Business roles are transported from the Development System to Test System and then to the Production System during the configuration sprints and will be assigned during the cutover to production. Procedure Notes: Associated catalogs are additional business catalogs required by business users to perform additional tasks in the respective end-to-end processes. The assignment of the associated catalog to the business roles is optional and should only be assigned if required. Test of completeness is to perform all required business-relevant tasks with unrestricted authorizations. Please use one business role per test case and Test User. If you can't perform all business-relevant tasks, this means that you don't have all associated business catalogs assigned to the business role. It is recommended to use the Business Role Templates only in the Starter System and Development System (e.g., for the fit-to-standard workshop and testing in general). For the business roles in the Production System, it is strongly recommended to create custom business roles based on the identified workplaces. As part of compliance, these custom business roles should then be created and maintained only in the Development System, transported into the Test System, and then forwarded into the Production System via Software Collections. Changing business roles directly in the Production System could cause an error that would put the productive environment and the productive data at greater risk. During the release upgrade, the Business Roles cannot be exported and imported into a Test System that is on a higher release version. Refer to accelerator Help - Export Software Collection for additional information.

ExtendedAttribute.Value: 2nd Wave Project / Rollout Project, Identity and Access Management, Transport Management

Task.Name: Extension Development and Transport
Task.Notes: The purpose of this deliverable is the setup of extensions in the Development System and the creation of setup guides, if needed. The following topics are covered within the deliverable Development and setup of the extension in the Development System. Documentation of all actions to implement, transport and test the extension in Test Tenant.

ExtendedAttribute.Value: 2nd Wave Project / Rollout Project, Transport Management

Task.Name: Develop and Transport Key-User Extensions
Task.Notes: The purpose of the task is to develop and setup Key-User extensions in the Development system (Customizing Tenant). Apps Used: Export Software Collection (Customizing tenant of Development System) Import Collection (Test System and Production System) Procedure Develop and setup the Key-User extension in the Development System(Customizing Tenant). Refer the help documentation available via the Help - Key User Extensibility accelerator Move content to Test/Production System Using the Export Software Collection application in the Customizing Tenant of the Development System, export the forms, extensions or other objects associated with the current transport. A complete list of the objects moved via Export Software Collection app is available in the application With the Import Collection application in the Test system, the transport can be imported. After E2E, SIT and UAT testing in the Test System, click ‘Forward’ button in the Import Collection application in Test System to send all the changes (configuration and extensibility) to the Production System. In the Production System, use the Import Collection app to import the queued changes. Repeat the process for each development sprint Procedure Note(s): Key User Extensions can only be created in the customizing tenant and can build on top of the client independent developer extensibility objects released in the development client. Key User Extension transports created in the Development System two releases prior to the target system version needs to be recreated in the upgraded development system (in sync with the target systems) before it can be imported into Test and Production System During Release Upgrades, certain objects cannot be imported on a system that is on a higher release than the source system. These object types can be identified using the ‘Extensibility Settings’ app. Please refer the following accelerators for additional information Help - Export Software Collection Help - Transport Dependencies SAP Note 3481049 - SAP S/4HANA Cloud in a 3-system landscape: Release Restriction Note In SAP Cloud ALM , 'Features' App can be used to bundle dependent transports of different transport types e.g., Customizing and Key User Extensibility. Exported transports can be assigned to Features and the Feature Traceability App provides a quick overview of the deployment status per Feature. Prerequisite is the creation of Communication Arrangement SAP Cloud ALM - Change and Deployment Management Integration (SAP_COM_0690).

ExtendedAttribute.Value: 2nd Wave Project / Rollout Project, Transport Management

Task.Name: Develop and Transport Developer Extensions
Task.Notes: The purpose of the task is to develop extensions in the Development Tenant using On-stack developer extensibility. Apps Used: Transport Organizer in ABAP Development Tools (ADT) Import Collection (Test System and Production System) Git-Enabled CTS App (gCTS) Procedure Download and install the front-end components of ABAP Development Tools (ADT) Create an ABAP cloud project with ADT to connect to the ABAP system. Refer section Connect to the ABAP System in accelerator Help - Developer Extensibility Create an ABAP package. Refer section Tasks→Working with ABAP Packages→Creating ABAP Packages in SAP - ABAP Development User Guide Build your corresponding Development Object Perform technical testing in Development Tenant and perform functional unit tests in Customizing tenant of the Development System. Use ABAP Development tools (ADT) to execute unit tests and to evaluate the results concerning functional correctness and code coverage by leveraging the the ABAP Unit framework. Please refer Accelerator Help - Unit Testing with ABAP Unit for additional details ABAP Test Cockpit (ATC) can be used to check the quality of the ABAP development objects during the following scenarios During Development During Transport Release During Central ATC Run It is recommended that the ATC configuration should be set to block the release of transports containing Prio 1 Errors (Red). Please refer Accelerator Help - Checking Quality of ABAP Code with ATC for additional details Perform functional unit tests in Customizing tenant of the Development System. Transport Content to Test/Production System Release workbench transports in ADT With the Import Collection application in the Test system the transport can be imported. After E2E, SIT and UAT testing in the Test System, click ‘Forward’ button in the Import Collection application in Test System to send all the changes (configuration and extensibility) to the Production System. In the Production System, use the Import Collection app to import the queued changes. Repeat the process for each development sprint. If you want to consume an extension developed by the Partner using Multi-Off Delivery and delivered in a Git repository, you can use the Git-enabled Change and Transport System (gCTS) to pull the extension into your system. Follow Section ‘Consuming ABAP Extensions in Multi-Off Delivery’ in the accelerator SAP Help: Multi-Off Delivery to import the object from the Git Repository. Procedure Note(s): From the development tenant in the development system, no transport of customizing and key user extensibility objects is possible Key User Artifacts cannot be consumed from Development Tenant. Field Extensibility is one of the known exceptions to this guideline. Key User Extensions can build upon the Client Independent Developer Extensibility objects released in the development tenant. Please refer accelerator Help - Transport Dependencies for additional details on Object Dependencies A default customizing transport request is technically required but not used to transport content to any other system Developer extension transports created in Customizing Tenant of Development System two releases prior to the target system need to be recreated in the upgraded development system (in sync with the target systems) before it can be imported into Test and Production System In SAP Cloud ALM , 'Features' App can be used to bundle dependent transports of different transport types e.g., Customizing and Key User Extensibility. Exported transports can be assigned to Features and the Feature Traceability App provides a quick overview of the deployment status per Feature. Prerequisite is the creation of Communication Arrangement SAP Cloud ALM - Change and Deployment Management Integration (SAP_COM_0690).

ExtendedAttribute.Value: 2nd Wave Project / Rollout Project, Transport Management

Task.Name: Develop and Transport Side-by-Side Extensions
Task.Notes: The purpose of the task is to develop and set up a side-by-side extensions Procedure Develop and set up the side-by-side extension in the development environment based on requirements collected in the Collect Details for Extensions task Refer the SAP Extensibility Explorer and Extend SAP S/4HANA in the cloud and on premise with ABAP based extensions accelerators for additional guidance on development of extensions using the side by side scenario. Procedure Note(s) If there are developer extensibility or key user extensibility scenarios that integrate or depend on side by side extensions, they have to be tested in the customizing tenant of SAP S/4HANA Cloud system. SAP Cloud ALM is integrated with Cloud Transport Management Service to conveniently move side-by-side extensions with e.g., SAP BTP ABAP Environment, based on Features. Please check the Setup & Administration Guide of SAP Cloud ALM to learn more about the integration.

ExtendedAttribute.Value: 2nd Wave Project / Rollout Project, Transport Management

Task.Name: Data Migration in the Development Tenant
Task.Notes: The purpose of this deliverable is to develop, test, and execute the data migration programs and processes defined in the Explore phase. This consists of iterative data migration and testing cycles focused on the analysis of data, refinement of business rules, and processes designed to move, cleanse, transform, and enrich legacy data required to support the various test cycles and ultimately the production cutover. The test cycles enable the migration team to improve data quality, develop a detailed cutover sequencing plan, exercise data reconciliation and validation required to support the production cutover.

ExtendedAttribute.Value: 2nd Wave Project / Rollout Project, Hybrid Deployment (Two-Tier ERP)

Task.Name: Execute Data Migration in the Development Tenant of SAP S/4HANA Cloud
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to execute data migration using the data migration cockpit. Data can be migrated using staging tables or through direct transfer. Procedure: Data Migration Using Staging Tables Review the information in Accel ID = S4H_2035. If using an SAP or a third party ETL tool to fill the staging tables, follow the ‘Set-up instructions’ provided with Data Migration to SAP S/4HANA from Staging (‏2Q2‏). Follow the procedure in the ‘Test Script’ accessible via the Data Migration to SAP S/4HANA from Staging (‏2Q2‏) to migrate the various migration objects. Below is a summary of the steps. Create the migration project. Select the migration objects. Populate the staging tables with the data files or alternatively via SAP or 3rd party tools. Process any open mapping tasks to ensure that the source data is mapped correctly. Simulate data migration. Execute data migration. Note the uptime and downtime restrictions related to the Hotfix Collection Deployment. Review status of your migration projects and objects in the Data Migration Status app. Verify migrated data for accuracy and completeness. Document the process and sequence for each object in the cutover plan. Data Migration Using Direct Transfer Review the information in Accel ID = S4H_2035. Follow the “Set up instructions” accessible via the Data Migration to SAP S/4HANA from SAP (BH3) accelerator. A communication arrangement is required to use the direct transfer approach. Follow the procedure in the ‘Test Script’ accessible via the Data Migration to SAP S/4HANA from SAP (BH3) accelerator to migrate the various migration objects. Below is a summary of the steps. Create the migration project. Select a communication arrangement. Select the migration objects that are relevant for your migration project. Select data. Process any open mapping tasks to ensure that the source data is mapped correctly. Simulate data migration. Execute data migration. Note the uptime and downtime restrictions related to the Hotfix Collection Deployment. Document the process and sequence for each object in the cutover plan. Procedure Note(s): See the accelerator SAP S/4HANA Cloud - Migration Cockpit - Cookbook and Help - Data Migration for step-by-step guidance. Consider planned system maintenance windows before executing data migration in order to avoid terminations. See SAP Note 3024158 - Blue-Green Deployment for Hotfix Collection for RISE with SAP S/4HANA Cloud and Software Lifecycle Management for more information. Check for object changes after a release by using the Help - Release Comparison of Migration Object Templates accelerator. Customers transitioning from SAP Business ByDesign can refer Blog : Guide for Proposed Migration - SAP Business ByDesign to S/4HANA Public Cloud (Step 4 onwards). The parallel project line can be used for additional data migration testing. See accelerator Parallel Project Line (PPL) in SAP S/4HANA Cloud (restricted access) and Project Experience - Parallel Project Line (restricted access) for more information on parallel project line.

ExtendedAttribute.Value: 2nd Wave Project / Rollout Project, ByDesign to S/4HANA Cloud Transition (Partner), Parallel Project Line

Task.Name: Transport the Data Migration Project in the Test Tenant (Direct Transfer)
Task.Notes: This task is only relevant for migration using Direct Transfer. The purpose of this task is to transport the data migration project to the target tenant. Procedure: Follow the procedure in Help - Transporting Projects to the Test System to move the migration project to another tenant.

Task.Name: Analytics Configuration in the Test System
Task.Notes: The purpose of this deliverable is the configuration of Analytics as configured in the Development System.

Task.Name: Configure Analytics in the Test System
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to configure Analytics according to the previously developed setup guides. Procedure: Configure to the specifications determined in the Development System. Execute pre-delivered test scripts where available. Test and evaluate the analytics report(s) with the available data. Capture and release the custom objects in the transport request (TR). Procedure Note(s): All configuration related transports need to be captured in a transport request. All standard and custom configuration needs to be transported to the Production System.

Task.Name: Integration Setup in the Production System
Task.Notes: The purpose of this deliverable is to set up the Integration in Production system. This can optionally be included in the cutover list. In case you chose to use the Cloud Integration Automation Service follow the instruction of the Service.

Task.Name: Set Up Integrations in the Production System
Task.Notes: The purpose of the task is the set up of integrations in the Production System. Prerequisites: Tested integration scenarios in Test system. Procedure: Setup the integration according to the setup guide used for setup in the Test Tenant. Setup the monitoring using Application Interface Framework (AIF) by assigning recipients to users in the tile " Assign Recipients" in "Message Monitoring." Procedure Note(s): This task needs to be performed for each signed off and tested integration. A fiori app 'Message monitoring for Integration Experts' can be alternatively used for monitoring integrations.

ExtendedAttribute.Value: 2nd Wave Project / Rollout Project, Hybrid Deployment (Two-Tier ERP), Industry Cloud Apps

Task.Name: Artificial Intelligence Setup in Production System
Task.Notes: The purpose of this deliverable is to get the production system ready for running SAP Build Process Automation Bots. This include the installation of all applications as discussed in Artificial Intelligence (AI) Setup deliverable in Explore phase and importing the necessary SAP delivered Package(s).

ExtendedAttribute.Value: 2nd Wave Project / Rollout Project, Artificial Intelligence Technology

Task.Name: Deploy SAP Build Process Automation scripts in Production Tenant
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to make the Production Tenant ready for running and schedule to run the various SAP Build Process Automation related Bots. Prerequisites: All the SAP SAP Build Process Automation Packages are deployed in the Production Tenant. All the SAP SAP Build Process Automation are already tested in Test Tenant and signed off by the customer. Procedure: Install all the necessary applications which are needed to execute the prepackaged SAP Build Process Automation Bots or custom Bots. Configure the Agent and SAP Build Process Automation Tenant as specified in test scripts of individual scope item and schedule the Bot.

ExtendedAttribute.Value: 2nd Wave Project / Rollout Project, Artificial Intelligence Technology

Task.Name: Test Preparation
Task.Notes: The purpose of this deliverable is to ensure readiness for testing activities. This involves configuring a test automation tool, outlining test scripts, and developing a tailored Test Plan to suit your requirements. SAP provides a range of tools, including Test Management within SAP Cloud ALM, and supplementary resources like the Manual Test Script template, to aid in your preparation for testing tasks.

Task.Name: Prepare Testing Prerequisites
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to prepare the prerequisites for testing. This is to ensure the availability of testers, Test Management Systems like SAP Cloud ALM (if used), or to ensure the availability and accessibility of the Testing Automation Tool(s) (if used). In order to ensure the availability of testers and provide key knowledge transfer, a kick-off meeting is advisable during this project phase. The Test Phase Kick Off Template accelerator can be used to prepare and execute the kick-off Meeting. If test automation is in scope, then the technical resources should also be planned if any. If using SAP Cloud ALM as a Test Management System, then the test preparation should take place in the tool directly. You can use the project scope to easily identify the business processes which require testing. You can also view all the requirements created during the fit-to-standard workshops and created dedicated test cases for these requirements. Prerequisites: Define test scenarios and test data Apps Used: SAP Cloud ALM (if used) Test Preparation, Requirements, and Processes Selected Test Automation Tool(s) (if used) Procedure: Confirm the availability of testers and perform knowledge transfers. Confirm test tool setup. Leverage the Test Phase Kick-Off Template accelerator for the kick-off meeting preparation and execution. If using SAP Cloud ALM, prepare test cases based on process flow, application activities, and requirements.

Task.Name: Set Up and Integrate the Automation Tool
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to enable the selected test automation tool(s) from the Test Strategy. The setup and enablement process may vary based on the selected tools. If using a third-party automation testing tool, dedicated accelerators should be provided by the tool vendors. SAP offers the Test Automation Tool for SAP S/4HANA Cloud. The test tool is natively part of the SAP S/4HANA Cloud Quality System. You can integrate the Test Automation Tool with SAP Cloud ALM upon setting up users. SAP Cloud ALM supports this integration to gain an overview of your test cases in the Test Preparation app. It enables you to execute them directly from the Test Execution app. Apps Used: Test Your Processes Test Preparation (SAP Cloud ALM) Test Execution (SAP Cloud ALM) Procedure: Create Users and Configure Test Automation Tool for the SAP S/4HANA Cloud solution. For more details, see the Help - Testing in SAP S/4HANA Cloud accelerator. Set up an integration between SAP S/4HANA Cloud Test Automation Tool and SAP Cloud ALM. For more details, see the Integrating Automated Test Case steps from the SAP Cloud ALM for Implementation Expert Portal - Test Management accelerator. Refer to the SAP Community - SAP S/4HANA Cloud Automation Testing accelerator for information, content, and forums regarding test automation. Procedure Note(s): Add business/test users with the Maintain users option in the Test Your Processes App to set up the Test Automation Tool. Note that these users must be business users (a technical user is insufficient) and must have the appropriate roles to launch the SAP S/4HANA Cloud applications under testing. Two-factor authentication for the Test Automation Tool can also be configured based on the system requirement. For any issues in setting up the test tool or in performing test executions with the tool, create an incident under component ‘CA-CTT-S4C.’ For additional information and blogs on the Test Automation Tool, refer to the Blogs - SAP S/4HANA Cloud Test Automation Tool Tag in the SAP Community accelerator. If you are implementing Hybrid two-tier Deployment Scenarios, the SAP S/4HANA Cloud Test Automation Tool can automate the steps executed in the SAP S/4HANA Cloud system.

ExtendedAttribute.Value: 2nd Wave Project / Rollout Project, Hybrid Deployment (Two-Tier ERP), Parallel Project Line

Task.Name: Create Test Process with Test Automation Tool
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to manage Test Processes within the Test Automation Tool. Each test process comprises several steps, each of which involves a series of system-related actions. Procedure: Integrate standard automated test scripts into a test plan and modify the necessary data, primarily organizational and master data. For more information, refer to the Help - Testing in SAP S/4HANA Cloud and select the Test Your Processes section. If standard test scripts cannot be directly adopted, consider the following options: Check if Standard test scripts can be partially adopted by creating a custom test process. This can be done by copying standard test processes and modifying them by adding or deleting test process steps and editing action data in test process steps. Create a new automated test script using a recording functionality and incorporate it into the test plan. For more information, refer to the Help - Testing in SAP S/4HANA Cloud and select the Manage Your Test Processes section. Procedure Note(s): The apps Manage Your Test Processes and Test Your Processes are not available during the Explore phase or in the Starter System. These apps will become accessible after provisioning the Test System in the Realize phase. SAP advises modifying standard test processes by adding or deleting existing process steps and using the Data Variant feature to swap test data. After a release upgrade, the customer must manually update any custom-created process steps. The SAP Community - SAP S/4HANA Cloud Automation Testing contains information on standard automated test scripts, coverage of steps, and associated data bindings. Review the Accelerator Test Automation Tool Guide to understand how the SAP S/4HANA Cloud Test Automation Tool works.

ExtendedAttribute.Value: 2nd Wave Project / Rollout Project, Parallel Project Line

Task.Name: Create Test Plan
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to develop a comprehensive test plan, which involves organizing a sequence of standard or customized test cases/test scripts in a specific manner to outline the entire business process. Test plans are sets of test cases executed together to represent end-to-end business processes in specific test cycles, helping you run your testing activities in iterations. Test plans consist of groups of test cases executed together to define end-to-end business processes within specific test cycles. This approach facilitates iterative testing activities, encompassing various test cases such as Automated Test Cases, Manual Test Cases, and Test Cases executed on integrated systems during integration scenarios. The test plan holds immense significance as an artifact during the testing process as it enables monitoring the successful execution of tests. Procedure: Review the end-to-end business processes and define the scope of the Test Plan. If you use SAP Cloud ALM as your Test Management Tool: Create the Test Cases in the SAP Cloud ALM > Test Preparation App either manually or by integrating automation providers with SAP Cloud ALM. Create test plans to categorize test cases in the Test Plan Overview section of SAP Cloud ALM > Test Preparation App. You can find additional information on SAP Cloud ALM Test Plans available in the Help - SAP Cloud ALM Test Plans accelerator. If you are managing Test Plans Manually or using a third-party Test Management Tool: Create the test plan and add the relevant business processes to it. Different test plans should be created for the different phases of the project (i.e., User Acceptance Tests, Regression Tests, Performance Tests, etc.). Procedure Note(s): SAP Cloud ALM currently supports the integration with the following automation providers. Test automation tool for SAP S/4HANA Cloud: Test all solution processes from the solution scenario SAP Best Practices for SAP S/4HANA Cloud. Tricentis Test Automation for SAP integrated with SAP Cloud ALM: Test all browser-based SAP solutions and applications. For more details, see the Automated Test Cases in SAP Cloud ALM accelerator.

ExtendedAttribute.Value: 2nd Wave Project / Rollout Project, Parallel Project Line

Task.Name: Change Test Data Using Data Variant
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to edit test data using data variants. A data variant can be created to change test data used in test actions. An existing data variant can be edited, copied, and deleted. To ease changes, it is possible to download data variants into a spreadsheet to perform changes and upload the updated version. Apps Used: Test Your Processes Test Data Container Procedure: Review or edit data from the Data Variants table in the Test Your Processes application. In the Manage Variant section, Edit variant description, values, and data binding criteria (if applicable). Procedure Note(s): For more details, see the Help - Testing in SAP S/4HANA Cloud accelerator and select the Test Your Processes and Test Data Container sections. Alternatively, you can edit a data variant using Microsoft Excel. For additional information and blogs on the Test Automation Tool and Test Data Container, refer to the Blogs - SAP S/4HANA Cloud Test Automation Tool Tag in the SAP Community accelerator.

ExtendedAttribute.Value: 2nd Wave Project / Rollout Project, Parallel Project Line

Task.Name: Establish Readiness for User Acceptance Test
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to deliver the ‘Readiness for UAT’ survey, to establish whether the testing team is ready to conduct their User Acceptance Test (UAT) activities. Corrective measures derived from the findings report will allow stakeholders to ensure UAT runs smoothly and within the designated timeframe. Procedure: Review the recommendations of the ‘Readiness for UAT’ section of the XM Transformation Procedures accelerator. Identify the survey and reporting recipient groups, listed in the above section of the accelerator, and inform them they are participating in the XM transformation program. Provide these groups (especially report recipients) with enablement on how to use the Readiness for UAT survey and/or interpret the reporting results. Go to the ‘Survey Q’ tab of the XM Transformation Survey Questions accelerator and locate the survey questions, by filtering on the ‘Readiness for UAT’ column. Adapt the survey to the current transformation, finalize and publish. Distribute the Readiness for UAT survey. Once the survey response collection period is over, finalize the dashboard and use it to communicate the feedback to report recipients, with follow-up meetings to discuss the findings and recommending corrective measures accordingly. Document the outcomes in an executive summary for Sponsor and Steering Committee quarterly business review activities. Procedure Note(s): If the process is unclear, engage with the XM Advisory experts from your XM vendor, SAP or implementation partner for assistance.

ExtendedAttribute.Value: 2nd Wave Project / Rollout Project, XM Transformation

Task.Name: Data Migration in the Test Tenant
Task.Notes: The purpose of this deliverable is to execute data migration in the test tenant so that the data can be used and validated in the end-to-end scenario testing. The execution sequence adheres to the migration plan that will be used in the production cutover and is adjusted based on any deficiencies found. Process execution times are also determined and included in the plan.

ExtendedAttribute.Value: 2nd Wave Project / Rollout Project, Hybrid Deployment (Two-Tier ERP)

Task.Name: Execute Data Migration in the Test Tenant of SAP S/4HANA Cloud
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to execute data migration using the staging tables or/and direct transfer approach. Procedure: Data Migration Using Staging Tables Follow the procedure in the ‘Test Script’ accessible via the Data Migration to SAP S/4HANA from Staging (‏2Q2‏) to migrate the various migration objects. Below is a summary of the steps. Create the migration project. Select the migration objects. Populate the staging tables with the data files or alternatively via SAP or 3rd party tools. Process any open mapping tasks to ensure that the source data is mapped correctly. Simulate data migration. Execute data migration. Note the uptime and downtime restrictions related to the Hotfix Collection Deployment. Review status of your migration projects and objects in the Data Migration Status app. Verify migrated data for accuracy and completeness. Verify the process and sequence for each object in the cutover plan. Data Migration Using Direct Transfer Follow the “Set up instructions” accessible via the Data Migration to SAP S/4HANA from SAP (BH3) accelerator. A communication arrangement is required to use the direct transfer approach. Complete the step below: Note the project and migration objects were created with the import of the project transport. Select a communication arrangement. Select data. Process any open mapping tasks to ensure that the source data is mapped correctly. Simulate data migration. Execute data migration. Note the uptime and downtime restrictions related to the Hotfix Collection Deployment. Verify migrated data for accuracy and completeness – check ‘Migration Results’ button. Verify the process and sequence for each object in the cutover plan. Procedure Note(s): See the accelerator SAP S/4HANA Cloud - Migration Cockpit - Cookbook for step by step guidance. Consider planned system maintenance windows before executing data migration in order to avoid terminations. See SAP Note 3024158 - Blue-Green Deployment for Hotfix Collection for RISE with SAP S/4HANA Cloud and Software Lifecycle Management for more information. Check for object changes after a release by using the Help - Release Comparison of Migration Object Templates accelerator. Customers transitioning from SAP Business ByDesign can refer Blog : Guide for Proposed Migration - SAP Business ByDesign to S/4HANA Public Cloud (Step 4 onwards).

ExtendedAttribute.Value: 2nd Wave Project / Rollout Project, ByDesign to S/4HANA Cloud Transition (Partner), Parallel Project Line

Task.Name: Conduct Final Data Quality Assessment
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to verify the quality of the data sets once all objects have been migrated into all integrated systems. The stakeholders are notified that data migration is completes and business scenario testing can begin. Procedure: Conduct a final quality assessment with the data owners documenting the findings and action items. Report the final findings to key stakeholders. Finalize documentation of data migration processes. Finalize the data cutover sequence and plan.

ExtendedAttribute.Value: 2nd Wave Project / Rollout Project, Hybrid Deployment (Two-Tier ERP)

Task.Name: Recreate the Data Migration Project in the Production Tenant (Staging Tables)
Task.Notes: This task is only relevant for migration using staging tables. The purpose of this task is to recreate the data migration project in the target tenant when the staging tables process is used. Procedure: Manually recreate the project and assign the relevant objects in the target tenant.

Task.Name: Transport the Data Migration Project in the Production Tenant (Direct Transfer)
Task.Notes: This task is only relevant for migration using Direct Transfer. The purpose of this task is to transport the data migration project to the target tenant. Procedure: Follow the procedure in Help - Transporting Projects to the Test System to move the migration project to another tenant.

Task.Name: Test Execution
Task.Notes: The purpose of this deliverable is to simulate business activities to validate that the configured solution and related business processes will satisfy the business operating requirements. Test execution during the Realize phase is a significant activity where the previous planning and preparation activities come together to test the system. This is where planned and prepared tests are executed, statuses are recorded, and defects are raised, fixed, and tested. It's important to highlight the responsible testing resources and document the steps and results since this can be used in the following deliverable for end-user enablement activities.

Task.Name: Execute the Test Cases within SAP S/4HANA Cloud
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to carry out testing within SAP S/4HANA Cloud for the test cases specified in the Test Plan created during the Test Preparation Deliverable and oversee the execution of the tests. As a Testing Expert, you can execute and monitor the progress and the result of both manual and Automated test cases. Procedure: Validate if the necessary test data is maintained. If you are executing Manual Test Cases: If SAP Cloud ALM is utilized, executing the manual test cases developed in the Test Preparation Deliverable is possible using SAP Cloud ALM > Test Execution App. You can find additional information on executing manual test cases in the Execute Manual Test Cases steps available in the SAP Cloud ALM for Implementation Expert Portal - Test Management accelerator. If you do not use SAP Cloud ALM, Record your Testing result manually. Please use Manual Test Script Template.xlsx Accelerator to record the results of your Manual Test Cases. If you are executing Automated Test Cases: If SAP Cloud ALM is utilized, the automated test cases can be executed through the connected test automation tool using the SAP Cloud ALM > Test Execution App. Further instructions on executing automated test cases can be found in the Execute Automated Test Cases steps available in the SAP Cloud ALM for Implementation Expert Portal - Test Management accelerator. If you do not use SAP Cloud ALM, Execute the Test Cases (Known as Test Plan in the Test Automation Tool) directly from the Test Automation Tool by executing the test plans from the Test Your Processes App within SAP S/4HANA Cloud System. For more details, see the Test Your Processes steps from the Help - Testing in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Accelerator. Procedure Note(s): Review the Blog - SAP S/4HANA Cloud Test Automation Tool - FAQ Blog Series accelerator for frequently asked questions on the Test Automation Tool. Please validate the Not Supported APIs.xlsx accelerator to verify the roster of APIs that the Test Automation Tool does not endorse. For additional information and blogs on the Test Automation Tool, refer to the Blogs - SAP S/4HANA Cloud Test Automation Tool Tag in the SAP Community accelerator.

ExtendedAttribute.Value: 2nd Wave Project / Rollout Project, Parallel Project Line

Task.Name: Defect Management and Re-testing for SAP S/4HANA Cloud
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to detect any errors during the automated test execution in the SAP S/4HANA Cloud->Test Your Processes, document them in SAP Cloud ALM->Defect, and address them during the test plan execution. Resolving these issues will involve a collaborative effort from a cross-functional team comprising Testing Experts, Configuration Experts, and Business Process Experts, who will hold regular meetings to discuss necessary actions. Procedure: If you use SAP Cloud ALM, Identify the test plan "With Errors" in the Test Execution App and click on Open Execution Log to view a detailed action log in the SAP S/4HANA Cloud Test Automation Tool. Create a Defect in SAP Cloud ALM->Defects; for more details, see the Defects section from SAP Cloud ALM for Implementation Expert Portal - Test Management accelerator. Resolve all failed Test Plans(s) and fix them per the detailed action log. Once all errors have been fixed, re-run the test plan. If the retest is successful, the defect status can be set to Close in SAP Cloud ALM->Defects. Procedure Note(s): Regular defect triage meetings are held to discuss defect resolution. Any defects that must be communicated to SAP should be reported via the SAP Support Portal accelerator. If you experience any test tool-related issues, please create an incident with component CA-CTT-S4C. Other defects should refer to the relevant application component.

ExtendedAttribute.Value: 2nd Wave Project / Rollout Project, Parallel Project Line

Task.Name: Test Execution Analysis and Reporting for SAP S/4HANA Cloud
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to analyze and provide updates/reports on the advancement of test execution conducted within SAP S/4HANA Cloud at various phases, beginning with the creation of test scripts to the assessment of test execution outcomes and defect management. As a Testing Expert, you can analyze and report on both manual and automated test cases. Apps Used: Analyze Automated Test Results SAP Cloud ALM > Test Execution Analysis Procedure: If SAP Cloud ALM is your preferred Test Management tool, you can leverage several analytical dashboards and cards, including Test Preparation Overview and Test Execution Overview, to report on testing progress. To learn how to make the most of these dashboards and cards, refer to the SAP Cloud ALM for Implementation Expert Portal – Test Management accelerator. If you use the S/4HANA Cloud Test Automation Tool, you can utilize the Analyze Automated Test Results app within the Automation-Administrator group to access several dashboards for generating, reviewing, and evaluating test results reports. For more information, refer to the Help - Testing in SAP S/4HANA Cloud accelerator.

ExtendedAttribute.Value: 2nd Wave Project / Rollout Project, Parallel Project Line, Upgrade

Task.Name: Solution Walkthrough
Task.Notes: The purpose of this deliverable is to demonstrate the configured solution to the customer project team and management for solution acceptance.

Task.Name: Prepare for Solution Walkthrough
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to prepare the key business processes and data needed to demonstrate the functionality to the customer project team and executives. Typically, the customer presents to respective stakeholders their understanding of the solution and how it will be used to run the business. Procedure: Schedule the walkthrough meeting. Decide on the processes to demonstrate in a live system based on importance to the business. The processes should cover the critical business processes at a minimum Determine, jointly, data needs across all teams and select data for demonstration of the processes. It is best to connect the scenarios into a complete story with consistent data. Set-up the processes. If integration or enhancements are required but not completed, a conceptual walk-through can be created to explain how the process will work Create walkthrough overview presentation to supplement the demonstration of the solution to the customer.

Task.Name: Conduct Solution Walkthrough
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to demonstrate the configured solution to the stakeholders and gain final approval that the solution satisfies the business needs. Procedure: Demonstrate the processes to the stakeholders. Typically, the implementation team leads the meeting and demonstrates how the solution will fulfill the business requirements. Some slides maybe necessary to help explain difficult topics, but the focus is always on the system actions. Document and resolve issues. Obtain final sign-off from the customer for the solution.

Task.Name: Enablement Delivery
Task.Notes: The purpose of this deliverable is to cover all of the different methods of enablement delivery available to an organization. Some examples include onsite classroom learning, virtual classroom learning, e-learning self-enablement, blended learning, short micro videos, webinars, social collaboration, blogs, and on the job coaching. Each enablement delivery should cover the following aspects: Train the Trainer - soft skills for trainers to learn all the tips and tricks for effective training delivery, both in person and virtually. Pilot delivery - dry run of the course, either virtually or in person. User acceptance testing training - usually solution overview, basics and navigation, high level introduction to how testing works before UAT starts. Knowledge transfer - an SAP trainer delivers content and knowledge transfer to the trainer. Coaching - one-on-one with users, answering general queries or covering specific areas; can also include floorwalking - where trainers are made available to walk around the customer’s office to respond to individual queries, problems and tasks, post implementation.

Task.Name: Plan Learning Logistics
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to consider all of the training, planning and logistics required to deliver enablement content and courses. Procedure: Review both Managing Enablement Delivery and Enablement Delivery Overview accelerator to gain insight into recognizing the essential elements and prerequisites for delivering enablement. Schedule and book learning rooms and virtual classrooms. Plan the logistics for course administration, invitation management, attendance tracking processes, and course feedback processes.

Task.Name: Deliver Enablement
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to equip the designated trainers and end-user with the knowledge and expertise needed to perform their roles effectively. Procedure: Ensure effective knowledge transfer to all users utilizing the most efficient delivery method available. Enhance system acceptance and adoption by providing hands-on experience. Obtain feedback and facilitate ongoing enhancements to learning enablement activities. Pilot the business-critical courses. This provides benefits by allowing for rehearsal and ensuring the final testing of learning content in the chosen delivery mode. Initiate 'Train-the-Trainer' to equip the designated trainers with the knowledge and expertise to deliver effective instructor led learning, whether it be classroom led or virtual online environment. Deliver enablement using the appropriate deliver method tailored to the audience, typically determined during the Learning Needs Analysis for Users)

Task.Name: Assess Training Satisfaction
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to deliver the Training Satisfaction survey to each end user who takes training. This will help safeguard the adoption of the solution by end users and assess their satisfaction with training content, activities, and time given to absorb the knowledge transfer. Furthermore, the Training Satisfaction survey also asks participants about their opinion on the solution in terms of ease of use, usefulness and whether they would recommend the solution (Net Promoter Score). Prerequisites: Training on the solution has been delivered to the survey cohort Procedure: Review the recommendations of the ‘Training Satisfaction’ section of the XM Transformation Procedures accelerator. Identify the survey and reporting recipient groups, listed in the above section of the accelerator, and inform them they are participating in the XM transformation program. Provide these groups (especially report recipients) with enablement on how to use the Training Satisfaction survey and/or interpret the reporting results. Go to the ‘Survey Q’ tab of the XM Transformation Survey Questions accelerator and locate the survey questions, by filtering on the ‘Training Satisfaction’ column. Adapt the survey to the current transformation, finalize and publish. Distribute the Training Satisfaction survey. Once the survey response collection period is over, finalize the dashboard and use it to communicate the feedback to report recipients, with follow-up meetings to discuss the findings and recommending corrective measures accordingly. Document the outcomes in an executive summary for Sponsor and Steering Committee quarterly business review activities. Procedure Note(s): If the process is unclear, engage with the XM Advisory experts from: your XM vendor, SAP or implementation partner for assistance.

ExtendedAttribute.Value: 2nd Wave Project / Rollout Project, XM Transformation

Task.Name: Support Operations and Handover Plan
Task.Notes: The purpose of this deliverable is to establish technical operations monitoring and support processes and to ensure that the post-production support organization has its strategy in place.

ExtendedAttribute.Value: 2nd Wave Project / Rollout Project, GROW Adoption Plan

Task.Name: Establish Support and Operation Processes
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to ensure support operations and tools are in place to support go-live and running the new solution efficiently and effectively. The customer organization must be able to: Communicate problems internally Troubleshoot data issues or improper setup of object Research issues Escalate to SAP support if no solution/cause can be found Procedure: Specify the different level of customer’s support structure required and finalize hiring and onboarding process A help desk, typically 2 to 4 weeks after the go live of any new implementation project or enhancement projects. A key user model to act as first line support for business user, go-to person in day to day business activities and onboarding of new hires. A Customer CoE, a key component of continuous improvement to realize more business benefit from SAP solution implementations and improvements. Setup knowledge transfer to prepare the support resources prepare to run the new solution. Knowledge transfer is done through a combination of activities, including formal training, self-study, shadowing, and on-the-job training. Document operation handbook and test support processes and procedures. This includes incident management, problem management, access management, change management, and test management Implement support tools. Reference SAP Cloud ALM for Operations accelerator for functionality to monitor process, provide alerts and prevent disruption.

ExtendedAttribute.Value: 2nd Wave Project / Rollout Project, GROW Adoption Plan

Task.Name: Cutover Preparation
Task.Notes: The purpose of this deliverable is to document the strategy, scope, and timelines for moving from the "as-is" solution to the "to-be" solution and the post-go live support period immediately following go-live.

ExtendedAttribute.Value: 2nd Wave Project / Rollout Project, Hybrid Deployment (Two-Tier ERP)

Task.Name: Create Cutover Plan and Documentation
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to develop and document the cutover plan for moving from the current (legacy) solution to the new solution and the post-go live support period. This includes the following activities: Determining scope and timeline Setting up and initializing the production system Setting up and verifying interface connections and integrated applications Data migration User creation Closing the legacy systems Completing all required documentation for regulatory purposes (if required) Planning timeline and meeting schedule for sequencing and simulating the cutover schedule It is important that each team begin the development of the cutover schedule when starting configuration and maintain the list throughout the implementation to avoid missing critical details. Estimated durations should also be kept and refined so that the final schedule can calculated down to the minute. Procedure: Review the How to Approach Remote Cutover accelerator. Create a strategy document including the areas impacted by the cutover. See accelerator Cutover Strategy Template.pptx for an example. Create a draft cutover schedule that documents the end-to-end activities of the cutover. The following are commonly found in a cutover plan. Schedule times and durations Prerequisite steps for the production conversion Closing the legacy systems End-user lockout Business data conversion Post-conversion validation reports (e.g. checking for business data consistency) Go/No-Go decisions Ramp-Up activities (e.g. batch jobs, interfaces, etc.) User unlock Planned system maintenance windows Review roles and responsibilities. Every task within the cutover plan should have an assigned owner, estimated duration, and identified dependencies. The owner of each task should validate and approve the task to ensure they understand their responsibilities. Simulate or test the plan. Multiple iterations may be beneficial. Finalize the plan and associated documentation. Procedure Note(s): Planned system maintenance windows should be considered when planning data migration in order to avoid terminations. See product specific maintenance schedules in the accelerator section. Relevant go-live tasks from integrated applications (BTP apps, Industry Cloud apps, third-party, etc.) are included in the cutover plan resulting in a complete cutover list.

ExtendedAttribute.Value: 2nd Wave Project / Rollout Project, Hybrid Deployment (Two-Tier ERP), Industry Cloud Apps, Parallel Project Line

Task.Name: Analytics Configuration in the Production System
Task.Notes: The purpose of this deliverable is the configuration of Analytics in the Production System.

Task.Name: Verify Analytics in the Production System
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to verify the analytics in the Production system according to the previously developed setup guides for a successful run. Prerequisites: Successful import of the transport request in the Production system Successful testing of reports in the Test system Procedure: Execute pre-delivered test scripts where available. Execute custom reports to the specifications which were run through in the previous system. Procedure Note(s): All documentation needs to be delivered upon successful completion which includes the Functional and Technical Specification documents.

Task.Name: Solution Extension Deployment in Production System
Task.Notes: The purpose of this deliverable is to deploy and validate any solution extensions into the Production system of the customer landscape.

Task.Name: Deploy Solution Extensions
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to deploy solution extensions in the production system. Prerequisite: Successful testing of extension scenarios. Apps Used: Import Collection Procedure: Using the Import Collection application in Test System to forward the extension scenario related transport to Production System. In the Production System, use Import Collection app to import the queued changes. Repeat the process for each development sprint

Task.Name: Phase Closure and Sign-Off Phase Deliverables
Task.Notes: The purpose of the phase closure and sign-off deliverable is to. Ensure that all required deliverables from this phase and the project are complete and accurate, and close any outstanding issues Identify lessons learned during the phase to prepare for formal phase closure Capture customer feedback and potential Customer References

ExtendedAttribute.Value: 2nd Wave Project / Rollout Project, GROW Adoption Plan

Task.Name: Conduct Project Quality Gate
Task.Notes: The purpose of the Quality Gate is to ensure that both compliance and project management standards are being upheld within projects. A Quality Gate is a checklist milestone at the end of a project phase . Prior to moving into the next phase each project manager demonstrates that they have been compliant with the mandatory deliverables associated with a methodology while ensuring best practice standards have been applied to ensure quality.
