Procedure: Review the QGate Checklist Concept SAP Activate accelerator to ensure an understanding on what should be covered during the Quality Gate. Areas covered should include: Specifically checking deliverables been completed with recommended practices Assuring project planning Validating open risks and issues, and measuring customer satisfaction Conduct the Quality Gate utilizing the applicable Quality Gate Template accelerator.

ExtendedAttribute.Value: 2nd Wave Project / Rollout Project, GROW Adoption Plan, Industry Cloud Apps

Task.Name: Assess Project Performance
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to deliver the Project Performance survey to the appropriate stakeholder groups throughout the remainder of the implementation. This includes the core project management team and each team working to transform a ‘Line of Business’ (LoB) business process (supply chain, finance, etc). Each team will provide project team-related feedback in terms of governance, processes and empowerment during the Explore, Realize and Deploy phases. Procedure: Review the recommendations of the ‘Project Performance’ section of the XM Transformation Procedures accelerator. Identify the survey and reporting recipient groups, listed in the above section of the accelerator, and inform them they are participating in the XM transformation program. Provide these groups (especially report recipients) with enablement on how to use the Project Performance survey and/or interpret the reporting results. Go to the ‘Survey Q’ tab of the XM Transformation Survey Questions accelerator and locate the survey questions, by filtering on the ‘Project Performance’ column. Adapt the survey to the current transformation, finalize and publish. Determine the appropriate frequency of survey (at least quarterly or at end of a phase), noting where other surveys (i.e. Solution Validation) incorporate the same questions, so that they do not coincide with what is already distributed to these same user. Distribute the Project Performance survey. Once the survey response collection period is over, finalize the dashboard and use it to communicate the feedback to report recipients, with follow-up meetings to discuss the findings and recommend corrective measures accordingly. Document the outcomes in an executive summary for Sponsor and Steering Committee quarterly business review activities. Procedure Note(s): If the process is unclear, engage with the XM Advisory experts from: your XM vendor, SAP or implementation partner for assistance. For LoB teams only, the ‘Tracking Goals’ survey takes over from the Project Performance survey, at that phase.

ExtendedAttribute.Value: 2nd Wave Project / Rollout Project, XM Transformation

Task.Name: Obtain Customer Sign-Off for Phase Completion
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to conduct a formal closure of the project phase and sign-off the deliverables completed during the phase. When sign-off is obtained, the project can proceed to the next phase. Procedure: Ensure that all required deliverables from this phase and the project are complete and accurate, and close any outstanding issues. Ensure the Q-Gate was completed and identify lessons learned during the phase. Capture customer feedback and potential customer references. Use the Phase Sign-Off Accelerator to document and store in the project repository.

ExtendedAttribute.Value: 2nd Wave Project / Rollout Project, GROW Adoption Plan

Task.Name: Deploy
Task.Notes: The purpose of this phase is to set up the production system, conduct cutover activities, confirm customer organization readiness, and to switch business operations to the new system. Deploy Phase Activities: Finalize the solution and business processes for production go-live Resolve all crucial open issues Conduct system tests Proceed with cutover activities including data migration Execute transition and cutover plans including organizational change management (OCM) plans Complete all scheduled end user training Track and report on value delivery Develop post-go live support plan

Task.Name: Execution/Monitoring of Project
Task.Notes: The purpose of this deliverable is for the project team to carry out the planned and approved project work and measures project performance to identify variances from the plan. The execution goal is to manage the scope of the work to be done, while monitoring the execution, identifying variances from the plan, monitoring quality results, controlling progress against the plan, controlling changes throughout the project, assess and respond to risks, and communicate the project status. The Project Management Plan developed during the Prepare phase for each of the PM knowledge areas, guide the team's approach to management, execution, monitoring, and control of project activities. This methodology provides steps to be considered when each activity is engaged and supported by the team's monitoring/controlling plans. The project manager is responsible for ensuring that the monitoring/controlling plans developed in the planning phase are applied at the appropriate level of control.

ExtendedAttribute.Value: 2nd Wave Project / Rollout Project, GROW Adoption Plan

Task.Name: Review the SAP S/4HANA Cloud Onboarding Journey
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to provide users with the essential knowledge and resources required to successfully navigate and contribute to projects and implementations involving SAP S/4HANA Cloud. Procedure: Explore the SAP methodology and gain familiarity with assessing final activities for solution go live, identification of SAP offerings & services to support go live, and post go live resources using the 5th Onboarding session - Project Guidance one pager accelerator. Review the SAP S/4HANA Cloud Onboarding Journey one pager accelerator to get familiar with the onboarding journey from the welcome & introduction all the way to go-live preparation. Tune into both live and recorded onboarding webinars using the SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition Onboarding Resource Center accelerator.

Task.Name: Direct and Manage Project Execution
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to execute the project management plan and accomplish the work defined in the project scope statement for the project manager and the project team. Procedure: In executing the project work, the project team will perform the following types of activities: Perform project tasks to reach project objectives Expend effort and funds to accomplish project objectives Staff, train, and manage the project team members assigned to the project Obtain, manage, and utilize resources Implement and execute the planned methods and standards Create, control, verify, and validate project deliverables Manage the scope of the approved work Manage risks and implement risk response activities Manage issues to closure Adapt approved changes into the scope, plans, and project environment Establish and manage internal and external communications Collect project data and report on progress and performance In monitoring/controlling work results, the project team performs the following types of activities: Compare actual project performance to the project management plan Assess performance to determine whether corrective or preventive actions are necessary Monitor and control project risks and issues Provide metrics to support progress and performance reporting and forecasting Monitor implementation of approved changes Take corrective action as needed See topic ‘Analytics’ in the SAP Cloud ALM for Implementation - Expert Portal accelerator for more information on project monitoring in SAP Cloud ALM. Management plans developed during the Prepare phase guide the team's approach to management, execution, and control of project activities. Note: See the “Prepare Project Management Plan” task in Prepare phase for details.

Task.Name: Manage Project Issues, Risks, and Changes
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to manage project issues, risks, and changes. A consistent and thorough approach to managing project issues is essential for an effective project management system. Efficient issue management entails the appropriate managerial decision-making and progress tracking in line with the project's issue management procedure. Identified issues are centralized and maintained within a single environment. Procedure: Utilize a dedicated issue tracking document based on the Open Issues List Template.xls accelerator. The management of issues entails the following steps: An issue is raised and appropriately categorized based on its relevance to system conversion, solution implementation, or solution operations within SAP technology. This issue is logged in the issue tracking tool, either by SAP, a customer, or an implementation partner. During the issue's creation, the individual raising the issue assigns its priority and identifies the responsible person for resolving it. The Project Manager conducts regular follow-ups on issues, in addition to adhering to the standard issue management process outlined in the project's management plans. Critical issues are reviewed as part of the input for each Quality Gate review meeting. Review and update open issues regularly, and communicate these updates to the relevant stakeholder groups as part of the routine project reporting and communication process. Issue tracking enhances visibility and transparency regarding open issues, problems, action items, and associated action plans for the project management team. Use a centralized issue tracking system to oversee and maintain lists of issues that require action and resolution, thereby guaranteeing the project's success.

ExtendedAttribute.Value: 2nd Wave Project / Rollout Project, GROW Adoption Plan

Task.Name: Update Project Management Documents
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to ensure that the project manager keeps the key project management documents up-to-date. The project management documents are, together, a comprehensive body of project documents that include the project schedule, budget/cost information, monitoring/controlling plans for each of the nine knowledge areas of the Project Management Body of Knowledge (PMBOK), and other information as appropriate. The project management plan document developed for each of the knowledge areas provide the foundation for the consistent application of project management practices. Procedure: Refine the project schedule, the project budget, and provide appropriate updates to the management plans, scope document and business case to reflect the detailed scope information created during the project. Includes updates to: Project management plan Project WBS Project schedule Project budget Business case Scope document Backlog document (created in Explore phase)

Task.Name: Communicate Project Status and Progress
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to communicate project status and progress. Throughout the project, several project performance reports need to be produced for different purposes and audiences, as defined in the project communication plan. The project manager and project team are responsible for clearly communicating the progress of the key activities, completion of the deliverables, and status against the schedule and budget. Procedure: Produce team member status updates typically every week and share them with the team lead. It is recommended that this report is kept very lightweight and provided to the team lead via e-mail or in a team meeting. Report team status reports on regular cadence, typically weekly. The team status reports are prepared by the team leads and are delivered to the project manager as an input for the project status report. The team status report may be reviewed in regular team review with the Project Manager or provided in a predefined format. Use the project status report template for project status report. Create the project status report on weekly basis, based on the input from individual teams and additional information like issues list, risk list, etc. Prepare executive status report on monthly or quarterly cadence and provide it to the project executive steering group. Generally, In this report re-use the key information from the weekly project status report. Expand on the value and benefits of the program and include discussion of the decisions that are needed from the executive steering group. Additionally, throughout the project, as more is known, review and update the project communication matrix. The communication matrix documents the project team’s approach to communication. It captures the analysis completed as part of communications planning and serves as a tool to guide the project team throughout the project.

Task.Name: Operations Readiness
Task.Notes: The purpose of this deliverable is to help check the customer’s ability to operate the new SAP solution as of Go-Live.

ExtendedAttribute.Value: 2nd Wave Project / Rollout Project, GROW Adoption Plan

Task.Name: Tracking Goals
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to track whether the team is operationally ready for the cutover and go-live tasks. Conducted at the beginning and again at the end of the Deploy phase, the ‘Tracking Goals’ survey also supports Organizational Change Management activities and invites participants to give recommendations for improvement. Prerequisites: The Readiness for UAT survey results from the Realize phase have been gathered and communicated The recommendations and findings from the Readiness for UAT feedback are understood and, where applicable, corrective actions have been taken. Procedure: Review the recommendations of the ‘Tracking Goals’ section of the XM Transformation Procedures accelerator. Identify the survey and reporting recipient groups, listed in the above section of the accelerator, and inform them they are participating in the XM transformation program. Provide these groups (especially report recipients) with enablement on how to use the Readiness for UAT survey and/or interpret the reporting results. Go to the ‘Survey Q’ tab of the XM Transformation Survey Questions accelerator and locate the survey questions, by filtering on the ‘Tracking Goals’ column. Adapt the survey to the current transformation, finalize and publish. Distribute the Tracking Goals survey. Once the survey response collection period is over, finalize the dashboard and use it to communicate the feedback to report recipients, with follow-up meetings to discuss the findings and recommending corrective measures accordingly. Document the outcomes in an executive summary for Sponsor and Steering Committee quarterly business review activities. Procedure Note(s): If the process is unclear, engage with the XM Advisory experts from your XM vendor, SAP or implementation partner for assistance.

ExtendedAttribute.Value: 2nd Wave Project / Rollout Project, GROW Adoption Plan, XM Transformation

Task.Name: Production Cutover
Task.Notes: The purpose of this deliverable is to execute the cutover plan and ready the business and system for productive use. The cutover plan contains both business process tasks as well as system tasks. It is executed in the days prior to the go-live date. Examples of potential tasks in the cutover list are as follows. Based on the solution, not all may be applicable. Setting up and initializing the production system Setting up and verifying interface connections Migration or creation of master data Migration of order objects (i.e. purchase orders, sales orders, etc) User creation/access Go/no go decision points Closing the legacy systems Notification of impacted 3rd parties Completing all required documentation for regulatory purposes

ExtendedAttribute.Value: Data Management, Extensibility, Integration, Operations and Support
2nd Wave Project / Rollout Project, Hybrid Deployment (Two-Tier ERP), Identity and Access Management

Task.Name: Execute Cutover Tasks per the Cutover Plan
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to cutover to the productive system, obtain the customer approval (sign-off), validate that the go-live acceptance criteria have been met, and confirm the successful go-live. Procedure: Execute the cutover to Production following the task defined in the cutover plan. Document the actual duration of each step to support future projects. Capture any variances to the plan along with the decision maker who approved the change. The cutover manager(s) should proactively notify task owners of upcoming tasks, to ensure their availability. Regularly communicate status to stakeholders. Test and validate the systems after the cutover has finished. Obtain the production approval sign-off, which documents the agreement with the stakeholders that cutover tasks have been successfully executed.

ExtendedAttribute.Value: 2nd Wave Project / Rollout Project, Hybrid Deployment (Two-Tier ERP)

Task.Name: System Go-Live
Task.Notes: The purpose of this deliverable is to set the SAP S/4HANA Cloud system to a Run status which notifies SAP support that Production system is being used for productive business operations.

Task.Name: Set Production System to Live
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to confirm the Productive system is Live and in Run mode. Procedure: Ensure all project activities of the implementation project are set to ‘Completed.’ Execute Go-Live communications. Procedure Note(s): Change projects can still be created in the Development System and transported to the Test System, and forwarded to the Production System. However, additional diligence is necessary when configuring and testing new processes not to impact the current operations. Short transport sprints (1 to 2 weeks) are still recommended when configuring new functionality.

Task.Name: Phase Closure and Sign-Off Phase Deliverables
Task.Notes: The purpose of this deliverable is to formally close the phase and conduct deliverable sign-off. During this time the project team will: Ensure that all required deliverables from this phase and the project are complete and accurate, and close any outstanding issues Identify lessons learned during the phase Capture customer feedback and identify potential customer references

ExtendedAttribute.Value: 2nd Wave Project / Rollout Project, GROW Adoption Plan

Task.Name: Conduct Project Quality Gate
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to conduct regular quality checks at defined or critical stages of the project lifecycle to assess the health of the project. Procedure: Review the QGate Checklist Concept SAP Activate accelerator to ensure an understanding on what should be covered during the Quality Gate. Areas covered should include: Specifically checking deliverables been completed with recommended practices Assuring project planning Validating open risks and issues, and measuring customer satisfaction Conduct the Quality Gate utilizing the applicable Quality Gate Template accelerator.

Task.Name: Obtain Customer Sign-Off for Phase/Project Completion
Task.Notes: The purpose of this deliverable is to formally close the phase and conduct deliverable sign-off. Procedure: Ensure that all required deliverables from this phase and the project are complete and accurate, and close any outstanding issues Ensure Project Quality Gate was completed and identify lessons learned during the phase Capture customer feedback and identify potential customer references Formally close the project by obtaining final phase sign-off utilizing the Phase Sign-Off Template accelerator.

ExtendedAttribute.Value: 2nd Wave Project / Rollout Project, GROW Adoption Plan

Task.Name: S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition - Published July 24, 2024
Task.Notes: SAP Activate Content for SAP S/4HANA Cloud. Many thanks to all of the people that contribute and provide feedback!! Release Notes

Task.Name: Run
Task.Notes: The purpose of this phase is to further optimize and automate the operability of the solution. Operability is the ability to maintain IT systems in a functioning and operating condition, guaranteeing system availability and required performance levels to support the execution of the enterprise’s business operations. Run Phase Activities: Ongoing system operations Continuous change management Continuous learning Continuous improvement Release cycles

Task.Name: Cloud Operation Framework
Task.Notes: The purpose of this deliverable is to establish operation framework or center to manage and operate the S/4HANA Cloud Public Cloud to sustain business operations, continue solution adoption and make incremental value realization. It includes all activities involved in supporting and managing the lifecycle of providing service by SAP, customers' IT support organization and/or Partner to end users.

ExtendedAttribute.Value: 2nd Wave Project / Rollout Project, GROW Adoption Plan

Task.Name: Establish Operation Center
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to understand the different roles, tasks and tools needed to establish an operation center. Procedure: Review Best Practices for Operations in Run Phase.pdf accelerator. Form your operation team with recommended personas and RACI matrix in the following operational areas: Monitoring - Monitor systems and processes and observe to detect changes over time. Reference tasks in Operate and Monitor deliverable for examples of ongoing system operation details. Incident management - Manage unplanned event or service interruption by restoring the service to its operational state and minimizing effects on end users. Change management - Seek to minimize the risk associated with changes, including changes to the IT infrastructure, processes, documents, supplier interfaces, etc. Service requests - Managing service requests and support an agreed quality of services, by way of handling user-initiated requests in an efficient and user-friendly manner. Reference task Access SAP Support Service task when creating request to SAP. Test management - Reference test preparation and test execution tasks in SAP Activate for Upgrade of SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition (3-system landscape) on regression test during upgrade. Software lifecycle event management - Reference task Review and Process Hotfix Collection, Evaluate and Activate Feature from Continuous Delivery, and Prepare and Process Upgrade for details of managing release upgrade and updates.

Task.Name: Access SAP Support Service
Task.Notes: The purpose of the task is to find support and services provided by SAP when there is a need. SAP for Me is the starting point to find support and services that are available. The Services and Support Dashboard has various apps that allow customer search for Knowledge Based Articles and Notes (KBAs) before logging a case to contact SAP including Expert Chat or creating service request. In the More Resources tab there is My Trust Center that consolidates a customer's view of security and privacy measure, and compliance checks from Accel ID = INN_074. Under Systems and Provisioning Dashboard, customer can see their system(s) status and availability, and subscribe notifications to receive timely updates and remain informed. From Finance and Legal dashboard, customer can access agreement documents (i.e. SLA, Service Level Agreement). Customer can also check out SAP Support Offerings and Programs to engage experts from SAP to run the solution and support end users. Procedure: Access SAP for Me. Search Support Knowledge. Go to various different Dashboards for Legal, Service, Support, Systems related customer specific information. Log Case using Get Support app. Procedure Note(s): Check product specific accelerators when applicable. Review Accelerator SAP Note 3080379 - Customer Penetration Testing Request Process when there is a need to perform an annual penetration test (subject to approval from SAP).

Task.Name: Ongoing System Operations
Task.Notes: The purpose of this deliverable is to perform routine actions to ensure that the system is running as expected by leveraging the established support and operation processes.

ExtendedAttribute.Value: Application Design and Configuration, Data Management, Integration, Operations and Support, Technical Architecture & Infrastructure
2nd Wave Project / Rollout Project, Artificial Intelligence Technology, GROW Adoption Plan, Upgrade

Task.Name: Check External Tax Partner Interface
Task.Notes: This task is relevant for customers working with an external tax partner. The purpose of this task is to check for data inconsistencies between the SAP S/4HANA Cloud system and the external tax partner interface being used. The 'Manage External Tax Postings' app provides customer with a simple way to check for data inconsistencies between their SAP S/4HANA Cloud system and their tax calculation engine. This should occur weekly and before the month end as errors can impact tax reporting in the external tax partner solution. Apps Used: Manage External Tax Postings Schedule Tax Jobs Procedure: Open the Manage External Tax Postings app. Press "Go" to generate the report and review the 'Reason for Hold" column. If there is one posting with status "Failed with Error", it will keep the other posting pending. Failed updates need to be recognized soon.From the 'Failed with Error' link, customers will be able to determine if the error is an internal error or an external error from the tax partner side. This report can be scheduled to be run in the background via the Schedule Tax Jobs app to display a List of Documents for the External Tax System." Review the Help - Manage External Tax Postings accelerator for more information on how to use the app. Procedure Note(s): The 'Manage External Tax Postings' app doesn't appear the SAP Fiori launchpad by default. It has to first be assigned to the S/4HANA Cloud Home Page.

Task.Name: Manage Posting Periods
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to open and close posting periods at the beginning of each period to ensure that journal entries are posted to proper posting periods. This is necessary periodically (for example, monthly) to continue posting transactions to the ledger. See the Help – Manage Posting Periods and Period-End Closing - Plant (BEI) accelerators for additional information. Procedure: In the Manage Posting Periods app, do a search to display posting period variants. Select a posting period variant you want to change, and choose Set Posting Periods > Open Periods. Change the fiscal year period to open a posting period. Save your changes. Procedure Note(s): The process can be scheduled to avoid manual periodic intervention. To schedule background jobs, choose Set Posting Periods > Schedule Recurrence. Opening a posting period will automatically close the previous period. In addition to normal periods, you can change adjustment periods and CO periods to meet your needs. To see the detailed change log for T001B- Manage Posting Period, create an Service Request with the Subject ‘Providing change Log for T001B: Manage Posting Period’, Description 'Dear Cloud operations team, please provide table logs in S/4HANA Cloud system – special case T001B Manage Posting Periods between period <y> and <x>. Please use internal KBA - 2844952 as a reference' on component XX-S4C-OPR-SRV.

Task.Name: Setup Routines and Adapt Changes for Data Protection
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to define routines for data protection activities, monitor the results, and continuously review the internal data protection requirements as well as the external regulations to adjust data protection configurations. Procedure: Define data archiving routines. This step defines how often and when data archiving should be executed using “Manage Archiving Variant” app. Define data destruction routines. This step defines how often and when data destruction should be executed using APP “Manage Archiving Variant” and “ILM Destruction”. Define master data blocking routines. This step defines routine for executing APP “Block Master Data: Business Partner” and APP “Block master Data: Customer / Supplier”. Monitor data access to sensitive personal information via APP “Read Access Logging Monitor”. Review business processes and include new ILM objects and EoP applications in the configuration scope. Review internal and external data protection requirements to update residence policies and retention policies. Procedure Note(s): Data protection activities are not one-time. Update Design and Configuration Documentation for Data Protection to reflect adjustments in configuration settings for the latest policy changes.

Task.Name: Review Upcoming Regulatory Changes
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to enable users to monitor, assess the business impact, and plan the next steps to ensure compliance. The changes are available in the regulatory change manager tool, which provides contextualized regulatory changes across the globe to help customers to rapidly adapt to new and evolving regulations that. This tool should be checked periodically based on the change frequency of the required countries. Automated email notifications can be enabled in the tool to keep track of relevant regulatory changes. Prerequisite: Have an S-User or P-User ID. Procedure: Watch the “Overview Video” and read about “What is Regulatory Change Manager” in Accel ID = S4H_461. Access the Regulatory Change Manager tool and personalize your view and notifications. Monitor the regulatory changes related to your countries and determine action plans. Implement action plans where necessary.

Task.Name: Monitor SAP Build Process Automation Jobs
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to monitor the SAP Build Process Automation Jobs A job is scheduled to execute SAP Build Process Automation Bots at a specified day and time in Set up Artificial Intelligence in Production System deliverable of the Realize phase. Procedure: Login to SAP Build Process Automation Tenant and monitor the job in 'Monitor' Tab. SAP Build offers several interlinked views for Process and Workflow Instances, Automation Jobs, Automation Overview, Visibility Scenarios, Business Rules, Triggers, and Acquired Events. All can be accessed using dedicated tiles in the SAP Build Work Zone. Procedure Note(s): See the 'Monitoring Processes' section within the accelerator Help - SAP Build Process Automation for additional information.

ExtendedAttribute.Value: 2nd Wave Project / Rollout Project, Artificial Intelligence Technology, Upgrade

Task.Name: Continue to Improve and Innovate
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to continually improve the business process efficiencies by expanding the use of system functionality. Procedure: Set up a new organization model like Customer Center of Expertise to provide transparency and efficiency in implementing improvements and innovations to meet business objectives and goals. Reference Value Management deliverable to monitor usage, perform benchmarking, and assess solution performance. Evaluate new functionality for improvement projects. Reference task Evaluate New Functionality under Release and Upgrade Cycle deliverable. Improve with SAP Continuous Influence by continuously suggest improvements directly to SAP development teams. Create new project. Procedure Note(s): Build upon backlog started during initial implementation to keep track of new change requests and innovations with Innovation Backlog in Run Phase.xlsx template. Use tag “2nd Wave Project” for a complete list of tasks to setup your new improvement project. Customer may choose to switch to "simple" transport mode in the Run phase when there are mainly configuration transports from SAP update and upgrade of business content. Make sure to re-evaluate the transport mode when starting a new project. Switch to “flexible” mode if rolling out multiple countries, or when involving extension developments with complex business process activations. Reference Help - Transport Modes for more details.

Task.Name: Release and Update Cycles for SAP S/4HANA Cloud
Task.Notes: The purpose of the deliverable is to manage updates and upgrades of SAP S/4HANA Cloud. With 3-system landscape architecture, software and business configuration or content lifecycles are decoupled. Software updates of S/4HANA systems and reference content upgrades in SAP Central Business Configuration are governed by SAP with predefined schedule. Active business content updates and upgrades are deployed by SAP and scheduled for imports that can be revised by customer. The Release Navigator consolidates essential release content from SAP Product Engineering, SAP User Assistance, SAP Learning, SAP Enterprise Support and other areas of the SAP ecosystem organized by Lines of Business (LoB’s), Industries, and Cross-Topics. Built-in guided tours, created with native SAP Enable Now software, will teach you how to use various SAP tools and websites to locate content when a release comes. The following Release Navigators are available for SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition and SAP Business Technology Platform Release Navigator for SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition Release Navigator for SAP Business Technology Platform Use the accelerator Help - How to get the most of the Release Navigator for SAP BTP for useful information on the usage of Release Navigator. SAP Activate for Upgrade of SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition (3-system landscape) roadmap highlights steps before, after during an upgrade. Also reference the Automation Settings and Planned System Behavior for Lifecycle Events accelerator for transport management related details.

ExtendedAttribute.Value: Application Design and Configuration, Operations and Support, Technical Architecture & Infrastructure
2nd Wave Project / Rollout Project, GROW Adoption Plan, Upgrade

Task.Name: Evaluate New Functionality
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to evaluate new features and functions that are released. These new features and functions are deployed during upgrades and periodic updates. It is important to evaluate new features and functions for the following purposes: Determine new functions and features for implementation to meet continuously changing business needs. Fulfill delta requirements that require custom development efforts and didn't make to the project backlog. Replace custom developments with SAP standard functions to reduce implementation and maintenance efforts. Procedure: Review product road map for features and functions planned for upcoming release using SAP S/4HANA Cloud Road Map Explorer. Use What's New Viewer accelerator to review the latest features and functions that are released with updates and upgrades. Some features require activation. Refer to the Evaluate and Activate Feature from Continuous Delivery task for additional details. Others need to be deployed from SAP Central Business Configuration. Refer to task Review and Process Hotfix Collection and Prepare and Process Upgrade for business content activation details. Understand the impact of the changes to your current implementation scope by accessing the SAP S/4HANA Cloud Release Assessment and Scope Dependency accelerator via S-user ID. Check SAP S/4HANA Cloud Release Restriction accelerator to be aware of exception cases with current release. Reference Upgrade and Maintenance Schedule accelerator to find out the release time of new functionalities. Initiate planning of project to introduce new feature and function to users. Procedure Note(s): Use Valid as Of filter in What's New Viewer to select the respective release(s). Updates are indicated by a suffix like .1, .2, following major release number. For example, SAP S/4HANA Cloud 2108.1 is the first update after major release 2108. Impact analysis is based on customer's used and activated scope in Test or Production System. Reference Blog - Release Assessment and Scope Dependency posts in SAP community to see updated information with regard to the tool. For customer using SAP Cloud ALM, access Upcoming Event card or tile in the Overview app to see upcoming upgrades and use the Impact Assessment link to access the RASD from SAP Cloud ALM.

ExtendedAttribute.Value: 2nd Wave Project / Rollout Project, GROW Adoption Plan, Upgrade

Task.Name: Review and Process Hotfix Collection
Task.Notes: The purpose of the task is to review information associated with the release of hotfix collection that is deployed to all systems on the same weekend every 2 weeks in the months where no upgrade is planned. Customer should use this information to: Inform the user about the timing of a fix to a previously reported issue Allow planning of business activities around downtime Plan ongoing project tasks around systems' lock phase period before downtime Complete changes in SAP Central Business Configuration and align configuration in all SAP S/4HANA Cloud systems Procedure: Follow the steps described in Knowledge-Based Articles for Known Regression Issues accelerator to understand possible workarounds and find out the Hotfix Collection delivery date when a fix to a previously reported issue will be delivered. Review information in Upgrade and Maintenance Schedule for the latest on: Starter, Development, Test and Production system downtimes. System locks for Import and Export of transports in Development, Test and Production System locks for Configuration and Extensibility Refrain from scheduling activities into development sprints and plan around the downtime and system lock phase period. Check limitation and recommendation details (i.e transports, scope activation, etc) before and during the SAP pre-processing window in the Software Lifecycle Management accelerator. If business content is included in the Hotfix Collection: Notification message of ongoing update will appear in SAP Central Business Configuration Project Experience UI. These updates will be automatically deployed to SAP S/4HANA Cloud Starter system (if not retired) and Development system. A Transport Request is created in Customizing Tenant of the system during deployment. This Transport Request of updated content and associated Task are automatically released upon successful checks performed in the background. This Transport Request is scheduled to be imported to Test System, forwarded to Production System, and then imported to Production System. Customer can revise or suspend the default schedule for moving the transport across the landscape using Import Collection app. In case of error during deployment, SAP Cloud Operations team will be notified to address with customer. Task within the Transport Request can only be released by SAP. Additional Transport Request may be created by SAP to fix issue. Customer may need to release dependent transports and release transport request(s) related to the content updates manually. Procedure Note(s): When reference to Production system, activities are only applicable to live customer. It is recommended as a good practice to immediately deploy business content updates to all S/4HANA system each time when there is one. To view a list of corrections included in the Hotfix Collection, go to the Patch Collection Information note in the useful link section of the Upgrade and Maintenance Schedule accelerator, and download the pdf document that contains a list of affected component ID and description of corrections. Access to Business Process Configuration app from SAP Central Business Configuration is possible until SAP S/4HANA Cloud system enters down-time. Check Upgrade and Maintenance Schedule accelerator for exact timing. Organizational structure enhancements, adding new scope or country/region is possible until the content update is triggered and the project in SAP Central Business Configuration is locked. Check SAP Note - 3215993 - Software Update & Upgrade for actual project block timing. Reference Hotfix Collection Deployment Restrictions for a summary of limitations on project activities.

Task.Name: Review Reports for Release Updates
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to review the reports for any product release enhancements and/or changes as it relates to standard and custom reports. As enhancements of the solution are released or retired, the project team should verify the reports are running as expected or if there are any areas of the reports which need to be updated or modified accordingly such as new reporting features, new filtering options, and new content which can be reported on within the solution. Procedure Step(s): Review the latest release notes for the solution to ensure there is no impact to the reports which are used in the project such as features, display, filtering, tables, and data. Review all custom reports to ensure the latest product features do not impact the reports in the solution and make any adjustments as necessary to run the reports successfully. Review any errors which occur when running the reports and correct them. Once errors are corrected, test and run the report to ensure errors have been resolved. Procedure Note(s): This task should be routinely reviewed with each solution release where updates are applicable. Any reports which are running slowly can be due to many reasons including: selection from large data set, reporting errors, and/or connection errors, etc. Note errors which reports may be generating to analyze and to avoid them in the future.

Task.Name: Evaluate and Activate Feature from Continuous Delivery
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to evaluate and activate, when needed, new functionalities provided in frequent updates from SAP between major upgrades. These updates will give customers access to new capabilities in a nondisruptive manner. Continuous Delivery for S/4HANA Cloud accelerator provides an overview of this service. Some features require customer activation when initially released. Functionality which can be activated has the following characteristics: It is by default not available in the customer system landscape until it is activated in Activate Features app. Activation needs to be performed in each system, Starter (if not retired yet), Development, Test and Production system, respectively. Activation of functionality via this app is NOT reversible. Proper testing should be executed before activation in Production system. A toggle introduced in an update has a limited lifetime. In the next release or the one following, the functionality will be released for all customers. Procedure: Use the What's New Viewer accelerator to get an overview of new and updated features and functions. Understand the impact of the changes to your current implementation scope by using the SAP S/4HANA Cloud Release Assessment and Scope Dependency accelerator via S-user ID. Reference Upgrade and Maintenance Schedule accelerator to find out the release time of new features. Use "Preparation Required" filter in What's New Viewer accelerator to view feature requires preparation work from customer. Follow steps in the Help - Activate Features accelerator to switch on selected feature, when applicable. Perform activation and business configuration setting adjustments from SAP Central Business Configuration, when applicable. Test and release the new feature. Procedure Note(s): Use the "Valid as Of" filter in What's New Viewer to select the respective continuous delivery service(s). An update version is indicated by the release upgrade followed by a suffix such as .1, or .2. For example, SAP S/4HANA Cloud 2108.1 is the first update after major release 2108. Availability of feature updates can be found in the Upgrade and Maintenance Schedule with label YYMM.n, indicating continuous delivery service n for product version YYMM. Feature updates are executed the same way as Hotfix Collection technically. Reference task Review and Process Hotfix Collection for transport request behavior and process for content updates. Impact analysis is based on customer's used and activated scopes in the Test or Production System. Reference Blog - Release Assessment and Scope Dependency posts in SAP community to see updated information with regard to the tool. Customers have the option to perform regression test, if desired, by leveraging the Post Upgrade Tests from the Test Your Process app, under the Post Upgrade Test tab. To access Activate Features app, search it in tree view of Implementation Activities app in S/4HANA Cloud or Business Process Configuration app in SAP Central Business Configuration, Product-Specific Configuration phase.

ExtendedAttribute.Value: Application Design and Configuration, Operations and Support

Task.Name: Prepare and Process Upgrade
Task.Notes: The purpose of the task is to execute periodic upgrade of S/4HANA Cloud. Customer should use the specific Upgrade project in SAP Cloud ALM and tasks from SAP Activate S/4HANA Cloud Upgrade roadmap to prepare for the upgrade, complete regression testing, update business roles and business content when appropriate. It is recommended to start the preparation steps at least 2 weeks before the start of Test system upgrade. It is a best practice to have a dedicated sprint for upgrade related activities and focusing on regression testing. Procedure: Review Upgrade and Maintenance Schedule - 3 System Landscape accelerator for actual timing and Software Lifecycle Management accelerator for behind-the-scenes details. Launch and start upgrade project. Follow tasks in SAP Activate for Upgrade of S/4HANA Cloud roadmap to prepare and complete regression testing in Test System. Revise business roles immediately after the software upgrade in Production system. See task in upgrade roadmap for more details. Plan and execute the business content upgrade with regression testing before the next major release. See task in upgrade roadmap for more details. Procedure Note(s): To access the upgrade roadmap from SAP Activate Roadmap Viewer main page, go to Explore All Roadmaps and select the Upgrade Methodology tab. For customer who uses SAP Cloud ALM, select ‘SAP S/4HANA Cloud 3-system landscape - Upgrade task template' when setting up project in Projects and Setup app. For customer who has an existing ERP system and adopting a Two-Tier enterprise resource planning (ERP) strategy for the S/4HANA Cloud implementation, it is important to notify users running the existing ERP system with regard to the downtime and plan business and project activities accordingly.

ExtendedAttribute.Value: 2nd Wave Project / Rollout Project, Hybrid Deployment (Two-Tier ERP), Upgrade

Task.Name: Value Management
Task.Notes: The purpose of the deliverable is to ensure the customer plans for long-term value management strategy. Review previous recommendations to determine if the benefits have been realized and what further opportunities should be fed back into the continuous learning phase. This would help in ensuring expected benefits are realized in the long term, and that any gaps which might develop are addressed.

ExtendedAttribute.Value: 2nd Wave Project / Rollout Project, GROW Adoption Plan

Task.Name: Perform Benchmarking Assessment for Value Realization Comparison
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to re-evaluate the business process benchmarking collaboratively with Line of Business heads. This exercise helps to understand the benefits realized on the process maturity and the key performance indicators after the implementation of SAP S/4HANA Cloud by comparing the results taken during the Discover phase. The SAP S/4HANA Benchmarking Assessment includes key business performance metrics and best practices for all process areas covered by SAP S/4HANA, such as: Procurement, Sales, Service, R&D Engineering, Supply Chain, Manufacturing, Asset Management, Finance, Human Resources, and Information Technology. Upon participation, you will receive a personalized scorecard in real-time showcasing the Key Performance Indicator (KPI) analysis and process maturity gap on best practices in comparison to industry peers. Prerequisites: The SAP S/4HANA Cloud Benchmarking Assessment was performed during the Discover phase or before the go-live of the SAP S/4HANA Cloud solution to establish a baseline of the business processes. Procedure: Fill out the SAP S/4HANA Benchmarking Assessment. Review the SAP S/4HANA Cloud Benchmarking Assessment – Overview accelerator for further step by step information on how to fill out the assessment. Download the results and compare the results from the baseline assessment to determine the value realized. Leverage continuous benchmarking tools and scorecards for on-going value realization efforts. Procedure Note(s): For any questions about the SAP S/4HANA Benchmarking Assessment or SAP’s Performance Benchmarking Program, please contact valuemanagement@sap.com.

ExtendedAttribute.Value: 2nd Wave Project / Rollout Project, GROW Adoption Plan

Task.Name: Assess Solution Performance
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to periodically deliver a Solution Performance survey to the end users, so that their feedback can drive improvements in solution usability, stability, speed, support, compatibility etc. The results will offer important insight into how the solution can be improved, throughout the Run phase. Prerequisites: The solution is live for customer end-users. Procedure: Review the recommendations of the ‘Solution Performance’ section of the XM Transformation Procedures accelerator. Identify the survey and reporting recipient groups, listed in the above section of the accelerator, and inform them they are participating in the XM transformation program. Provide these groups (especially report recipients) with enablement on how to use the Readiness for UAT survey and/or interpret the reporting results. Go to the ‘Survey Q’ tab of the XM Transformation Survey Questions accelerator and locate the survey questions, by filtering on the ‘Solution Performance’ column. Adapt the survey to the current transformation, finalize and publish. Distribute the Solution Performance survey. Once the survey response collection period is over, finalize the dashboard and use it to communicate the feedback to report recipients, with follow-up meetings to discuss the findings and recommending corrective measures accordingly. Procedure Note(s): If the process is unclear, engage with the XM Advisory experts from your XM vendor, SAP or implementation partner for assistance. If the customer prefers, and has the technology, they can set up the Solution Performance survey as a continuous feedback tab inside the solution, rather than ask end users to answer a periodic survey.

ExtendedAttribute.Value: 2nd Wave Project / Rollout Project, XM Transformation

Task.Name: Monitor Functional Usage Adoption and Consumption
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to monitor the customer’s adoption and consumption based on functional usage data, enabling them to make informed decisions according to their own usage patterns. Procedure: Login in to SAP for Me using your S-user. Navigate to Usage Dashboard using the Usage Dashboard accelerator. Review the Blog - Customer Usage Dashboard 2nd Edition for SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition for more information on what's new. Procedure Note(s): In the usage dashboard for SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition, we provide the following usage data: Monthly Active Users: This table displays the number of active versus valid users over the past 12 months. Valid users are business users with assigned business content and are license–relevant who may not log into the system, while active users have logged in at least once during a given month. Most Used Apps: This table shows the full list of applications used by your organization over the past 12 months. You can select any monthly interval from the past 12 months to see how many times each application was started by the end-users within that period. Feature Usage (Scope Item Usage): This table shows the usage of scope items (referred to as a “Feature“ on SAP for Me) for your SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition. This table includes: Feature Name: Clicking on the name navigates you to the Accel ID = S4H_2087. DDA Status: Displays whether the scope items identified during the sales cycle using the Digital Discovery Assessment (DDA) tool were “selected” or “not selected.” Activation Status: Shows the activation status of the scope item. L6M & L12M Usage Status: Indicates the usage status of the corresponding scope items over the last 6 months (L6M) and last 12 months (L12M)> The data is pre-filtered to show activated and used scope items first. You can also filter by activation status to find active or inactive scope items, and by usage status to see if the scope items have been used within the last 6 or 12 months. Publish Date: May 2024
